name: apex_application.stop_apex_engine
bodyFullText: APEX_APPLICATION.STOP_APEX_ENGINE
descriptionText: This procedure signals the Application Express engine to stop further processing and immediately exit to avoid adding additional HTML code to the HTTP buffer.

name: apex_application_install.clear_all
bodyFullText: APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL.CLEAR_ALL;
descriptionText: This procedure clears all values currently maintained in the APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL package.

name: apex_application_install.generate_application_id
bodyFullText: APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL.GENERATE_APPLICATION_ID;
descriptionText: This procedure generates an available application ID on the instance and sets the application ID in APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL.

name: apex_application_install.generate_offset
bodyFullText: APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL.GENERATE_OFFSET;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the offset value used during application import. Use the offset value to ensure that the metadata for the Application Express application definition does not collide with other metadata on the instance. For a new application installation, it is usually sufficient to call this procedure to have Application Express generate this offset value for you.

name: apex_application_install.get_application_alias
bodyFullText:
APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL.GET_APPLICATION_ALIAS
RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function gets the application alias for the application to be imported. This is only used if the application to be imported has an alias specified. An application alias must be unique within a workspace and it is recommended to be unique within an instance.

name: apex_application_install.get_application_id
bodyFullText:
APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL.GET_APPLICATION_ID
RETURN NUMBER;
descriptionText: Use this function to get the application ID of the application to be imported. The application ID should either not exist in the instance or, if it does exist, must be in the workspace where the application is being imported to.

name: apex_application_install.get_application_name
bodyFullText:
APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL.GET_APPLICATION_NAME
RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function gets the application name of the import application.

name: apex_application_install.get_auto_install_sup_obj
bodyFullText:
APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL.GET_AUTO_INSTALL_SUP_OBJ
RETURN BOOLEAN;
descriptionText: Use this function to get the automatic install of supporting objects setting used during the import of an application. This setting is valid only for command line installs. If the setting is set to TRUE and the application export contains supporting objects, it automatically installs or upgrades the supporting objects when an application imports from the command line.

name: apex_application_install.get_image_prefix
bodyFullText:
APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL.GET_IMAGE_PREFIX
RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function gets the image prefix of the import application. Most Application Express instances use the default image prefix of /i/.

name: apex_application_install.get_keep_sessions
bodyFullText:
get_keep_sessions
    return boolean
descriptionText: This function finds out if sessions and session state will be preserved or deleted on upgrades.

name: apex_application_install.get_offset
bodyFullText:
APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL.GET_OFFSET
RETURN NUMBER;
descriptionText: Use function to get the offset value used during the import of an application.

name: apex_application_install.get_proxy
bodyFullText:
APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL.GET_PROXY
RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: Use this function to get the proxy server attribute of an application to be imported.

name: apex_application_install.get_schema
bodyFullText:
APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL.GET_SCHEMA
RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: Use this function to get the parsing schema ("owner") of the Application Express application.

name: apex_application_install.get_workspace_id
bodyFullText:
APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL.GET_WORKSPACE_ID
RETURN NUMBER;
descriptionText: Use this function to get the workspace ID for the application to be imported.

name: apex_application_install.set_application_alias
bodyFullText:
APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL.SET_APPLICATION_ALIAS(
    p_application_alias IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure sets the application alias for the application to be imported. This is only used if the application to be imported has an alias specified. An application alias must be unique within a workspace and it is recommended to be unique within an instance.

name: apex_application_install.set_application_id
bodyFullText:
APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL.SET_APPLICATION_ID (
    p_application_id IN NUMBER);
descriptionText: Use this procedure to set the application ID of the application to be imported. The application ID should either not exist in the instance or, if it does exist, must be in the workspace where the application is being imported to. This number must be a positive integer and must not be from the reserved range of Application Express application IDs.

name: apex_application_install.set_application_name
bodyFullText:
APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL.SET_APPLICATION_NAME;(
    p_application_name  IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure sets the application name of the import application.

name: apex_application_install.set_auto_install_sup_obj
bodyFullText:
APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL.SET_AUTO_INSTALL_SUP_OBJ(
    p_auto_install_sup_obj IN BOOLEAN);
descriptionText: This procedure sets the automatic install of supporting objects value used during application import. This setting is valid only for command line installs. If the value is set to TRUE and the application export contains supporting objects, it automatically installs or upgrades the supporting objects when an application imports from the command line.

name: apex_application_install.set_image_prefix
bodyFullText:
APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL.SET_IMAGE_PREFIX(
    p_image_prefix  IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure sets the image prefix of the import application. Most Application Express instances use the default image prefix of /i/.

name: apex_application_install.set_keep_sessions
bodyFullText:
set_keep_sessions (
    p_keep_sessions in boolean );
descriptionText: This procedure preserves sessions associated with the application on upgrades.

name: apex_application_install.set_offset
bodyFullText:
APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL.SET_OFFSET(
    p_offset IN NUMBER);
descriptionText: This procedure sets the offset value used during application import. Use the offset value to ensure that the metadata for the Application Express application definition does not collide with other metadata on the instance. For a new application installation, it is usually sufficient to call the generate_offset procedure to have Application Express generate this offset value for you.

name: apex_application_install.set_proxy
bodyFullText:
APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL.SET_PROXY (
    p_proxy IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: Use this procedure to set the proxy server attributes of an application to be imported.

name: apex_application_install.set_schema
bodyFullText:
APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL.SET_SCHEMA (
    p_schema  IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: Use this function to set the parsing schema ("owner") of the Application Express application. The database user of this schema must already exist, and this schema name must already be mapped to the workspace used to import the application.

name: apex_application_install.set_workspace
bodyFullText:
set_workspace (
   p_workspace in varchar2 );
descriptionText: This function is used to set the workspace ID for the application to be imported.

name: apex_application_install.set_workspace_id
bodyFullText:
APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL.SET_WORKSPACE_ID (
    p_workspace_id  IN NUMBER);
descriptionText: Use this function to set the workspace ID for the application to be imported.

name: apex_authentication.get_login_username_cookie
descriptionText: This function reads the cookie with the username from the default login page.

name: apex_authentication.is_authenticated
bodyFullText:
APEX_AUTHENTICATION.IS_AUTHENTICATED
    RETURN BOOLEAN;
descriptionText: This function checks if the user is authenticated in the session and returns TRUE if the user is already logged in or FALSE if the user of the current session is not yet authenticated.

name: apex_authentication.is_public_user
bodyFullText:
APEX_AUTHENTICATION.IS_PUBLIC_USER
    return BOLLEAN;
descriptionText: This function checks if the user is not authenticated in the session. A FALSE is returned if the user is already logged on or TRUE if the user of the current session is not yet authenticated.

name: apex_authentication.login
bodyFullText:
APEX_AUTHENTICATION.LOGIN ( 
    p_username IN VARCHAR2, 
    p_password IN VARCHAR2, 
    p_uppercase_username IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE );
descriptionText: This procedure authenticates the user in the current session.

name: apex_authentication.logout
bodyFullText:
APEX_AUTHENTICATION.LOGOUT ( 
    p_session_id in number, 
    p_app_id in number, 
    p_ws_app_id in number default null );
descriptionText: This procedure closes the session and redirects to the applicatio\'s home page. Call this procedure directly from the browser.

name: apex_authentication.post_login
bodyFullText:
APEX_AUTHENTICATION.POST_LOGIN ( 
    p_username IN VARCHAR2, 
    p_password IN VARCHAR2, 
    p_uppercase_username IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE );
descriptionText: This procedure authenticates the user in the current session. It runs a subset of login(), without steps 1 and 2. For steps, see "LOGIN Procedure." It is primarily useful in authentication schemes where user credentials checking is done externally to Application Express.

name: apex_authentication.send_login_username_cookie
descriptionText: This procedure sends a cookie with the username.

name: apex_authorization.enable_dynamic_groups
bodyFullText:
APEX_AUTHORIZATION.ENABLE_DYNAMIC_GROUPS (
    p_group_names IN apex_t_varchar2 );
descriptionText: This procedure enables groups in the current session. These groups do not have to be created in the Application Express workspace repository, but can, for example, be loaded from a LDAP repository. Enabling a group that exists in the workspace repository and has other groups granted to it, also enables the granted groups.

name: apex_authorization.is_authorized
descriptionText: Determine if the current user passes the authorization with name p_authorization_name. For performance reasons, authorization results are cached. Because of this, the function may not always evaluate the authorization when called, but take the result out of the cache.

name: apex_authorization.reset_cache
bodyFullText: APEX_AUTHORIZATION.RESET_CACHE;
descriptionText: This procedure resets the authorization caches for the session and forces a re-evaluation when an authorization is checked next.

name: apex_collection.add_member
body:
p_collection_name => $1
	, p_c001 => null
	...
	, p_c050 => null
	, p_n001 => null
	, p_n002 => null
	, p_n003 => null
	, p_n004 => null
	, p_n005 => null
	, p_d001 => null
	, p_d002 => null
	, p_d003 => null
	, p_d004 => null
	, p_d005 => null
	, p_clob001 => empty_clob()
	, p_blob001 => empty_blob()
	, p_xmltype001 => null
	, p_generate_md5 => 'NO'
bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.ADD_MEMBER (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2,
    p_c001 IN VARCHAR2 default null,
    ...
    p_c050 IN VARCHAR2 default null,
    p_n001 IN NUMBER default null,
    p_n002 IN NUMBER default null,
    p_n003 IN NUMBER default null,
    p_n004 IN NUMBER default null,
    p_n005 IN NUMBER default null,
    p_d001 IN DATE default null,
    p_d002 IN DATE default null,
    p_d003 IN DATE default null,
    p_d004 IN DATE default null,
    p_d005 IN DATE default null,
    p_clob001 IN CLOB default empty_clob(),
    p_blob001 IN BLOB default empty_blob(),
    p_xmltype001 IN XMLTYPE default null,
    p_generate_md5 IN VARCHAR2  default 'NO');
descriptionText: Use this procedure to add a new member to an existing collection. An error is raised if the specified collection does not exist for the current user in the same session for the current Application ID. Gaps are not used when adding a new member, so an existing collection with members of sequence IDs (1,2,5,8) adds the new member with a sequence ID of 9.

name: apex_collection.add_members
body:
p_collection_name => $1
	, p_c001 => empty_vc_arr
	, p_c002 => empty_vc_arr
	, p_c003 => empty_vc_arr
	...
	, p_c050 => empty_vc_arr
	, p_n001 => empty_n_arr
	, p_n002 => empty_n_arr
	, p_n003 => empty_n_arr
	, p_n004 => empty_n_arr
	, p_n005 => empty_n_arr
	, p_d001 => empty_d_arr
	, p_d002 => empty_d_arr
	, p_d003 => empty_d_arr
	, p_d004 => empty_d_arr
	, p_d005 => empty_d_arr
	, p_generate_md5 => 'NO'
bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.ADD_MEMBERS (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2,
    p_c001 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.VC_ARR2 default empty_vc_arr,
    p_c002 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.VC_ARR2 default empty_vc_arr,
    p_c003 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.VC_ARR2 default empty_vc_arr,
    ...
    p_c050 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.VC_ARR2 default empty_vc_arr,
    p_n001 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.N_ARR default empty_n_arr,
    p_n002 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.N_ARR default empty_n_arr,
    p_n003 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.N_ARR default empty_n_arr,
    p_n004 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.N_ARR default empty_n_arr,
    p_n005 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.N_ARR default empty_n_arr,
    p_d001 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.D_ARR default empty_d_arr,
    p_d002 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.D_ARR default empty_d_arr,
    p_d003 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.D_ARR default empty_d_arr,
    p_d004 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.D_ARR default empty_d_arr,
    p_d005 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.D_ARR default empty_d_arr,
    p_generate_md5 IN VARCHAR2 default 'NO');
descriptionText: Use this procedure to add an array of members to a collection. An error is raised if the specified collection does not exist for the current user in the same session for the current Application ID. Gaps are not used when adding a new member, so an existing collection with members of sequence IDs (1,2,5,8) adds the new member with a sequence ID of 9. The count of elements in the p_c001 PL/SQL table is used as the total number of items across all PL/SQL tables. For example, if p_c001.count is 2 and p_c002.count is 10, only 2 members are added. If p_c001 is null an application error is raised.

name: apex_collection.collection_exists
descriptionText: Use this function to determine if a collection exists. A TRUE is returned if the specified collection exists for the current user in the current session for the current Application ID, otherwise FALSE is returned.

name: apex_collection.collection_has_changed
descriptionText: Use this function to determine if a collection has changed since it was created or the collection changed flag was reset.

name: apex_collection.collection_member_count
descriptionText: Use this function to get the total number of members for the named collection. If gaps exist, the total member count returned is not equal to the highest sequence ID in the collection. If the named collection does not exist for the current user in the current session, an error is raised.

name: apex_collection.create_collection
bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.CREATE_COLLECTION(
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: Use this procedure to create an empty collection that does not already exist. If a collection exists with the same name for the current user in the same session for the current Application ID, an application error is raised.

name: apex_collection.create_collection_from_query
bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.CREATE_COLLECTION_FROM_QUERY (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2,
    p_query IN VARCHAR2,
    p_generate_md5 IN VARCHAR2 default 'NO');
descriptionText: Use this procedure to create a collection from a supplied query. The query is parsed as the application owner. This method can be used with a query with up to 50 columns in the SELECT clause. These columns in the SELECT clause populates the 50 character attributes of the collection (C001 through C050). If a collection exists with the same name for the current user in the same session for the current Application ID, an application error is raised.

name: apex_collection.create_collection_from_query2
bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.CREATE_COLLECTION_FROM_QUERY2 (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2,
    p_query IN VARCHAR2,
    p_generate_md5 IN VARCHAR2 default 'NO');
descriptionText: Use this procedure to create a collection from a supplied query. This method is identical to CREATE_COLLECTION_FROM_QUERY, however, the first 5 columns of the SELECT clause must be numeric and the next 5 must be date. After the numeric and date columns, there can be up to 50 character columns in the SELECT clause. The query is parsed as the application owner. If a collection exists with the same name for the current user in the same session for the current Application ID, an application error is raised.

name: apex_collection.create_collection_from_query_b
body:
p_collection_name => $1
	, p_query => $2
	, p_names => $3
	, p_values => $4
	, p_max_row_count => null
bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.CREATE_COLLECTION_FROM_QUERY_B (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2,
    p_query IN VARCHAR2,
    p_names IN apex_application_global.vc_arr2,
    p_values IN apex_application_global.vc_arr2,
    p_max_row_count IN NUMBER DEFAULT null);
descriptionText: Use this procedure to create a collection from a supplied query using bulk operations. This method offers significantly faster performance than the CREATE_COLLECTION_FROM_QUERY method. The query is parsed as the application owner. If a collection exists with the same name for the current user in the same session for the current Application ID, an application error is raised.

name: apex_collection.create_collection_from_queryb2
body:
p_collection_name => $1
	, p_query => $2
	, p_names => $3
	, p_values => $4
	, p_max_row_count => null
bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.CREATE_COLLECTION_FROM_QUERYB2 (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2,
    p_query IN VARCHAR2,
    p_names IN apex_application_global.vc_arr2,
    p_values IN apex_application_global.vc_arr2,
    p_max_row_count IN NUMBER DEFAULT null);
descriptionText: Use this procedure to create a collection from a supplied query using bulk operations. This method offers significantly faster performance than the CREATE_COLLECTION_FROM_QUERY_2 method. The query is parsed as the application owner. If a collection exists with the same name for the current user in the same session for the current Application ID, an application error is raised. It is identical to the CREATE_COLLECTION_FROM_QUERY_B, however, the first five columns of the SELECT clause must be numeric and the next five columns must be date. After the date columns, there can be up to 50 character columns in the SELECT clause

name: apex_collection.create_or_truncate_collection
bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.CREATE_OR_TRUNCATE_COLLECTION(
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: Use this procedure to create a collection. If a collection exists with the same name for the current user in the same session for the current Application ID, all members of the collection are removed. In other words, the named collection is truncated.

name: apex_collection.delete_all_collections
bodyFullText: APEX_COLLECTION.DELETE_ALL_COLLECTIONS;
descriptionText: Use this procedure to delete all collections that belong to the current user in the current Application Express session for the current Application ID.

name: apex_collection.delete_all_collections_session
bodyFullText: APEX_COLLECTION.DELETE_ALL_COLLECTIONS_SESSION;
descriptionText: Use this procedure to delete all collections that belong to the current user in the current Application Express session regardless of the Application ID.

name: apex_collection.delete_collection
bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.DELETE_COLLECTION (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: Use this procedure to delete a named collection. All members that belong to the collection are removed and the named collection is dropped. If the named collection does not exist for the same user in the current session for the current Application ID, an application error is raised.

name: apex_collection.delete_member
descriptionText: Use this procedure to delete a specified member from a given named collection. If the named collection does not exist for the same user in the current session for the current Application ID, an application error is raised.

name: apex_collection.delete_members
bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.DELETE_MEMBERS (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2,
    p_attr_number IN VARCHAR2,
    p_attr_value IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: Use this procedure to delete all members from a given named collection where the attribute specified by the attribute number equals the supplied value. If the named collection does not exist for the same user in the current session for the current Application ID, an application error is raised. If the attribute number specified is invalid or outside the range of 1 to 50, an error is raised.

name: apex_collection.get_member_md5
bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.GET_MEMBER_MD5 (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2,
    p_seq IN NUMBER)
RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: Use this function to compute and return the message digest of the attributes for the member specified by the sequence ID. This computation of message digest is equal to the computation performed natively by collections. Thus, the result of this function could be compared to the MD5_ORIGINAL column of the view apex_collections.

name: apex_collection.merge_members
body:
p_collection_name => $1
	, p_seq => empty_vc_arr
	, p_c001 => empty_vc_arr
	, p_c002 => empty_vc_arr
	, p_c003 => empty_vc_arr
	...
	, p_c050 => empty_vc_arr
	, p_null_index => 1
	, p_null_value => null
	, p_init_query => null
bodyNoDefault:
p_collection_name => $1
	, p_seq => $2
	, p_c001 => $3
	, p_c002 => $4
	, p_c003 => $5
	...
	, p_c050 => $6
	, p_null_index => $7
	, p_null_value => $8
	, p_init_query => $9
bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.MERGE_MEMBERS (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2,
    p_seq  IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.VC_ARR2 DEFAULT empty_vc_arr,
    p_c001 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.VC_ARR2 DEFAULT empty_vc_arr,
    p_c002 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.VC_ARR2 DEFAULT empty_vc_arr,
    p_c003 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.VC_ARR2 DEFAULT empty_vc_arr,
    ...
    p_c050 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.VC_ARR2 DEFAULT empty_vc_arr,
    p_null_index  IN NUMBER DEFAULT 1,
    p_null_value  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT null,
    p_init_query  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT null);
descriptionText: Use this procedure to merge members of the given named collection with the values passed in the arrays. If the named collection does not exist one is created. If a p_init_query is provided, the collection is created from the supplied SQL query. If the named collection exists, the following occurs:

name: apex_collection.move_member_down
descriptionText: Use this procedure to adjust the sequence ID of specified member in the given named collection down by one (subtract one), swapping sequence ID with the one it is replacing. For example, 3 becomes 2 and 2 becomes 3. If a collection does not exist with the specified name for the current user in the same session and for the current Application ID, an application error is raised. If the member specified by sequence ID p_seq does not exist, an application error is raised. If the member specified by sequence ID p_seq is the lowest sequence in the collection, an application error is NOT returned.

name: apex_collection.move_member_up
descriptionText: Use this procedure to adjust the sequence ID of specified member in the given named collection up by one (add one), swapping sequence ID with the one it is replacing. For example, 2 becomes 3 and 3 becomes 2. If a collection does not exist with the specified name for the current user in the same session and for the current Application ID, an application error is raised. If the member specified by sequence ID p_seq does not exist, an application error is raised. If the member specified by sequence ID p_seq is the highest sequence in the collection, an application error is not returned.

name: apex_collection.resequence_collection
bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.RESEQUENCE_COLLECTION (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: For a named collection, use this procedure to update the seq_id value of each member so that no gaps exist in the sequencing. For example, a collection with the following set of sequence IDs (1,2,3,5,8,9) becomes (1,2,3,4,5,6). If a collection does not exist with the specified name for the current user in the same session and for the current Application ID, an application error is raised.

name: apex_collection.reset_collection_changed
bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.RESET_COLLECTION_CHANGED (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: Use this procedure to reset the collection changed flag (mark as not changed) for a given collection. If a collection does not exist with the specified name for the current user in the same session and for the current Application ID, an application error is raised.

name: apex_collection.reset_collection_changed_all
bodyFullText: APEX_COLLECTION.RESET_COLLECTION_CHANGED_ALL; (
descriptionText: Use this procedure to reset the collection changed flag (mark as not changed) for all collections in the use\'s current session.

name: apex_collection.sort_members
descriptionText: Use this procedure to reorder the members of a given collection by the column number specified by p_sort_on_column_number. This sorts the collection by a particular column/attribute in the collection and reassigns the sequence IDs of each number such that no gaps exist. If a collection does not exist with the specified name for the current user in the same session and for the current Application ID, an application error is raised.

name: apex_collection.truncate_collection
bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.TRUNCATE_COLLECTION (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: Use this procedure to remove all members from a named collection. If a collection does not exist with the specified name for the current user in the same session and for the current Application ID, an application error is raised.

name: apex_collection.update_member
body:
p_collection_name => $1
	, p_seq => NULL
	, p_c001 => NULL
	, p_c002 => NULL
	, p_c003 => NULL
	...
	, p_c050 => NULL
	, p_n001 => NULL
	, p_n002 => NULL
	, p_n003 => NULL
	, p_n004 => NULL
	, p_n005 => NULL
	, p_d001 => NULL
	, p_d002 => NULL
	, p_d003 => NULL
	, p_d004 => NULL
	, p_d005 => NULL
	, p_clob001 => empty_clob()
	, p_blob001 => empty-blob()
	, p_xmltype001 => NULL
bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.UPDATE_MEMBER (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2,
    p_seq  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_c001 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_c002 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_c003 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    ...
    p_c050 IN VARCHAR DEFAULT NULL,
    p_n001 IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
    p_n002 IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
    p_n003 IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
    p_n004 IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
    p_n005 IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
    p_d001 IN DATE DEFAULT NULL,
    p_d002 IN DATE DEFAULT NULL,
    p_d003 IN DATE DEFAULT NULL,
    p_d004 IN DATE DEFAULT NULL,
    p_d005 IN DATE DEFAULT NULL,   
    p_clob001 IN CLOB DEFAULT empty_clob(),
    p_blob001 IN BLOB DEFAULT empty-blob(),
    p_xmltype001 IN XMLTYPE DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: Use this procedure to update the specified member in the given named collection. If a collection does not exist with the specified name for the current user in the same session and for the current Application ID, an application error is raised. If the member specified by sequence ID p_seq does not exist, an application error is raised.

name: apex_collection.update_member_attribute
bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.UPDATE_MEMBER_ATTRIBUTE (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2,
    p_seq IN NUMBER,
    p_attr_number IN NUMBER,
    p_attr_value  IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: Update the specified member attribute in the given named collection. If a collection does not exist with the specified name for the current user in the same session for the current Application ID, an application error is raised. If the member specified by sequence ID p_seq does not exist, an application error is raised. If the attribute number specified is invalid or outside the range 1-50, an error is raised. Any attribute value exceeding 4,000 bytes are truncated to 4,000 bytes.

	, p_seq => empty_vc_arr

	...

	, p_n001 => empty_n_arr

	, p_d002 => empty_d_arr

bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.UPDATE_MEMBERS (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2,

    ...

    p_n002 IN apex_application_global.N_ARR DEFAULT empty_n_arr,

    p_d001 IN apex_application_global.D_ARR DEFAULT empty_d_arr,
    p_d002 IN apex_application_global.D_ARR DEFAULT empty_d_arr,
    p_d003 IN apex_application_global.D_ARR DEFAULT empty_d_arr,
    p_d004 IN apex_application_global.D_ARR DEFAULT empty_d_arr,
    p_d005 IN apex_application_global.D_ARR DEFAULT empty_d_arr)
descriptionText: Use this procedure to update the array of members for the given named collection. If a collection does not exist with the specified name for the current user in the same session and for the current Application ID, an application error is raised. The count of elements in the p_seq PL/SQL table is used as the total number of items across all PL/SQL tables. That is, if p_seq.count = 2 and p_c001.count = 10, only 2 members are updaapex_application_globalted. If p_seq is null, an application error is raised. If the member specified by sequence ID p_seq does not exist, an application error is raised.

name: apex_debug.disable

    p_level    IN  T_LOG_LEVEL DEFAULT C_LOG_LEVEL_INFO );

name: apex_debug.enable_dbms_output
bodyFullText:
enable_dbms_output (
    p_prefix in varchar2 default '# APEX|' );
descriptionText: This procedure writes all debug logs via dbms_output. If debug is disabled, this call also enables it with log level c_log_level_warn. You have to set a debug level higher than c_log_level_warn for finer grained debug output. The output 95 starts with a configurable prefix, followed by the log level, "|" and the actual debug message.

    p_display_location in varchar2 );
descriptionText: This procedure adds an error message to the error stack that is used to display an error on an error page or inline in a notification. It can be called in a validation or process to add one or more errors to the error stack.

name: apex_error.auto_set_associated_item
descriptionText: This procedure automatically sets the associated page item or tabular form column based on a constraint contained in p_error.ora_sqlerrm.This procedure performs the following:

name: apex_error.extract_constraint_name

APEX_ERROR.EXTRACT_CONSTRAINT_NAME (
    p_error          in t_error,
    p_include_schema in boolean default false )
    return varchar2;
descriptionText: This function extracts a constraint name contained in p_error.ora_sqlerrm. The constraint must match the pattern schema.constraint.

name: apex_error.get_aria_error_attributes
descriptionText: This function is useful for item plug-in developers, to enhance screen reader usability of your item, specifically when that item is associated with an error on a page. This function is called as part of rendering of the item, where the main form element(s) are output. The returned WAI-ARIA attributes include:

name: apex_error.get_first_ora_error_text
bodyFullText:
APEX_ERROR.GET_FIRST_ORA_ERROR_TEXT (
    p_error            in t_error,
    p_include_error_no in boolean default false )
    return varchar2;
descriptionText: This function returns the first ORA error message text stored in p_error.ora_sqlerrm. If p_error_ora_sqlerrm does not contain a value, NULL is returned.

name: apex_error.init_error_result
descriptionText: This function returns the t_error_result type initialized with the values stored in p_error.

name: apex_escape.html
descriptionText: This function escapes characters which can change the context in an html environment. It is an extended version of the well-known sys.htf.escape_sc.

name: apex_escape.html_attribute
descriptionText: Use this function to escape the values of html entity attributes. It hex escapes everything that is not alphanumeric or in one of the following characters\'\'\'\'\'\'\'\' .

name: apex_escape.html_trunc
bodyFullText:
APEX_ESCAPE.HTML_TRUNC (
    p_string IN CLOB,
    p_length IN NUMBER DEFAULT 4000 )
    return VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: The HTML_TRUNC function escapes html and limits the returned string to p_length bytes. This function returns the first p_length bytes of an input clob and escapes them. You can use this function if the input clob might be too large to fit in a varchar2 variable and it is sufficient to only display the first part of it.

name: apex_escape.html_whitelist
bodyFullText:
APEX_ESCAPE.HTML_WHITELIST (
    p_html IN VARCHAR2,
    p_whitelist_tags IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT c_html_whitelist_tags )
    return VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: The HTML_WHITELIST function performs HTML escape on all characters in the input text except the specified whitelist tags. This function can be useful if the input text contains simple html markup but a developer wants to ensure that an attacker cannot use malicious tags for cross-site scripting.

name: apex_escape.js_literal
bodyFullText:
APEX_ESCAPE.JS_LITERAL (
    p_string IN VARCHAR2,
    p_quote  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT '''' )
    return VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: The JS_LITERAL function escapes and optionally enquotes a javascript string. This function replaces non-immune characters with\\HH or\\HHHH equivalents. The result can be injected into javascript code, within <script> tags or inline ("javascript:xxx"). Immune characters include a through z, A through Z, 0 through 9, commas ",", periods "." and underscores "_" if the output should not be enclosed in quotes when the parameter p_quote is null. If p_quote has a value, printable ASCII 7 characters except for & < > "\' ` /\\% are not escaped.

name: apex_escape.json
descriptionText: This function returns p_string with all special characters escaped.

name: apex_escape.ldap_dn
bodyFullText:
APEX_ESCAPE.LDAP_DN (
    p_string IN VARCHAR2,
    p_reserved_chars IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT c_ldap_dn_reserved_chars,
    p_escaped_non_ascii IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE )
    return VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: The LDAP_DN function escapes reserved characters in an LDAP distinguished name, according to RFC 4514. The RFC describes "+,;<=\\as reserved characters (see p_reserved_chars). These are escaped by a backslash, for example, " becomes\\. Non-printable characters, ascii 0 - 31, and ones with a code > 127 (see p_escape_non_ascii) are escaped as\\x, where xx is the hexadecimal character code. The space character at the beginning or end of the string and a # at the beginning is also escaped with a backslash.

name: apex_escape.ldap_search_filter
bodyFullText:
APEX_ESCAPE.LDAP_SEARCH_FILTER (
    p_string              IN VARCHAR2,
    p_reserved_chars    IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT c_ldap_search_reserved_chars,
    p_escape_non_ascii IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE )
    return VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: The LDAP_SEARCH_FILTER function escapes reserved characters in an LDAP search filter, according to RFC 4515. The RFC describes *(\\ as reserved characters (see p_reserved_chars). These, non-printable characters (ascii 0 - 31) and ones with a code > 127 (see p_escape_non_ascii) are escaped as\\x, where xx is the hexadecimal character code.

name: apex_escape.noop
descriptionText: Return p_string unchanged. Use this function to silence automatic injection detection tests, similar to dbms_assert.noop for SQL injection.

name: apex_escape.regexp
bodyFullText:
APEX_ESCAPE.REGEXP (
    p_string IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This function escapes characters that can change the context in a regular expression. It should be used to secure user input. The following list depicts ascii characters that the function escapes with a backslash \\:

name: apex_escape.set_html_escaping_mode
bodyFullText:
APEX_ESCAPE.SET_HTML_ESCAPING_MODE (
    p_mode IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: The SET_HTML_ESCAPING_MODE procedure configures HTML escaping mode for apex_escape.html.

To reserve application IDs for a given workspace, see "RESERVE_WORKSPACE_APP_IDS Procedure."

name: apex_lang.create_language_mapping
bodyFullText:
APEX_LANG.CREATE_LANGUAGE_MAPPING (
  p_application_id IN NUMBER,
  p_language IN VARCHAR2,
  p_translation_application_id IN NUMBER )
descriptionText: Use this procedure to create the language mapping for the translation of an application. Translated applications are published as new applications, but are not directly editable in the App Builder.

name: apex_lang.delete_language_mapping
bodyFullText:
APEX_LANG.DELETE_LANGUAGE_MAPPING (
  p_application_id IN NUMBER,
  p_language IN VARCHAR2 )
descriptionText: Use this procedure to delete the language mapping for the translation of an application. This procedure deletes all translated strings in the translation repository for the specified language and mapping. Translated applications are published as new applications, but are not directly editable in the App Builder.

descriptionText: Use this function to translate text strings (or messages) generated from PL/SQL stored procedures, functions, triggers, packaged procedures, and functions.

name: apex_lang.publish_application
bodyFullText:
APEX_LANG.PUBLISH_APPLICATION (
  p_application_id IN NUMBER,
  p_language IN VARCHAR2 )
descriptionText: Use this procedure to publish the translated version of an application. This procedure creates an underlying, hidden replica of the primary application and merges the strings from the translation repository in this new application. Perform a seed and publish process each time you want to update the translated version of your application and synchronize it with the primary application.

name: apex_lang.seed_translations
bodyFullText:
APEX_LANG.SEED_TRANSLATIONS (
  p_application_id IN NUMBER,
  p_language IN VARCHAR2 )
descriptionText: Use this procedure to seed the translation repository for the specified application and language. This procedure populates the translation repository with all of the new, updated and removed translatable strings from your application. Perform a seed and publish process each time you want to update the translated version of your application and synchronize it with the primary application.

name: apex_lang.update_language_mapping
bodyFullText:
APEX_LANG.UPDATE_LANGUAGE_MAPPING (
  p_application_id IN NUMBER,
  p_language IN VARCHAR2,
  p_new_trans_application_id IN NUMBER )
descriptionText: Use this procedure to update the language mapping for the translation of an application. Translated applications are published as new applications, but are not directly editable in the App Builder.

name: apex_lang.update_message
bodyFullText:
APEX_LANG.UPDATE_MESSAGE (
  p_id IN NUMBER,
  p_message_text IN VARCHAR2 )
descriptionText: Use this procedure to update a translatable text message for the specified application.

name: apex_lang.update_translated_string
bodyFullText:
APEX_LANG.UPDATE_TRANSLATED_STRING (
  p_id IN NUMBER,
  p_language IN VARCHAR2
  p_string IN VARCHAR2 )
descriptionText: Use this procedure to update a translated string in the seeded translation repository.

name: apex_mail.add_attachment
bodyFullText:
APEX_MAIL.ADD_ATTACHMENT(
    p_mail_id                   IN    NUMBER,
    p_attachment                IN    BLOB,
    p_filename                  IN    VARCHAR2,
    p_mime_type                 IN    VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure sends an outbound email message from an application as an attachment. To add multiple attachments to a single email, APEX_MAIL.ADD_ATTACHMENT can be called repeatedly for a single email message.

name: apex_mail.get_images_url
bodyFullText: APEX_MAIL.GET_IMAGES_URL return VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: Use this function to get the image prefixed URL, if the email includes Application Express instance images.

name: apex_mail.get_instance_url
bodyFullText: APEX_MAIL.GET_INSTANCE_URL return VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: If an email includes a link to an Application Express instance, use this function to get the instance URL.

name: apex_mail.push_queue
descriptionText: Oracle Application Express stores unsent email messages in a table named APEX_MAIL_QUEUE. You can manually deliver mail messages stored in this queue to the specified SMTP gateway by invoking the APEX_MAIL.PUSH_QUEUE procedure.

name: apex_mail.send
body:
p_to => $1
	, p_from => $2
	, p_body => $3
	, p_body_html => NULL
	, p_subj => NULL
	, p_cc => NULL
	, p_bcc => NULL
	, p_replyto => $4
bodyNoDefault:

	, p_from => $2
	, p_body => $3
	, p_body_html => $4
	, p_subj => $5
	, p_cc => $6
	, p_bcc => $7
	, p_replyto => $8
bodyFullText:
APEX_MAIL.SEND(
    p_to                        IN    VARCHAR2,
    p_from                      IN    VARCHAR2,
    p_body                      IN  [ VARCHAR2 | CLOB ],
    p_body_html                 IN  [ VARCHAR2 | CLOB ] DEFAULT NULL,
    p_subj                      IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_cc                        IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_bcc                       IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_replyto                   IN    VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure sends an outbound email message from an application. Although you can use this procedure to pass in either a VARCHAR2 or a CLOB to p_body and p_body_html, the data types must be the same. In other words, you cannot pass a CLOB to P_BODY and a VARCHAR2 to p_body_html.

name: apex_plugin.get_input_name_for_page_item
descriptionText: Use this function when you want to render an HTML input element in the rendering function of an item type plug-in.For the HTML input element, for example, <input type="text" id="P1_TEST" name="xxx">, you have to provide a value for the name attribute so that Oracle Application Express can map the submitted value to the actual page item in session state. This function returns the mapping name for your page item. If the HTML input element has multiple values, such as a select list with multiple="multiple", then set p_is_multi_value to TRUE.

name: apex_plugin_util.clear_component_values
bodyFullText: clear_component_values;
descriptionText: This procedure clears the component specific Session State set by apex_plugin_util.set_component_values.

name: apex_plugin_util.debug_page_item

name: apex_plugin_util.debug_process

name: apex_plugin_util.debug_region

bodyFullText:
APEX_PLUGIN_UTIL.GET_DATA (
    p_sql_statement    IN VARCHAR2,
    p_min_columns      IN NUMBER,
    p_max_columns      IN NUMBER,
    p_component_name   IN VARCHAR2,
    p_search_type      IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 2,
    p_search_column_no IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 2,
    p_search_string    IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_first_row        IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
    p_max_rows         IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL)
RETURN t_column_value_list;
descriptionText: Executes the specified SQL query restricted by the provided search string (optional) and returns the values for each column. All column values are returned as a string, independent of their data types. The search column is identified by providing a column number in the p_search_column_no parameter. This function takes into account character value comparison globalization attributes defined for the application.

    p_sql_statement    IN VARCHAR2,
    p_min_columns      IN NUMBER,
    p_max_columns      IN NUMBER,
    p_data_type_list   IN WWV_GLOBAL.VC_ARR2 DEFAULT C_EMPTY_DATA_TYPE_LIST,
    p_component_name   IN VARCHAR2,
    p_search_type      IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 2,
    p_search_column_no IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 2,
    p_search_string    IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_first_row        IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
    p_max_rows         IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL)
RETURN t_column_value_list2;
descriptionText: Executes the specified SQL query restricted by the provided search string (optional) and returns the values for each column. All column values are returned along with their original data types. The search column is identified by providing a column number in the p_search_column_no parameter. This function takes into account character value comparison globalization attributes defines for the application.

name: apex_plugin_util.get_display_data

	, p_search_column_no => $6

APEX_PLUGIN_UTIL.GET_DISPLAY_DATA (

RETURN VARCHAR2;

name: apex_plugin_util.get_element_attributes
body:
p_item => $1
	, p_name => null
	, p_default_class => null
	, p_add_id => true
	, p_add_labelledby => true
bodyFullText:
APEX_PLUGIN_UTIL.GET_ELEMENT_ATTRIBUTES (
    p_item in apex_plugin.t_page_item,
    p_name in varchar2 default null,

descriptionText: This function returns some of the standard attributes of an HTML element (for example, id, name, required, placeholder, aria-error-attributes, class) which is used if a HTML input/select/textarea/... tag is generated to get a consistent set of attributes.

name: apex_plugin_util.get_plsql_expression_result
descriptionText: This function executes a PL/SQL expression and returns a result. This function also performs the binding of any bind variables in the provided PL/SQL expression. This function is usually used for plug-in attributes of type PL/SQL Expression.

name: apex_plugin_util.get_plsql_function_result
descriptionText: This function executes a PL/SQL function block and returns the result. This function also performs binding of bind variables in the provided PL/SQL Function Body. This function is usually used for plug-in attributes of type PL/SQL Function Body.

name: apex_plugin_util.get_position_in_list
bodyFullText:
APEX_PLUGIN_UTIL.GET_POSITION_IN_LIST(
    p_list IN apex_application_global.vc_arr2,
    p_value IN VARCHAR2)
RETURN NUMBER;
descriptionText: This function returns the position in the list where p_value is stored. If it is not found, null is returned.

name: apex_plugin_util.get_search_string
bodyFullText:
APEX_PLUGIN_UTIL.GET_SEARCH_STRING(
    p_search_type IN VARCHAR2,
    p_search_string IN VARCHAR2)
RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: Based on the provided value in p_search_type the passed in value of p_search_string is returned unchanged or is converted to uppercase. Use this function with the p_search_string parameter of get_data and get_data2.

name: apex_plugin_util.get_value_as_varchar2
bodyFullText:
get_value_as_varchar2 (
   p_data_type in varchar2,
   p_value in t_value,
   p_format_mask in varchar2 default null )
   return varchar2;
descriptionText: This function can be used if you use GET_DATA2 to read the column values along with their original data types. It will convert and return the passed in p_value as VARCHAR2.

name: apex_plugin_util.is_equal
bodyFullText:
APEX_PLUGIN_UTIL.IS_EQUAL (
    p_value1 IN VARCHAR2
    p_value2 IN VARCHAR2)
RETURN BOOLEAN;
descriptionText: This function returns TRUE if both values are equal and FALSE if not. If both values are NULL, TRUE is returned.

name: apex_plugin_util.page_item_names_to_jquery
descriptionText: This function returns a jQuery selector based on a comma delimited string of page item names. For example, you could use this function for a plug-in attribute called "Page Items to Submit" where the JavaScript code has to read the values of the specified page items.

name: apex_plugin_util.print_display_only
bodyFullText:
APEX_PLUGIN_UTIL.PRINT_DISPLAY_ONLY (

name: apex_plugin_util.print_escaped_value
bodyFullText:
APEX_PLUGIN_UTIL.PRINT_ESCAPED_VALUE (

name: apex_plugin_util.print_hidden_if_read_only

	, p_is_printer_friendly => $4

name: apex_plugin_util.print_json_http_header

APEX_PLUGIN_UTIL.PRINT_LOV_AS_JSON (

name: apex_plugin_util.print_option

	, p_return_value => $2

	, p_attributes => $4
	, p_escape => TRUE

name: apex_plugin_util.replace_substitutions
bodyFullText:
apex_plugin_util.replace_substitutions (
    p_value    in varchar2,
    p_escape   in boolean default true )
    return varchar2;
descriptionText: This function replaces any &ITEM. substitution references with their actual value. If p_escape is set to TRUE, any special characters contained in the value of the referenced item are escaped to prevent Cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.

name: apex_plugin_util.set_component_values
descriptionText: This procedure extends Session State to include the column values of a specific row number. By doing so, columns can be referenced using substitution syntax or the V function in the same way as you can reference page or application items.

name: apex_session.set_debug
descriptionText: This procedure sets debug level for all future requests in a session.

name: apex_session.set_trace
descriptionText: This procedure sets trace mode in all future requests of a session.

name: apex_theme.clear_all_users_style
body:
p_application_id => {current application id}
	, p_theme_number => {current theme id}
descriptionText: This procedure clears all theme style user preferences for an application and theme.

name: apex_theme.clear_user_style
descriptionText: This procedure clears the theme style user preference for user and application.

name: apex_theme.disable_user_style
body:
p_application_id => {current application id}
	, p_theme_number => {current theme number}
descriptionText: This procedure disables theme style selection by end users. End users will not be able to customize the theme style on their own. Note that this only affects the Customization link for end users. APEX_THEME API calls are independent.

name: apex_theme.enable_user_style
body:
p_application_id => {current application id}
	, p_theme_number => {current theme number}
descriptionText: This procedure enables theme style selection by end users. When enabled and there is at least one theme style marked as Public, end users will see a Customize link which allows to choose the theme style. End user theme style selection is enabled or disabled at the User Interface level. When providing a theme number, the theme must be the Current Theme for a user interface. Note that this only affects the Customization link for end users. APEX_THEME API calls are independent.

name: apex_theme.get_user_style
descriptionText: This function returns the theme style user preference for the user and application. If no user preference is present, NULL is returned.

name: apex_theme.set_current_style
descriptionText: This procedure sets current theme style for the current application.

name: apex_theme.set_session_style
descriptionText: This procedure sets the theme style dynamically for the current session. This is typically being called after successful authentication.

name: apex_theme.set_session_style_css
descriptionText: This procedure sets the theme style CSS urls dynamically for the current session. Theme style CSS URLs are being directly passed in; a persistent style definition is not needed. This is typically being called after successful authentication.

name: apex_theme.set_user_style
descriptionText: This procedure sets a theme style user preference for the current user and application. Theme Style User Preferences are automatically picked up and precede any style set with SET_SESSION_STYLE.

bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.ADD_AD_COLUMN (
    p_column_name           IN  VARCHAR2,
    p_label                 IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_help_text             IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_format_mask           IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_default_value         IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_form_format_mask      IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_form_display_width    IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_form_display_height   IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_form_data_type        IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_report_format_mask    IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_report_col_alignment  IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_syn_name1             IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_syn_name2             IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_syn_name3             IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: Adds a User Interface Default Attribute Dictionary entry with the provided definition. Up to three synonyms can be provided during the creation. Additional synonyms can be added post-creation using apex_ui_default_update.add_ad_synonym. Synonyms share the column definition of their base column.

name: apex_ui_default_update.add_ad_synonym
descriptionText: If the column name is found within the User Interface Default Attribute Dictionary, the synonym provided is created and associated with that column. Synonyms share the column definition of their base column.

name: apex_ui_default_update.del_ad_column
bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.DEL_AD_COLUMN (
    p_column_name           IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: If the column name is found within the User Interface Default Attribute Dictionary, the column, along with any associated synonyms, is deleted.

name: apex_ui_default_update.del_ad_synonym
bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.DEL_AD_SYNONYM (
    p_syn_name           IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: If the synonym name is found within the User Interface Default Attribute Dictionary, the synonym name is deleted.

name: apex_ui_default_update.del_column
descriptionText: If the provided table and column exists within the use\'s schem\'s table based User Interface Defaults, the UI Defaults for it are deleted.

name: apex_ui_default_update.del_group
descriptionText: If the provided table and group exists within the use\'s schem\'s table based User Interface Defaults, the UI Defaults for it are deleted and any column within the table that references that group has the group_id set to null.

name: apex_ui_default_update.del_table
bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.DEL_TABLE (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: If the provided table exists within the use\'s schem\'s table based User Interface Defaults, the UI Defaults for it is deleted. This includes the deletion of any groups defined for the table and all the columns associated with the table.

name: apex_ui_default_update.synch_table
bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.SYNCH_TABLE (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: If the Table Based User Interface Defaults for the table do not already exist within the use\'s schema, they are defaulted. If they do exist, they are synchronized, meaning, the columns in the table is matched against the column in the UI Defaults Table Definitions. Additions and deletions are used to make them match.

	, p_display_seq_report => $15
	, p_mask_report => $16
	, p_alignment => $17
bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_COLUMN (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_column_name           IN VARCHAR2,
    p_group_id              IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_label                 IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_help_text             IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_display_in_form       IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_display_seq_form      IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_mask_form             IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_default_value         IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_required              IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_display_width         IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_max_width             IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_height                IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_display_in_report     IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_display_seq_report    IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_mask_report           IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_alignment             IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: If the provided table and column exists within the use\'s schem\'s table based User Interface Defaults, the provided parameters are updated. If\'null\' is passed in, the value of the associated parameter is set to null.

name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_display_in_form
bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_DISPLAY_IN_FORM (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_column_name           IN VARCHAR2,
    p_display_in_form       IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: The UPD_DISPLAY_IN_FORM procedure sets the display in form user interface defaults. This user interface default is used by wizards when you select to create a form based upon the table. It controls whether the column is included by default or not.

name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_display_in_report
bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_DISPLAY_IN_REPORT (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_column_name           IN VARCHAR2,
    p_display_in_report     IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: The UPD_DISPLAY_IN_REPORT procedure sets the display in report user interface default. This user interface default is used by wizards when you select to create a report based upon the table and controls whether the column is included by default or not.

name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_form_region_title
descriptionText: The UPD_FORM_REGION_TITLE procedure updates the Form Region Title user interface default. User interface defaults are used in wizards when you create a form based upon the specified table.

name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_group
body:
p_table_name => $1
	, p_group_name => $2
	, p_new_group_name => NULL
	, p_description => NULL
	, p_display_sequence => NULL
bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_GROUP (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_group_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_new_group_name        IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_description           IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_display_sequence      IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: If the provided table and group exist within the use\'s schem\'s table based User Interface Defaults, the group name, description and display sequence of the group are updated. If\'null\' is passed in for p_description or p_display_sequence, the value is set to null.

name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_item_display_height
bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_ITEM_DISPLAY_HEIGHT (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_column_name           IN VARCHAR2,
    p_display_height        IN NUMBER);
descriptionText: The UPD_ITEM_DISPLAY_HEIGHT procedure sets the item display height user interface default. This user interface default is used by wizards when you select to create a form based upon the table and include the specified column. Display height controls if the item is a text box or a text area.

name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_item_display_width
bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_ITEM_DISPLAY_WIDTH (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_column_name           IN VARCHAR2,
    p_display_width         IN NUMBER);
descriptionText: The UPD_ITEM_DISPLAY_WIDTH procedure sets the item display width user interface default. This user interface default is used by wizards when you select to create a form based upon the table and include the specified column.

name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_item_format_mask
bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_ITEM_FORMAT_MASK (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_column_name           IN VARCHAR2,
    p_format_mask           IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: The UPD_ITEM_FORMAT_MASK procedure sets the item format mask user interface default. This user interface default is used by wizards when you select to create a form based upon the table and include the specified column. Item format mask is typically used to format numbers and dates.

name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_item_help
bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_ITEM_HELP (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_column_name           IN VARCHAR2,
    p_help_text             IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: The UPD_ITEM_HELP procedure updates the help text for the specified table and column. This user interface default is used when you create a form based upon the table and select to include the specified column.

name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_label
bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_LABEL (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_column_name           IN VARCHAR2,
    p_label                 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: The UPD_LABEL procedure sets the label used for items. This user interface default is used when you create a form or report based on the specified table and include a specific column.

name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_report_alignment
bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_REPORT_ALIGNMENT (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_column_name           IN VARCHAR2,
    p_report_alignment      IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: The UPD_REPORT_ALIGNMENT procedure sets the report alignment user interface default. This user interface default is used by wizards when you select to create a report based upon the table and include the specified column and determines if the report column should be left, center, or right justified.

name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_report_format_mask
bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_REPORT_FORMAT_MASK (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_column_name           IN VARCHAR2,
    p_format_mask           IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: The UPD_REPORT_FORMAT_MASK procedure sets the report format mask user interface default. This user interface default is used by wizards when you select to create a report based upon the table and include the specified column. Report format mask is typically used to format numbers and dates.

name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_report_region_title
descriptionText: The UPD_REPORT_REGION_TITLE procedure sets the Report Region Title. User interface defaults are used in wizards when a report is created on a table.

name: apex_ui_default_update.upd_table
bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_TABLE (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_form_region_title     IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_report_region_title   IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: If the provided table exists within the use\'s schem\'s table based User Interface Defaults, the form region title and report region title are updated to match those provided. If\'null\' is passed in for p_form_region_title or p_report_region_title, the value is set to null.

name: apex_util.cache_get_date_of_page_cache
bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.CACHE_GET_DATE_OF_PAGE_CACHE (
    p_application  IN NUMBER,
    p_page         IN NUMBER)
RETURN DATE;
descriptionText: This function returns the date and time a specified application page was cached either for the user issuing the call, or for all users if the page was not set to be cached by user.

name: apex_util.cache_get_date_of_region_cache
bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.CACHE_GET_DATE_OF_REGION_CACHE (
    p_application  IN NUMBER,
    p_page         IN NUMBER,
    p_region_name  IN VARCHAR2)
RETURN DATE;
descriptionText: This function returns the date and time a specified region was cached either for the user issuing the call, or for all users if the page was not set to be cached by user.

name: apex_util.cache_purge_by_application
bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.CACHE_PURGE_BY_APPLICATION (
    p_application  IN NUMBER);
descriptionText: This procedure purges all cached pages and regions for a given application.

name: apex_util.cache_purge_by_page
bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.CACHE_PURGE_BY_PAGE (
    p_application  IN NUMBER,
    p_page         IN NUMBER,
    p_user_name    IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure purges the cache for a given application and page. If the page itself is not cached but contains one or more cached regions, then the cache for these is also purged.

name: apex_util.cache_purge_stale
bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.CACHE_PURGE_STALE (
    p_application  IN NUMBER);
descriptionText: This procedure deletes all cached pages and regions for a specified application that have passed the defined active time period. When you cache a page or region, you specify an active time period (or Cache Timeout). Once that period has passed, the cache is no longer used, thus removing those unusable pages or regions from the cache.

name: apex_util.change_current_user_pw
bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.CHANGE_CURRENT_USER_PW(
    p_new_password IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure changes the password of the currently authenticated user, assuming Application Express user accounts are in use.

name: apex_util.change_password_on_first_use
descriptionText: Enables a developer to check whether this property is enabled or disabled for an end user account. This function returns TRUE if the account password must be changed upon first use (after successful authentication) after the password is initially set and after it is changed on the Administration Service, Edit User page. This function returns FALSE if the account does not have this property.

name: apex_util.clear_app_cache
bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.CLEAR_APP_CACHE (
    p_app_id    IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure removes session state for a given application for the current session.

name: apex_util.clear_page_cache
bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.CLEAR_PAGE_CACHE (
    p_page_id IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure removes session state for a given page for the current session.

name: apex_util.clear_user_cache
bodyFullText: APEX_UTIL.CLEAR_USER_CACHE;
descriptionText: This procedure removes session state and application system preferences for the current use\'s session. Run this procedure if you reuse session IDs and want to run applications without the benefit of existing session state.

name: apex_util.close_open_db_links
bodyFullText: APEX_UTIL.CLOSE_OPEN_DB_LINKS
descriptionText: This procedure closes all open database links for the current database session. It is rare that this procedure would ever be called programatically in an application. The primary purpose of this procedure is for the middleware technology in an Oracle Application Express environment (for example, Oracle REST Data Service, mod_plsql) to be configured such that it closes all of the open database links in a session, either before a request is made to the Application Express engine, or after a request to the Application Express engine is completed but before the database session is returned to the pool.

name: apex_util.count_click

	, p_user => NULL
	, p_workspace => NULL

    p_workspace   IN    VARCHAR2    DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure counts clicks from an application built in App Builder to an external site. You can also use the shorthand version, procedure Z, in place of APEX_UTIL.COUNT_CLICK.

name: apex_util.end_user_account_days_left

name: apex_util.expire_end_user_account

name: apex_util.expire_workspace_account
descriptionText: Expires developer or workspace administrator login accounts. Must be run by an authenticated workspace administrator in a page request context.

name: apex_util.export_users
bodyFullText:

    p_export_format IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'UNIX');
descriptionText: When called from a page, this procedure produces an export file of the current workspace definition, workspace users, and workspace groups. To execute this procedure, the current user must have administrative privilege in the workspace.

name: apex_util.find_security_group_id
descriptionText: This function returns the numeric security group ID of the named workspace.

name: apex_util.find_workspace
descriptionText: This function returns the workspace name associated with a security group ID.

name: apex_util.get_account_locked_status
descriptionText: Returns TRUE if the account is locked and FALSE if the account is unlocked. Must be run by an authenticated workspace administrator in a page request context.

name: apex_util.get_application_status
bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.GET_APPLICATION_STATUS(
    p_application_id IN NUMBER) RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function returns the current status of the application. Status values include AVAILABLE, AVAILABLE_W_EDIT_LINK, DEVELOPERS_ONLY, RESTRICTED_ACCESS, UNAVAILABLE, UNAVAILABLE_PLSQL, and UNAVAILABLE_URL.

name: apex_util.get_attribute
bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.GET_ATTRIBUTE(
    p_username                IN VARCHAR2,
    p_attribute_number        IN NUMBER)
RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function returns the value of one of the attribute values (1 through 10) of a named user in the Application Express accounts table. Please note these are only accessible by using the APIs.

name: apex_util.get_authentication_result
bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.GET_AUTHENTICATION_RESULT
RETURN NUMBER;
descriptionText: Use this function to retrieve the authentication result of the current session. Any authenticated user can call this function in a page request context.

name: apex_util.get_blob_file_src
body:
p_item_name => NULL
	, p_v1 => NULL
	, p_v2 => NULL
	, p_content_disposition => NULL
bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.GET_BLOB_FILE_SRC (
    p_item_name           IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_v1                  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_v2                  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_content_disposition IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL)
RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: As an alternative to using the built-in methods of providing a download link, you can use the APEX_UTIL.GET_BLOB_FILE_SRC function. One advantage of this approach, is the ability to more specifically format the display of the image (with height and width tags). Please note that this approach is only valid if called from a valid Oracle Application Express session. Also, this method requires that the parameters that describe the BLOB to be listed as the format of a valid item within the application. That item is then referenced by the function.

name: apex_util.get_build_option_status

name: apex_util.get_file
descriptionText: This procedure downloads files from the Oracle Application Express file repository. Please note if you are invoking this procedure during page processing, you must ensure that no page branch is invoked under the same condition, as it interferes with the file retrieval. This means that branches with any of the following conditions should not be set to fire:

name: apex_util.get_file_id

name: apex_util.get_since
bodyFullText:
APEX_UTIL.GET_SINCE (
   p_date  date )
   p_short in [ boolean default false | varchar2 default 'N' ] )  
RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function returns the relative date in words (for example, 2 days from now, 30 minutes ago). It also accepts a second optional p_short parameter and returns "in 2d", "30m". This function is equivalent to using the SINCE and SINCE_SHORT format mask available within Oracle Application Express and is useful within SQL queries or PL/SQL routines.

name: apex_util.get_user_id

name: apex_util.get_user_roles
descriptionText: This function returns the DEVELOPER_ROLE field stored in the named user account record. Please note that currently this parameter is named inconsistently between the CREATE_USER, EDIT_USER and FETCH_USER APIs, although they all relate to the DEVELOPER_ROLE field. CREATE_USER uses p_developer_privs, EDIT_USER uses p_developer_roles and FETCH_USER uses p_developer_role.

p_user_name => WWW_FLOW_SECURITY.G_USER

	, p_change_password_on_first_use => TRUE
bodyFullText:

This procedure changes the password of p_user_name in the current workspace to p_new_password. If p_change_password_on_first_use is TRUE, then the user has to change the password on the next login.

name: ctx_doc.set_key_type
bodyFullText: ctx_doc.set_key_type(key_type in varchar2);
descriptionText: Use this procedure to set the CTX_DOC procedures to accept either the ROWID or the PRIMARY_KEY document identifiers. This setting affects the invoking session only.

name: ctx_doc.snippet
body: index_name => $1 , textkey => $2 , text_query => $3 , starttag => '' , endtag => '' , entity_translation => TRUE , separator => '...' , radius => 25 , max_length => 250 , use_saved_copy => CTX_DOC.SAVE_COPY_FALLBACK , return => $4
bodyNoDefault:
index_name => $1
	, textkey => $2
	, text_query => $3
	, starttag => $4
	, endtag => $5
	, entity_translation => $6
	, separator => $7
	, radius => $8
	, max_length => $9
	, use_saved_copy => $10
	, return => $11
bodyFullText: CTX_DOC.SNIPPET( index_name IN VARCHAR2, textkey IN VARCHAR2, text_query IN VARCHAR2, starttag IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT '', endtag IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT '', entity_translation IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE, separator IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT '...', radius IN INTEGER DEFAULT 25, max_length IN INTEGER DEFAULT 250 use_saved_copy IN NUMBER DEFAULT CTX_DOC.SAVE_COPY_FALLBACK return varchar2 );
descriptionText: Use the CTX_DOC.SNIPPET procedure to produce a concordance for a document. The output of a snippet is a collection of segments. A concordance is a text fragment that contains a query term with some of its surrounding text. This is also sometimes known as Key Word in Context or KWIC, because it returns query keywords marked up in their surrounding text, which enables the user to evaluate them in context. The returned text can also contain themes that satisfy an ABOUT query.

name: ctx_doc.themes
body:
index_name => $1
	, textkey => $2
	, restab => $3
	, full_themes => FALSE
	, num_themes => 50
	, use_saved_copy => CTX_DOC.SAVE_COPY_FALLBACK
bodyNoDefault:
index_name => $1
	, textkey => $2
	, restab => $3
	, full_themes => $4
	, num_themes => $5
	, use_saved_copy => $6
bodyFullText:
CTX_DOC.THEMES(
index_name      IN VARCHAR2,
textkey         IN VARCHAR2,
restab          IN OUT NOCOPY THEME_TAB,
full_themes     IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
num_themes      IN NUMBER DEFAULT 50,
use_saved_copy  IN NUMBER DEFAULT CTX_DOC.SAVE_COPY_FALLBACK);
descriptionText: Use the CTX_DOC.THEMES procedure to generate a list of themes for a document. You can store each theme as a row in either a result table or an in-memory PL/SQL table that you specify.

name: ctx_doc.tokens
bodyFullText:
CTX_DOC.TOKENS(index_name      IN VARCHAR2,
               textkey         IN VARCHAR2,
               restab          IN OUT NOCOPY TOKEN_TAB,
               use_saved_copy  IN NUMBER DEFAULT CTX_DOC.SAVE_COPY_FALLBACK);
descriptionText: Use this procedure to identify all text tokens in a document. The tokens returned are those tokens that are inserted into the index. This feature is useful for implementing document classification, routing, or clustering.

name: ctx_output.add_event
bodyFullText: CTX_OUTPUT.ADD_EVENT(event in NUMBER, errnum in NUMBER := null);
descriptionText: Use this procedure to add an event to the index log for more detailed log output or to enable error tracing for Oracle Text errors.

name: ctx_output.add_trace
bodyFullText: CTX_OUTPUT.ADD_TRACE(trace_id BINARY_INTEGER);
descriptionText: Use this procedure to enable a trace. If the trace has not been enabled, this call adds the trace to the list of active traces and resets its value to 0. If the trace has already been enabled, an error is raised.

name: ctx_output.disable_query_stats
descriptionText: Disables gathering of query stats for the index.

name: ctx_output.enable_query_stats
descriptionText: Enables gathering of query stats for the index. To have query-related metadata stored for the index, use this procedure to enable collection of statistics on that index. You can only access the gathered metadata when ctx_output.enable_query_stats is turned on for the index.

name: ctx_output.end_log
bodyFullText: ctx_output.end_log;
descriptionText: This procedure halts logging index and document service requests.

name: ctx_output.end_query_log
bodyFullText: ctx_output.end_query_log;
descriptionText: Use this procedure to stop logging queries into a logfile created with CTX_OUTPUT.START_QUERY_LOG.

name: ctx_output.get_trace_value
bodyFullText: CTX_OUTPUT.GET_TRACE_VALUE(trace_id BINARY_INTEGER);
descriptionText: Use this procedure to programmatically retrieve the current value of a trace.

name: ctx_output.log_traces
bodyFullText: CTX_OUTPUT.LOG_TRACES;
descriptionText: Use this procedure to print all active traces to the logfile.

name: ctx_output.logfilename
bodyFullText: CTX_OUTPUT.LOGFILENAME RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: Returns the filename for the current log. This procedure looks for the logfile in the directory specified by the LOG_DIRECTORY system parameter, which is $ORACLE_HOME/ctx/log on UNIX. You can query the CTX_PARAMETERS view to find the current setting.

name: ctx_output.remove_event
bodyFullText: CTX_OUTPUT.REMOVE_EVENT(event in NUMBER);
descriptionText: Use this procedure to remove an event from the index log.

name: ctx_output.remove_trace
bodyFullText: CTX_OUTPUT.REMOVE_TRACE(trace_id BINARY_INTEGER);
descriptionText: Use this procedure to disable a trace.

name: ctx_output.reset_trace
bodyFullText: CTX_OUTPUT.RESET_TRACE(trace_id BINARY_INTEGER);
descriptionText: Use this procedure to clear a trace (that is, reset it to 0).

name: ctx_output.start_log
bodyFullText: CTX_OUTPUT.START_LOG(logfile in varchar2, overwrite in default true);
descriptionText: Begin logging index and document service requests.

name: ctx_output.start_query_log
bodyFullText: CTX_OUTPUT.START_QUERY_LOG(logfile in varchar2, overwrite in default true);
descriptionText: Begin logging query requests into a query log file.

name: ctx_query.browse_words

index_name => $1

	, numwords => 10
	, direction => BROWSE_AROUND
	, part_name => NULL

ctx_query.browse_words(

direction   IN   VARCHAR2 DEFAULT BROWSE_AROUND,

);
descriptionText: This procedure enables you to browse words in an Oracle Text index. Specify a seed word and BROWSE_WORDS returns the words around it in the index, and an approximate count of the number of documents that contain each word.

name: ctx_query.count_hits
body:
index_name => $1
	, text_query => $2
	, exact => TRUE
	, part_name => NULL
descriptionText: Returns the number of hits for the specified query. You can call COUNT_HITS in exact or estimate mode. Exact mode returns the exact number of hits for the query. Estimate mode returns an upper-bound estimate but runs faster than exact mode.

name: ctx_query.explain

    explain_table  IN VARCHAR2,
    sharelevel     IN NUMBER DEFAULT 0,
    explain_id     IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    part_name      IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL
);
descriptionText: Use CTX_QUERY.EXPLAIN to generate explain plan information for a query expression. The EXPLAIN plan provides a graphical representation of the parse tree for a Text query expression. This information is stored in a result table.

name: ctx_query.remove_sqe

name: ctx_query.store_sqe
descriptionText: This procedure creates either a stored or session-duration query expression (SQE). Only the query definition is stored.

name: ctx_report.create_index_script
descriptionText: Creates a SQL*Plus script which will create a text index that duplicates the named text index.

name: ctx_report.create_policy_script
descriptionText: Creates a SQL*Plus script which will create a text policy that duplicates the named text policy.

name: ctx_report.describe_index
descriptionText: Creates a report describing the index. This includes the settings of the index metadata, the indexing objects used, the settings of the attributes of the objects, and index partition descriptions, if any.

name: ctx_report.describe_policy
descriptionText: Creates a report describing the policy. This includes the settings of the policy metadata, the indexing objects used, and the settings of the attributes of the objects.

name: ctx_thes.alter_phrase

CTX_THES.ALTER_PHRASE(tname      in varchar2, 
                       phrase     in varchar2,
                       op         in varchar2,
                       operand    in varchar2 default null);
