name: ctx_thes.alter_thesaurus
descriptionText: Use this procedure to rename or truncate an existing thesaurus. Only the thesaurus owner or CTXSYS can invoke this function on a given thesaurus.

bodyFullText:
CTX_THES.BT(restab IN OUT NOCOPY EXP_TAB,
            phrase IN VARCHAR2, 
            lvl    IN NUMBER DEFAULT 1,
            tname  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'DEFAULT');

CTX_THES.BTG(restab IN OUT NOCOPY EXP_TAB,
             phrase IN VARCHAR2, 
             lvl    IN NUMBER DEFAULT 1,

name: ctx_thes.bti
bodyFullText:
CTX_THES.BTI(restab IN OUT NOCOPY EXP_TAB,
             phrase IN VARCHAR2, 
             lvl    IN NUMBER DEFAULT 1,

descriptionText: This function returns all broader terms instance of a phrase as recorded in the specified thesaurus.

name: ctx_thes.btp

CTX_THES.BTP(restab IN OUT NOCOPY EXP_TAB,
             phrase IN VARCHAR2, 
             lvl    IN NUMBER DEFAULT 1,

body:
tname => $1
	, phrase => $2
	, rel => NULL
	, relname => NULL

CTX_THES.CREATE_PHRASE(tname   IN VARCHAR2,
                       phrase  IN VARCHAR2,
                       rel     IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
                       relname IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: The CREATE_PHRASE procedure adds a new phrase to the specified thesaurus.

name: ctx_thes.create_relation
bodyFullText:
CTX_THES.CREATE_RELATION(tname      in    varchar2,
                         phrase     in    varchar2,
                         rel        in    varchar2,
                         relphrase  in    varchar2);
descriptionText: Creates a relation between two phrases in the thesaurus. The synonym ring is limited in length to about 4000 synonyms, depending on word length.

name: ctx_thes.create_thesaurus
bodyFullText:
CTX_THES.CREATE_THESAURUS(name           IN VARCHAR2,
                          casesens       IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
descriptionText: The CREATE_THESAURUS procedure creates an empty thesaurus with the specified name in the thesaurus tables.

name: ctx_thes.create_translation
bodyFullText:
CTX_THES.CREATE_TRANSLATION(tname       in    varchar2,
                            phrase      in    varchar2,
                            language    in    varchar2,
                            translation in    varchar2);

name: ctx_thes.drop_phrase
bodyFullText:
CTX_THES.DROP_PHRASE(tname      in varchar2, 
                     phrase     in varchar2);
descriptionText: Removes a phrase from the thesaurus. Only thesaurus owner and CTXSYS can invoke this procedure on a given thesaurus.

name: ctx_thes.drop_relation
bodyFullText:
CTX_THES.DROP_RELATION(tname     in    varchar2,
                        phrase    in    varchar2,
                        rel       in    varchar2,
                        relphrase in    varchar2 default null);
descriptionText: Removes a relation between two phrases from the thesaurus.

name: ctx_thes.drop_thesaurus
bodyFullText: CTX_THES.DROP_THESAURUS(name IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: The DROP_THESAURUS procedure deletes the specified thesaurus and all of its entries from the thesaurus tables.

name: ctx_thes.drop_translation
body:
tname => $1
	, phrase => $2
	, language => null
	, translation => null
bodyFullText:
CTX_THES.DROP_TRANSLATION (tname       in    varchar2,
                           phrase      in    varchar2,
                           language    in    varchar2 default null,
                           translation in    varchar2 default null);
descriptionText: Use this procedure to remove one or more translations for a phrase.

name: ctx_thes.export_thesaurus
bodyFullText:
CTX_THES.EXPORT_THESAURUS(name in varchar2, 
                          thesdump in out nocopy CLOB);
descriptionText: Use this procedure to export a thesaurus as a clob from the Oracle Text thesaurus tables. The format of the exported thesaurus is same as that of the format of the thesaurus file that is used by the ctxload utility to import thesaurus into the Oracle Text thesaurus tables.

name: ctx_thes.has_relation
bodyFullText:
CTX_THES.HAS_RELATION(phrase in varchar2, 
                      rel in varchar2, 
                      tname in varchar2 default 'DEFAULT')
  returns boolean;
descriptionText: HAS_RELATION tests that a thesaurus relation exists without actually performing the expansion. The function returns TRUE if the phrase has any of the relations in the specified list.

name: ctx_thes.import_thesaurus
descriptionText: Use this procedure to import a thesaurus into the Oracle Text thesaurus tables. You should call ctx_output.start_log before calling import_thesaurus to log the operations done by import_thesaurus.

name: ctx_thes.nt
bodyFullText:
CTX_THES.NT(restab IN OUT NOCOPY EXP_TAB,
             phrase IN VARCHAR2, 
             lvl    IN NUMBER DEFAULT 1,
             tname  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'DEFAULT');
descriptionText: This function returns all narrower terms of a phrase as recorded in the specified thesaurus.

name: ctx_thes.ntg
bodyFullText:
CTX_THES.NTG(restab IN OUT NOCOPY EXP_TAB,
             phrase IN VARCHAR2,

CTX_THES.NTP(restab IN OUT NOCOPY EXP_TAB,

name: ctx_thes.output_style
body:
showlevel => FALSE
	, showqualify => FALSE

name: ctx_thes.pt
bodyFullText:
CTX_THES.PT(restab IN OUT NOCOPY EXP_TAB,
            phrase IN VARCHAR2,
            tname  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'DEFAULT')
RETURN varchar2;

name: ctx_thes.rt
descriptionText: This function returns the related terms of a term in the specified thesaurus.

name: ctx_thes.sn
descriptionText: This function returns the scope note of the given phrase.

name: ctx_thes.syn
descriptionText: This function returns all synonyms of a phrase as recorded in the specified thesaurus.

name: ctx_thes.thes_tt
bodyFullText:
CTX_THES.THES_TT(restab IN OUT NOCOPY EXP_TAB,
                 tname  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'DEFAULT');
descriptionText: This procedure finds and returns all top terms of a thesaurus. A top term is defined as any term which has a narrower term but has no broader terms.

name: ctx_thes.tr
bodyFullText:
CTX_THES.TR(restab IN OUT NOCOPY EXP_TAB,
            phrase IN VARCHAR2, 
            lang   IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
            tname  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'DEFAULT')
descriptionText: For a given mono-lingual thesaurus, this function returns the foreign language equivalent of a phrase as recorded in the thesaurus.

name: ctx_thes.trsyn
bodyFullText:
CTX_THES.TRSYN(restab IN OUT NOCOPY EXP_TAB,
               phrase IN VARCHAR2, 
               lang   IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
               tname  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'DEFAULT');
descriptionText: For a given mono-lingual thesaurus, this function returns the foreign equivalent of a phrase, synonyms of the phrase, and foreign equivalent of the synonyms as recorded in the specified thesaurus.

name: ctx_thes.tt
descriptionText: This function returns the top term of a phrase as recorded in the specified thesaurus.

name: dbms_addm.compare_capture_replay_report
bodyFullText:
DBMS_ADDM.COMPARE_CAPTURE_REPLAY_REPORT (

  RETURN CLOB;
descriptionText: This function produces a Compare Period ADDM report comparing the performance of a capture to a replay. The AWR data must reside in the same database, but it can originate from different databases. The function generates a report in either XML or HTML(Active Report) format.

DBMS_ADDM.COMPARE_DATABASES (
   base_dbid             IN NUMBER := NULL,
   base_begin_snap_id    IN NUMBER,
   base_end_snap_id      IN NUMBER,
   comp_dbid             IN NUMBER := NULL,

   comp_end_snap_id      IN NUMBER,
   report_type           IN VARCHAR2 := 'HTML')
  RETURN CLOB;
descriptionText: This function produces a Compare Period ADDM report comparing the performance of a database over two different time periods or the performance of two different databases over two different time periods.The AWR data must reside in the same database, but it can originate from different databases. The function generates a report in either XML or HTML(Active Report) format.

   base_dbid             IN NUMBER := NULL,

   comp_dbid             IN NUMBER := NULL,
   comp_instance_id      IN NUMBER,
   comp_begin_snap_id    IN NUMBER,
   comp_end_snap_id      IN  NUMBER,
   report_type           IN VARCHAR2 := 'HTML')
  RETURN CLOB;
descriptionText: This function produces a Compare Period ADDM report comparing the performance of a single instance over two different time periods or the performance of two different instances over two different time periods.The AWR data must reside in the same database, but it can originate from different databases. The function generates a report in either XML or HTML(Active Report) format.

name: dbms_addm.delete
bodyFullText:
DBMS_ADDM.DELETE (
   task_name           IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure deletes an already created ADDM task (of any kind). For database analysis mode and partial analysis mode this deletes the local tasks associated with the main task.

name: dbms_addm.delete_finding_directive
descriptionText: This procedure deletes a finding directive.

name: dbms_addm.delete_parameter_directive
descriptionText: This procedure deletes a parameter directive. This removes a specific system directive for parameters. Subsequent ADDM tasks are not affected by this directive.

name: dbms_addm.delete_segment_directive
descriptionText: This procedure deletes a segment directive.

name: dbms_addm.delete_sql_directive
descriptionText: This procedure deletes a SQL directive.

name: dbms_addm.get_ash_query
bodyFullText:
DBMS_ADDM.GET_ASH_QUERY (
   task_name           IN   VARCHAR2,
   finding_id          IN   NUMBER)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: The function returns a string containing the SQL text of an ASH query identifying the rows in ASH with impact for the finding. For most types of findings this identifies the exact rows in ASH corresponding to the finding. For some types of findings the query is an approximation and should not be used for exact identification of the findin\'s impact or the findin\'s specific activity.

name: dbms_addm.get_report
descriptionText: This function retrieves the default text report of an executed ADDM task.

name: dbms_addm.insert_finding_directive
bodyFullText:
DBMS_ADDM.INSERT_FINDING_DIRECTIVE (
   task_name             IN VARCHAR2,
   dir_name              IN VARCHAR2,
   finding_name          IN VARCHAR2,
   min_active_sessions   IN NUMBER := 0,
   min_perc_impact       IN NUMBER := 0);
descriptionText: This procedure creates a directive to limit reporting of a specific finding type. The directive can be created for a specific task (only when the task is in INITIAL status), or for all subsequently created ADDM tasks (such as a system directive).

name: dbms_addm.insert_parameter_directive
bodyFullText:
DBMS_ADDM.INSERT_PARAMETER_DIRECTIVE (
   task_name             IN VARCHAR2,
   dir_name              IN VARCHAR2,
   parameter_name        IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure creates a directive to prevent ADDM from creating actions to alter the value of a specific system parameter. The directive can be created for a specific task (only when the task is in INITIAL status), or for all subsequently created ADDM tasks (such as a system directive).

name: dbms_addm.insert_segment_directive
body:
task_name => $1
	, dir_name => $2
	, owner_name => $3
	, object_name => NULL
	, sub_object_name => NULL
bodyFullText:
DBMS_ADDM.INSERT_SEGMENT_DIRECTIVE (
   task_name             IN VARCHAR2,
   dir_name              IN VARCHAR2,
   owner_name            IN VARCHAR2,
   object_name           IN VARCHAR2 := NULL,
   sub_object_name       IN VARCHAR2 := NULL);
   
DBMS_ADDM.INSERT_SEGMENT_DIRECTIVE (
   task_name             IN VARCHAR2,
   dir_name              IN VARCHAR2,
   object_number         IN NUMBER);
descriptionText: This procedure creates a directive to prevent ADDM from creating actions to "run Segment Advisor" for specific segments. The directive can be created for a specific task (only when the task is in INITIAL status), or for all subsequently created ADDM tasks (such as a system directive).

name: dbms_addm.insert_sql_directive
bodyFullText:
DBMS_ADDM.INSERT_SQL_DIRECTIVE (
   task_name             IN VARCHAR2,
   dir_name              IN VARCHAR2,
   sql_id                IN VARCHAR2,
   min_active_sessions   IN NUMBER := 0,
   min_response_time     IN NUMBER := 0);
descriptionText: This procedure creates a directive to limit reporting of actions on specific SQL. The directive can be created for a specific task (only when the task is in INITIAL status), or for all subsequently created ADDM tasks (such as a system directive).

name: dbms_addm.real_time_addm_report
bodyFullText:
DBMS_ADDM.REAL_TIME_ADDM_REPORT ()
 RETURN CLOB;
descriptionText: This function produces a real-time ADDM report for ADDM-related activity for the last five minutes. In an Oracle Real Application Clusters (Oracle RAC) environment, the function assumes that executing SQL over GV$ is possible.

name: dbms_advanced_rewrite.alter_rewrite_equivalence
descriptionText: This procedure changes the mode of the rewrite equivalence declaration to the mode you specify.

name: dbms_advanced_rewrite.declare_rewrite_equivalence
body:
name => $1
	, source_stmt => $2
	, destination_stmt => $3
	, validate => TRUE
	, rewrite_mode => 'TEXT_MATCH'
bodyFullText:
DBMS_ADVANCED_REWRITE.DECLARE_REWRITE_EQUIVALENCE (
   name                 VARCHAR2,
   source_stmt          VARCHAR2,
   destination_stmt     VARCHAR2,
   validate             BOOLEAN    := TRUE,
   rewrite_mode         VARCHAR2   := 'TEXT_MATCH');

DBMS_ADVANCED_REWRITE.DECLARE_REWRITE_EQUIVALENCE (
   name                 VARCHAR2,
   source_stmt          CLOB,
   destination_stmt     CLOB,
   validate             BOOLEAN   := TRUE,
   rewrite_mode         VARCHAR2  := 'TEXT_MATCH');
descriptionText: This procedure creates a declaration indicating that source_stmt is functionally equivalent to destination_stmt for as long as the equivalence declaration remains enabled, and that destination_stmt is more favorable in terms of performance. The scope of the declaration is system wide. The query rewrite engine uses such declarations to perform rewrite transformations in QUERY_REWRITE_INTEGRITY = trusted and stale_tolerated modes.

name: dbms_advanced_rewrite.drop_rewrite_equivalence
bodyFullText:
DBMS_ADVANCED_REWRITE.DROP_REWRITE_EQUIVALENCE (
   name        VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure drops the specified rewrite equivalence declaration.

name: dbms_advanced_rewrite.validate_rewrite_equivalence
bodyFullText:
DBMS_ADVANCED_REWRITE.VALIDATE_REWRITE_EQUIVALENCE (
   name         VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure validates the specified rewrite equivalence declaration using the same validation method as described with the VALIDATE parameter in "VALIDATE_REWRITE_EQUIVALENCE Procedure".

name: dbms_advisor.add_sts_ref
bodyFullText:
DBMS_ADVISOR.ADD_STS_REF(
  task_name       IN VARCHAR2 NOT NULL,
  sts_owner       IN VARCHAR2,
  workload_name   IN VARCHAR2 NOT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure establishes a link between the current SQL Access Advisor task and a SQL tuning set. The link enables an advisor task to access data for the purpose of doing an analysis. The link also provides a stable view of the data. Once a connection between a SQL Access Advisor task and a SQL tuning set is made, the STS is protected from removal or modification.

name: dbms_advisor.cancel_task
bodyFullText:
DBMS_ADVISOR.CANCEL_TASK (
   task_name      IN  VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure causes a currently executing operation to terminate. This call does a soft interrupt. It will not break into a low-level database access call like a hard interrupt such as Ctrl-C. The SQL Access Advisor periodically checks for soft interrupts and acts appropriately. As a result, this operation may take a few seconds to respond to a call.

name: dbms_advisor.copy_sqlwkld_to_sts

DBMS_ADVISOR.COPY_SQLWKLD_TO_STS (

   import_mode           IN VARCHAR2 := 'NEW');
descriptionText: This procedure copies the contents of a SQL workload object to a SQL tuning set.

DBMS_ADVISOR.DELETE_STS_REF (
  task_name      IN VARCHAR2 NOT NULL,
  sts_owner      IN VARCHAR2,
  workload_name  IN VARCHAR2 NOT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure removes a link between the current SQL Access Advisor task and a SQL tuning set.Use DELETE_STS_REF for any STS-based advisor runs. The older method of using DELETE_SQLWKLD_REF with parameter IS_STS=1 is only supported for backward compatibility. Furthermore, the DELETE_STS_REF function accepts an STS owner name, whereas DELETE_SQLWKLD_REF does not.

name: dbms_advisor.tune_mview

name: dbms_alert.register
descriptionText: This procedure lets a session register interest in an alert.

name: dbms_alert.remove
bodyFullText:
DBMS_ALERT.REMOVE (
   name  IN  VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure enables a session that is no longer interested in an alert to remove that alert from its registration list. Removing an alert reduces the amount of work done by signalers of the alert.

name: dbms_alert.removeall
bodyFullText: DBMS_ALERT.REMOVEALL;
descriptionText: This procedure removes all alerts for this session from the registration list. You should do this when the session is no longer interested in any alerts.

name: dbms_alert.set_defaults
bodyFullText:
DBMS_ALERT.SET_DEFAULTS (
   sensitivity  IN  NUMBER);
descriptionText: In case a polling loop is required, use the SET_DEFAULTS procedure to set the polling interval.

name: dbms_alert.signal
descriptionText: This procedure signals an alert. The effect of the SIGNAL call only occurs when the transaction in which it is made commits. If the transaction rolls back, SIGNAL has no effect.

name: dbms_alert.waitany
bodyFullText:
DBMS_ALERT.WAITANY (
   name      OUT  VARCHAR2,
   message   OUT  VARCHAR2,
   status    OUT  INTEGER,
   timeout   IN   NUMBER DEFAULT MAXWAIT);
descriptionText: Call this procedure to wait for an alert to occur for any of the alerts for which the current session is registered.

name: dbms_alert.waitone
bodyFullText:
DBMS_ALERT.WAITONE (
   name      IN   VARCHAR2,
   message   OUT  VARCHAR2,
   status    OUT  INTEGER,
   timeout   IN   NUMBER DEFAULT MAXWAIT);
descriptionText: This procedure waits for a specific alert to occur. An implicit COMMIT is issued before this procedure is executed. A session that is the first to signal an alert can also wait for the alert in a subsequent transaction. In this case, remember to commit after the signal and before the wait; otherwise, DBMS_LOCK.REQUEST (which is called by DBMS_ALERT) returns status 4.

name: dbms_app_cont.get_ltxid_outcome

descriptionText: This procedure sets a row in the V$SESSION_LONGOPS view. This is a view that is used to indicate the on-going progress of a long running operation. Some Oracle functions, such as parallel execution and Server Managed Recovery, use rows in this view to indicate the status of, for example, a database backup.

	, column_list => $2
	, operation => 'UPDATE'
	, compare => TRUE
	, apply_database_link => NULL
bodyFullText:
DBMS_APPLY_ADM.COMPARE_OLD_VALUES(
   object_name         IN VARCHAR2,
   column_list         IN VARCHAR2,
   operation           IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'UPDATE',
   compare             IN BOOLEAN  DEFAULT TRUE,
   apply_database_link IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);

DBMS_APPLY_ADM.COMPARE_OLD_VALUES(
   object_name         IN VARCHAR2,
   column_table        IN DBMS_UTILITY.LNAME_ARRAY,
   operation           IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'UPDATE',

   apply_database_link IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure specifies whether to compare the old values of one or more columns in a row logical change record (row LCR) with the current values of the corresponding columns at the destination site during apply. This procedure is relevant only for UPDATE and DELETE operations because only these operations result in old column values in row LCRs. The default is to compare old values for all columns.

name: dbms_apply_adm.set_global_instantiation_scn

source_database_name => $1

	, recursive => FALSE

  apply_database_link   IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
  recursive             IN  BOOLEAN   DEFAULT FALSE,
  source_root_name      IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure records the specified instantiation SCN for the specified source database and, optionally, for the schemas at the source database and the tables owned by these schemas. This procedure overwrites any existing instantiation SCN for the database, and, if it sets the instantiation SCN for a schema or a table, then it overwrites any existing instantiation SCN for the schema or table.

name: dbms_aq.listen
descriptionText: This procedure listens on one or more queues on behalf of a list of agents. The address field of the agent indicates the queue the agent wants to monitor. Only local queues are supported as addresses. Protocol is reserved for future use.

name: DBMS_AQADM.create_sharded_queue
body:
queue_name => $1
	, storage_clause => NULL
	, multiple_consumers => FALSE
	, max_retries => NULL
	, comment => NULL
bodyFullText:
CREATE_SHARDED_QUEUE (
    queue_name             IN VARCHAR2,
    storage_clause         IN VARCHAR2       DEFAULT NULL,
    multiple_consumers     IN BOOLEAN        DEFAULT FALSE,
    max_retries            IN NUMBER         DEFAULT NULL,
    comment                IN VARCHAR2       DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: CREATE_SHARDED_QUEUE is a new API in 12c Release 1 (12.1) to create a queue and its queue table as appropriate for a JMS sharded queue. This API cannot be used to create unsharded queues. JMS sharded queues must be created using this single integrated API that will automatically set AQ properties as needed for JMS.

name: dbms_aqadm.disable_db_access

DBMS_AQADM.DISABLE_DB_ACCESS (
  agent_name                IN VARCHAR2,
  db_username               IN VARCHAR2)

   destination_queue  IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);

bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.DROP_AQ_AGENT (
  agent_name                IN VARCHAR2)
descriptionText: This procedure drops an agent that was previously registered for Oracle Database Advanced Queuing Internet access.

name: dbms_aqadm.drop_queue
descriptionText: This procedure drops an existing queue.

name: dbms_aqadm.drop_queue_table
bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.DROP_QUEUE_TABLE (
   queue_table       IN    VARCHAR2,
   force             IN    BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   auto_commit       IN    BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);

name: dbms_aqadm.drop_sharded_queue
bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.DROP_SHARDED_QUEUE( 
       queue_name IN VARCHAR2, 
       force      IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE )
descriptionText: This procedure drops an existing sharded queue from the database queuing system. You must stop the queue before calling DROP_SHARDED_QUEUE. User must stop the queue explicitly if force is set to FALSE before calling DROP_SHARDED_QUEUE. If force is set to TRUE then queue will be stopped internally and then dropped.

name: dbms_aqadm.enable_db_access
bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.ENABLE_DB_ACCESS (
  agent_name                IN VARCHAR2,
  db_username               IN VARCHAR2)

name: dbms_aqadm.enable_jms_types
bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.ENABLE_JMS_TYPES (
   queue_table   IN   VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: Enqueue of JMS types and XML types does not work with Oracle Streams Sys.Anydata queues unless you call this procedure after DBMS_STREAMS_ADM.SET_UP_QUEUE. Enabling an Oracle Streams queue for these types may affect import/export of the queue table.

name: dbms_aqadm.enable_propagation_schedule
bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.ENABLE_PROPAGATION_SCHEDULE ( 
   queue_name         IN   VARCHAR2, 
   destination        IN   VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   destination_queue  IN   VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL);

bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.GET_MAX_STREAMS_POOL (
   value     OUT      NUMBER);
descriptionText: This procedure retrieves the value of Oracle Database Advanced Queuing maximum streams pool memory limit.

name: dbms_aqadm.get_min_streams_pool
bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.GET_MIN_STREAMS_POOL (
   value     OUT      NUMBER);
descriptionText: This procedure retrieves the value of Oracle Database Advanced Queuing minimum streams pool memory limit.

name: dbms_aqadm.get_watermark
bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.GET_WATERMARK (
   wmvalue     IN      NUMBER);
descriptionText: This procedure retrieves the value of watermark set by SET_WATERMARK.

name: dbms_aqadm.grant_queue_privilege
bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.GRANT_QUEUE_PRIVILEGE (
   privilege        IN    VARCHAR2,
   queue_name       IN    VARCHAR2,
   grantee          IN    VARCHAR2,
   grant_option     IN    BOOLEAN := FALSE);
descriptionText: This procedure grants privileges on a queue to users and roles. The privileges are ENQUEUE or DEQUEUE. Initially, only the queue table owner can use this procedure to grant privileges on the queues.

name: dbms_aqadm.grant_system_privilege
bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.GRANT_SYSTEM_PRIVILEGE (
   privilege         IN    VARCHAR2,
   grantee           IN    VARCHAR2,
   admin_option      IN    BOOLEAN := FALSE);
descriptionText: This procedure grants Oracle Database Advanced Queuing system privileges to users and roles. The privileges are ENQUEUE_ANY, DEQUEUE_ANY, and MANAGE_ANY. Initially, only SYS and SYSTEM can use this procedure successfully.

name: dbms_aqadm.migrate_queue_table
descriptionText: This procedure upgrades an 8.0-compatible queue table to an 8.1-compatible or higher queue table, or downgrades an 8.1-compatible or higher queue table to an 8.0-compatible queue table.

name: dbms_aqadm.purge_queue_table
bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.PURGE_QUEUE_TABLE(
   queue_table        IN   VARCHAR2,
   purge_condition    IN   VARCHAR2,
   purge_options      IN   aq$_purge_options_t);
descriptionText: This procedure purges messages from queue tables. You can perform various purge operations on both single-consumer and multiconsumer queue tables for persistent and buffered messages.

name: dbms_aqadm.queue_subscribers
descriptionText: This function returns the subscribers to an 8.0-compatible multiconsumer queue in the PL/SQL index by table collection type DBMS_AQADM.AQ$_subscriber_list_t. Each element of the collection is of type sys.aq$_agent. This functionality is provided for 8.1-compatible queues by the AQ$queue_table_name_S view.

name: dbms_aqadm.remove_subscriber
descriptionText: This procedure removes a default subscriber from a queue. This operation takes effect immediately, and the containing transaction is committed. All references to the subscriber in existing messages are removed as part of the operation.

name: dbms_aqadm.revoke_queue_privilege
bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.REVOKE_QUEUE_PRIVILEGE (
   privilege         IN      VARCHAR2,
   queue_name        IN      VARCHAR2,
   grantee           IN      VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure revokes privileges on a queue from users and roles. The privileges are ENQUEUE or DEQUEUE.

name: dbms_aqadm.revoke_system_privilege

name: dbms_assert.noop

name: dbms_audit_mgmt.clean_audit_trail
body:
audit_trail_type => $1

	, container => CONTAINER_CURRENT
	, database_id => NULL
	, container_guid => NULL
bodyFullText:
DBMS_AUDIT_MGMT.CLEAN_AUDIT_TRAIL(
   audit_trail_type         IN PLS_INTEGER,

   database_id              IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
   container_guid           IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure deletes audit trail records. The CLEAN_AUDIT_TRAIL procedure is usually called after the SET_LAST_ARCHIVE_TIMESTAMP Procedure has been used to set the last archived timestamp for the audit records.

name: dbms_audit_mgmt.deinit_cleanup
descriptionText: This procedure undoes the setup and initialization performed by the INIT_CLEANUP Procedure. The DEINIT_CLEANUP procedure clears the value of the default_cleanup_interval parameter. However, when used for audit tables, it does not move the audit trail tables back to their original tablespace.

bodyFullText:

   container_guid    IN VARCHAR2) ;
descriptionText: This procedure drops old unified audit tables following the cloning of a pluggable database (PDB).

bodyFullText:
DBMS_AUDIT_MGMT.DROP_PURGE_JOB(
   audit_trail_purge_name    IN VARCHAR2) ;
descriptionText: This procedure drops the purge job created using the CREATE_PURGE_JOB Procedure. The name of the purge job is passed as an argument.

name: dbms_audit_mgmt.flush_unified_audit_trail
descriptionText: This procedure writes the unified audit trail records in the SGA queue to disk.

name: dbms_audit_mgmt.get_audit_commit_delay
bodyFullText:
DBMS_AUDIT_MGMT.GET_AUDIT_COMMIT_DELAY
  RETURN NUMBER;
descriptionText: This function returns the audit commit delay time as the number of seconds. audit commit delay time is the maximum time that it takes to COMMIT an audit record to the database audit trail. If it takes more time to COMMIT an audit record than defined by the audit commit delay time, then a copy of the audit record is written to the operating system (OS) audit trail.

name: dbms_audit_mgmt.get_last_archive_timestamp
bodyFullText:
DBMS_AUDIT_MGMT.GET_LAST_ARCHIVE_TIMESTAMP(
   audit_trail_type         IN PLS_INTEGER,
   audit_trail_property     IN PLS_INTEGER)
 RETURN NUMBER;
descriptionText: This procedure returns the property value set by the SET_AUDIT_TRAIL_PROPERTY Procedure.

name: dbms_audit_mgmt.init_cleanup
bodyFullText:
DBMS_AUDIT_MGMT.INIT_CLEANUP(
   audit_trail_type          IN PLS_INTEGER,
   default_cleanup_interval  IN PLS_INTEGER
   container                 IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT CONTAINER_CURRENT);
descriptionText: This procedure sets up the audit management infrastructure and a default cleanup interval for the audit trail records. If the audit trail tables are in the SYSTEM tablespace, then the procedure moves them to the SYSAUX tablespace. If you are using unified auditing, you do not need to run this procedure because the unified audit trail tables are in the SYSAUX tablespace by default. If you are not using unified auditing, refer to Oracle Database Upgrade Guide for documentation which references an environment without unified auditing.

name: dbms_audit_mgmt.is_cleanup_initialized
bodyFullText:
DBMS_AUDIT_MGMT.IS_CLEANUP_INITIALIZED(
   audit_trail_type  IN PLS_INTEGER
   container         IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT CONTAINER_CURRENT)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;
descriptionText: This function checks to see if the INIT_CLEANUP Procedure has been run for an audit trail type. The IS_CLEANUP_INITIALIZED function returns TRUE if the procedure has already been run for the audit trail type. It returns FALSE if the procedure has not been run for the audit trail type.

name: dbms_audit_mgmt.load_unified_audit_files

name: dbms_audit_mgmt.set_audit_trail_location

name: dbms_audit_mgmt.set_purge_job_interval

name: dbms_audit_mgmt.set_purge_job_status

name: dbms_auto_report.finish_report_capture

descriptionText: This procedure obtains an XML report of the list of SQL Monitor and Real-time ADDM data captured in AWR. The input parameters can be used to select and restrict which captured data will be included in the list report. All parameters are optional.

name: dbms_auto_report.start_report_capture
bodyFullText: DBMS_AUTO_REPORT.START_REPORT_CAPTURE;
descriptionText: This procedure captures SQL monitor data of any newly monitored SQLs every minute since the last run of the capture cycle, and stores it in AWR. Every capture cycle attempts to capture data for SQLs that are not currently executing or queued. This is a complete capture since data of all newly monitored SQLs is captured. It continues to run every minute until it is explicitly ended with the FINISH_REPORT_CAPTURE Procedure. In the case of a RAC system, the capture will start on each node of the cluster.

name: dbms_auto_task_admin.enable
bodyFullText: DBMS_AUTO_TASK_ADMIN.ENABLE;
descriptionText: This procedure allows a previously disabled client, operation, target type, or individual target to be enabled under AUTOTASK control. Specifying the DEFERRED option postpones the effect of the call until the start of the next maintenance window. If IMMEDIATE option is specified the effect of this call is immediate – as long as there is a currently open maintenance window.

name: dbms_capture_adm.drop_capture
descriptionText: This procedure drops a capture process.

name: dbms_capture_adm.include_extra_attribute

   attribute_name  IN  VARCHAR2,
   include         IN  BOOLEAN   DEFAULT TRUE);
descriptionText: This procedure includes or excludes an extra attribute in logical change records (LCRs) captured by the specified capture process or synchronous capture.

name: dbms_capture_adm.prepare_global_instantiation
descriptionText: This procedure performs the synchronization necessary for instantiating all the tables in the database at another database and can enable supplemental logging for key columns or all columns in these tables. This procedure prepares the tables in the database for instantiation when a capture process will be used to capture changes to the tables in the database.

name: dbms_capture_adm.prepare_schema_instantiation
bodyFullText:
DBMS_CAPTURE_ADM.PREPARE_SCHEMA_INSTANTIATION(
   schema_name           IN  VARCHAR2,
   supplemental_logging  IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT 'KEYS',
   container             IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT 'CURRENT');
descriptionText: This procedure performs the synchronization necessary for instantiating all tables in the schema at another database and can enable supplemental logging for key columns or all columns in these tables. This procedure prepares the tables in the schema for instantiation when a capture process will be used to capture changes to the tables in the schema.

name: dbms_capture_adm.prepare_sync_instantiation
descriptionText: This function performs the synchronization necessary for instantiating one or more tables at another database. This function returns the prepare system change number (SCN) for the table or tables being prepared for instantiation.

name: dbms_capture_adm.prepare_table_instantiation
bodyFullText:
DBMS_CAPTURE_ADM.PREPARE_TABLE_INSTANTIATION(
   table_name            IN  VARCHAR2,
   supplemental_logging  IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT 'KEYS',
   container             IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT 'CURRENT');
descriptionText: This procedure performs the synchronization necessary for instantiating the table at another database and can enable supplemental logging for key columns or all columns in the table. This procedure prepares the table for instantiation when a capture process will be used to capture changes to the table.

name: dbms_capture_adm.set_parameter
bodyFullText:
DBMS_CAPTURE_ADM.SET_PARAMETER(
   capture_name  IN  VARCHAR2,
   parameter     IN  VARCHAR2,

name: dbms_capture_adm.start_capture
bodyFullText:
DBMS_CAPTURE_ADM.START_CAPTURE(
   capture_name  IN  VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure starts the capture process, which mines redo logs and enqueues the mined redo information into the associated queue.

name: dbms_capture_adm.stop_capture
descriptionText: This procedure stops the capture process from mining redo logs.

DBMS_CQ_NOTIFICATION.CQ_NOTIFICATION_QUERYID
 RETURN NUMBER;

name: dbms_cq_notification.deregister
bodyFullText:
DBMS_CQ_NOTIFICATION.DEREGISTER (
  regid IN NUMBER);
descriptionText: This procedure desubscribes the client with the specified registration identifier (ID).

name: dbms_cq_notification.enable_reg
bodyFullText:
DBMS_CQ_NOTIFICATION.ENABLE_REG (  
  regid IN NUMBER);
descriptionText: This procedure adds objects to an existing registration identifier (ID). It is similar to the interface for creating a new registration, except that it takes an existing regid to which to add objects.Subsequent execution of queries causes the objects referenced in the queries to be added to the specified regid, and the registration is completed on invoking the REG_END Procedure.

name: dbms_cq_notification.new_reg_start
descriptionText: This procedure begins a new registration block. Any objects referenced by queries executed within the registration block are considered interesting objects and added to the registration. The registration block ends upon calling the REG_END procedure.

name: dbms_cq_notification.reg_end
bodyFullText: DBMS_CQ_NOTIFICATION.REG_END;
descriptionText: This procedure marks the end of the registration block. No newly executed queries are tracked.

name: dbms_cq_notification.set_rowid_threshold
descriptionText: This procedure configures the maximum number of rows of a table published in a change notification if the rows of the table are modified in a transaction.

name: dbms_crypto.decrypt

   src IN RAW,
   typ IN PLS_INTEGER,
   key IN RAW,
   iv  IN RAW DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN RAW;
descriptionText: This function decrypts RAW data using a stream or block cipher with a user supplied key and optional IV (initialization vector).

name: dbms_crypto.encrypt
bodyFullText:
DBMS_CRYPTO.ENCRYPT(
   src IN RAW,
   typ IN PLS_INTEGER,
   key IN RAW,
   iv  IN RAW          DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN RAW;
descriptionText: This function encrypts RAW data using a stream or block cipher with a user supplied key and optional IV (initialization vector).

name: dbms_crypto.hash
bodyFullText:
DBMS_CRYPTO.Hash (
   src IN RAW,
   typ IN PLS_INTEGER)
 RETURN RAW;

DBMS_CRYPTO.Hash (
   src IN BLOB,
   typ IN PLS_INTEGER)
 RETURN RAW;

DBMS_CRYPTO.Hash (
   src IN CLOB CHARACTER SET ANY_CS,
   typ IN PLS_INTEGER)
 RETURN RAW;
descriptionText: A one-way hash function takes a variable-length input string, the data, and converts it to a fixed-length (generally smaller) output string called a hash value. The hash value serves as a unique identifier (like a fingerprint) of the input data. You can use the hash value to verify whether data has been changed or not.

name: dbms_crypto.mac
bodyFullText:
DBMS_CRYPTO.MAC (
   src IN RAW,
   typ IN PLS_INTEGER,
   key IN RAW)
 RETURN RAW;

DBMS_CRYPTO.MAC (
   src IN BLOB,
   typ IN PLS_INTEGER
   key IN RAW)
 RETURN RAW;

DBMS_CRYPTO.MAC (
   src IN CLOB CHARACTER SET ANY_CS,
   typ IN PLS_INTEGER
   key IN RAW)
 RETURN RAW;
descriptionText: A Message Authentication Code, or MAC, is a key-dependent one-way hash function. MACs have the same properties as the one-way hash function described in "HASH Function", but they also include a key. Only someone with the identical key can verify the hash. Also refer to "When to Use Hash or Message Authentication Code (MAC) Functions" for more information about using MACs.

name: dbms_crypto.randombytes
descriptionText: This function returns a RAW value containing a cryptographically secure pseudo-random sequence of bytes, which can be used to generate random material for encryption keys. The RANDOMBYTES function is based on the RSA X9.31 PRNG (Pseudo-Random Number Generator).

name: dbms_crypto.randominteger
bodyFullText:
DBMS_CRYPTO.RANDOMINTEGER
 RETURN BINARY_INTEGER;
descriptionText: This function returns an integer in the complete range available for the Oracle BINARY_INTEGER datatype.

name: dbms_crypto.randomnumber
bodyFullText:
DBMS_CRYPTO.RANDOMNUMBER
 RETURN NUMBER;
descriptionText: This function returns an integer in the Oracle NUMBER datatype in the range of [0..2**128-1].

descriptionText: This procedure creates an Oracle OLAP 12c analytic workspace from a copy of the metadata contained in an OLAP 10g analytic workspace. The original OLAP 10g analytic workspace is not affected and can exist at the same time and in the same schema as the OLAP 12c analytic workspace.

name: dbms_cube.validate_xml
descriptionText: This procedure checks the XML to assure that it is valid without committing the results to the database. It does not create an analytic workspace.

name: dbms_cube_advise.mv_cube_advice
bodyFullText:
DBMS_CUBE_ADVISE.MV_CUBE_ADVICE (
          owner        IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT USER,
          mvname       IN  VARCHAR2,
          reqtype      IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT '0',
          validate     IN  NUMBER    DEFAULT 0)
     RETURN COAD_ADVICE_T  PIPELINED;
descriptionText: This table function evaluates the metadata for a specified cube materialized view. It generates recommendations and returns them as a SQL result set. These SQL statements can be used to create constraints, SQL dimension objects, and materialized view logs that allow the broadest range of query rewrite transformations and log-based fast refresh of the cube materialized view.

name: dbms_data_mining.get_model_details_em
body:
model_name => $1
	, cluster_id => NULL
	, attribute => NULL
	, centroid => 1
	, histogram => 1
	, rules => 2
	, attribute_subname => NULL
	, topn_attributes => NULL
bodyNoDefault:
model_name => $1
	, cluster_id => $2
	, attribute => $3
	, centroid => $4
	, histogram => $5
	, rules => $6
	, attribute_subname => $7
	, topn_attributes => $8
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DATA_MINING.GET_MODEL_DETAILS_EM (
          model_name         VARCHAR2,
          cluster_id         NUMBER    DEFAULT NULL,
          attribute          VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
          centroid           NUMBER    DEFAULT 1, 
          histogram          NUMBER    DEFAULT 1, 
          rules              NUMBER    DEFAULT 2,
          attribute_subname  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
          topn_attributes    NUMBER    DEFAULT NULL)
RETURN DM_CLUSTERS PIPELINED;
descriptionText: This table function returns a set of rows that provide statistics about the clusters produced by an Expectation Maximization model.

name: dbms_data_mining.get_model_details_em_comp
descriptionText: This table function returns a set of rows that provide details about the parameters of an Expectation Maximization model.

name: dbms_data_mining.get_model_details_em_proj
descriptionText: This table function returns a set of rows that provide statistics about the projections produced by an Expectation Maximization model.

name: dbms_data_mining.get_model_details_glm
descriptionText: This table function returns the coefficient statistics for a Generalized Linear Model.

name: dbms_data_mining.get_model_details_global
descriptionText: This table function returns statistics about the model as a whole. Global details are available for Generalized Linear Models, Association Rules, Singular Value Decomposition, and Expectation Maximization.

name: dbms_data_mining.get_model_details_km

model_name => $1
	, cluster_id => NULL

name: dbms_data_mining.get_model_details_nb
descriptionText: This table function returns a set of rows that provide the details of a Naive Bayes model.

name: dbms_data_mining.get_model_details_nmf
descriptionText: This table function returns a set of rows that provide the details of a Non-Negative Matrix Factorization model.

name: dbms_data_mining.get_model_details_oc
body:
model_name => $1
	, cluster_id => NULL
	, attribute => NULL
	, centroid => 1
	, histogram => 1
	, rules => 2
	, topn_attributes => NULL
bodyNoDefault:
model_name => $1
	, cluster_id => $2
	, attribute => $3
	, centroid => $4
	, histogram => $5

bodyFullText:
DBMS_DATA_MINING.GET_MODEL_DETAILS_OC (
          model_name         VARCHAR2,
          cluster_id         NUMBER    DEFAULT NULL,

RETURN DM_CLUSTERS PIPELINED;

name: dbms_data_mining.get_model_details_svd
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DATA_MINING.GET_MODEL_DETAILS_SVD (
        model_name        VARCHAR2,
        matrix_type       VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN DM_SVD_MATRIX_SET PIPELINED;
descriptionText: This table function returns a set of rows that provide the details of a Singular Value Decomposition model.

name: dbms_data_mining.get_model_details_svm
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DATA_MINING.GET_MODEL_DETAILS_SVM (
        model_name        VARCHAR2,
        reverse_coef      NUMBER DEFAULT 0)
 RETURN DM_SVM_LINEAR_COEFF_SET PIPELINED;
descriptionText: This table function returns a set of rows that provide the details of a linear Support Vector Machine (SVM) model. If invoked for nonlinear SVM, it returns ORA-40215.

name: dbms_data_mining.get_model_details_xml
descriptionText: This function returns an XML object that provides the details of a Decision Tree model.

name: dbms_data_mining.get_model_transformations
descriptionText: This function returns the transformation expressions embedded in the specified model.

name: dbms_data_mining.get_transform_list
descriptionText: This procedure converts transformation expressions specified as DM_TRANSFORMS to a transformation list (TRANSFORM_LIST) that can be used in creating a model. DM_TRANSFORMS is returned by the GET_MODEL_TRANSFORMATIONS function.

name: dbms_data_mining.import_model
body:
filename => $1
	, directory => $2
	, model_filter => NULL
	, operation => NULL
	, remote_link => NULL
	, jobname => NULL
	, schema_remap => NULL
	, tablespace_remap => NULL
bodyNoDefault:
filename => $1
	, directory => $2
	, model_filter => $3
	, operation => $4
	, remote_link => $5
	, jobname => $6
	, schema_remap => $7
	, tablespace_remap => $8
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DATA_MINING.IMPORT_MODEL (
      filename          IN  VARCHAR2,
      directory         IN  VARCHAR2,
      model_filter      IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
      operation         IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
      remote_link       IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
      jobname           IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
      schema_remap      IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
      tablespace_remap  IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure imports one or more data mining models. The procedure is overloaded. You can call it to import mining models from a dump file set, or you can call it to import a single mining model from a PMML document.

name: dbms_data_mining.rank_apply
body:
apply_result_table_name => $1
	, case_id_column_name => $2
	, score_column_name => $3
	, score_criterion_column_name => $4
	, ranked_apply_table_name => $5
	, top_N => 1
	, cost_matrix_table_name => NULL
	, apply_result_schema_name => NULL
	, cost_matrix_schema_name => NULL
bodyNoDefault:
apply_result_table_name => $1
	, case_id_column_name => $2
	, score_column_name => $3
	, score_criterion_column_name => $4
	, ranked_apply_table_name => $5
	, top_N => $6
	, cost_matrix_table_name => $7
	, apply_result_schema_name => $8
	, cost_matrix_schema_name => $9
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DATA_MINING.RANK_APPLY (
      apply_result_table_name        IN VARCHAR2,
      case_id_column_name            IN VARCHAR2,
      score_column_name              IN VARCHAR2,
      score_criterion_column_name    IN VARCHAR2,
      ranked_apply_table_name        IN VARCHAR2,
      top_N                          IN NUMBER (38) DEFAULT 1,
      cost_matrix_table_name         IN VARCHAR2    DEFAULT NULL,
      apply_result_schema_name       IN VARCHAR2    DEFAULT NULL,
      cost_matrix_schema_name        IN VARCHAR2    DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure ranks the results of an APPLY operation based on a top-N specification for predictive and descriptive model results. For classification models, you can provide a cost matrix as input, and obtain the ranked results with costs applied to the predictions.

name: dbms_data_mining.remove_cost_matrix
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DATA_MINING.REMOVE_COST_MATRIX (
      model_name   IN  VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: Removes the default scoring matrix from a classification model.

name: dbms_data_mining.rename_model
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DATA_MINING.RENAME_MODEL (
     model_name            IN VARCHAR2,
     new_model_name        IN VARCHAR2,
     versioned_model_name  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure changes the name of the mining model indicated by model_name to the name that you specify as new_model_name. If a model with new_model_name already exists, then the procedure optionally renames new_model_name to versioned_model_name before renaming model_name to new_model_name.

name: dbms_data_mining_transform.create_bin_cat
descriptionText: This procedure creates a transformation definition table for categorical binning. The columns are described in Table 46-4.

name: dbms_data_mining_transform.create_bin_num
descriptionText: This procedure creates a transformation definition table for numerical binning. The columns are described in Table 46-6.

name: dbms_data_mining_transform.create_clip
descriptionText: This procedure creates a transformation definition table for clipping or winsorizing to minimize the effect of outliers. The columns are described in Table 46-8.

name: dbms_data_mining_transform.create_col_rem
descriptionText: This procedure creates a transformation definition table for removing columns from the data table. The columns are described in Table 46-10.

name: dbms_data_mining_transform.create_miss_cat
descriptionText: This procedure creates a transformation definition table for replacing categorical missing values. The columns are described in Table 46-12.

name: dbms_data_mining_transform.create_miss_num
descriptionText: This procedure creates a transformation definition table for replacing numerical missing values. The columns are described in Table 46-14.

name: dbms_data_mining_transform.create_norm_lin
descriptionText: This procedure creates a transformation definition table for linear normalization. The columns are described in Table 46-16.

name: dbms_data_mining_transform.describe_stack
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DATA_MINING_TRANSFORM.DESCRIBE_STACK (
     xform_list           IN  TRANSFORM_LIST,
     data_table_name      IN  VARCHAR2,
     describe_list        OUT DESCRIBE_LIST,
     data_schema_name     IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure describes the columns of the data table after a list of transformations has been applied. Only the columns that are specified in the transformation list are transformed. The remaining columns in the data table are included in the output without changes.

name: dbms_data_mining_transform.get_expression
descriptionText: This function returns a row from a VARCHAR2 array that stores a transformation expression. The array is built by calls to the SET_EXPRESSION Procedure.

body:
bin_table_name => $1
	, data_table_name => $2
	, bin_num => 3
	, max_bin_num => 100
	, exclude_list => NULL
	, round_num => 6
	, sample_size => 50000

	, rem_table_name => NULL
	, rem_schema_name => NULL
bodyNoDefault:

	, data_table_name => $2
	, bin_num => $3
	, max_bin_num => $4
	, exclude_list => $5
	, round_num => $6
	, sample_size => $7
	, bin_schema_name => $8
	, data_schema_name => $9
	, rem_table_name => $10
	, rem_schema_name => $11
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DATA_MINING_TRANSFORM.INSERT_AUTOBIN_NUM_EQWIDTH (
     bin_table_name        IN VARCHAR2,
     data_table_name       IN VARCHAR2,
     bin_num               IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT 3,
     max_bin_num           IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT 100,
     exclude_list          IN COLUMN_LIST DEFAULT NULL,
     round_num             IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT 6,
     sample_size           IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT 50000,

     data_schema_name      IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
     rem_table_name        IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
     rem_schema_name       IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL));
descriptionText: This procedure performs numerical binning and inserts the transformation definitions in a transformation definition table. The procedure identifies the minimum and maximum values and computes the bin boundaries at equal intervals.

name: dbms_data_mining_transform.set_expression
descriptionText: This procedure appends a row to a VARCHAR2 array that stores a SQL expression. The array can be used for specifying a transformation expression that is too long to be used with the SET_TRANSFORM Procedure.

body:

	, attribute_name => $2
	, attribute_subname => $3
	, expression => $4
	, reverse_expression => $5
	, attribute_spec => NULL
bodyNoDefault:

	, attribute_name => $2
	, attribute_subname => $3
	, expression => $4
	, reverse_expression => $5
	, attribute_spec => $6

DBMS_DATA_MINING_TRANSFORM.SET_TRANSFORM (
          xform_list               IN OUT NOCOPY TRANSFORM_LIST,
          attribute_name           VARCHAR2,
          attribute_subname        VARCHAR2,
          expression               VARCHAR2,
          reverse_expression       VARCHAR2,
          attribute_spec           VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure appends the transformation instructions for an attribute to a transformation list.

	, store_name => NULL
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT.CHECKACCESS (
   path           IN     VARCHAR2,
   pathtype       IN     INTEGER,
   operation      IN     VARCHAR2,
   principal      IN     VARCHAR2,
   store_name     IN     VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN  BOOLEAN;
descriptionText: This function reports if the user (principal) can perform the specified operation on the given path. This enables verifying the validity of an operation without attempting to perform the operation. If CHECKACCESS returns 0, then the subprogram invoked to implement that operation should fail with an error.

DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT.CREATEREFERENCE (
   srcPath     IN              VARCHAR2,
   dstPath     IN              VARCHAR2,
   properties  IN OUT NOCOPY   PROPERTIES_T,
   prop_flags  IN              INTEGER     DEFAULT PROP_STD,
   store_name  IN              VARCHAR2    DEFAULT NULL,
   principal   IN              VARCHAR2    DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure creates a physical link, srcPath, to an already existing file system element, dstPath (such as file or directory). The resulting entry shares the same metadata structures as the value of the dstPath parameter, and so is similar to incrementing a reference count on the file system element. This is analogous to a UNIX file system hard link.

	, operation => $3
	, principal => $4
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT_SPI.CHECKACCESS (
   store_name     IN     VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   path           IN     VARCHAR2,
   pathtype       IN     INTEGER,
   operation      IN     VARCHAR2,
   principal      IN     VARCHAR2)
  RETURN  INTEGER;
descriptionText: This function reports if the user (principal) can perform the specified operation on the given path. This enables verifying the validity of an operation without attempting to perform the operation. If CHECKACCESS returns 0, then the subprogram invoked to implement that operation should fail with an error.

   ctx           IN              DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT_CONTEXT_T);
descriptionText: This procedure creates a physical link to an already existing file system element (such as file or directory). The resulting entry shares the same metadata structures as the value of the srcPath parameter, and so is similar to incrementing a reference count on the file system element. This is analogous to a UNIX file system hard link.

name: dbms_dbfs_sfs.createstore

store_name => $1

name: dbms_dbfs_sfs.dropfilesystem
descriptionText: This procedure drops the DBFS SFS store, purging all dictionary information associated with the store, and dropping the underlying file system table.

name: dbms_dbfs_sfs.initfs
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DBFS_SFS.INITFS (
   store_name     IN      VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure initialize a POSIX file system store. The table associated with the POSIX file system store store_name is truncated and reinitialized with a single "root" directory entry.

name: dbms_ddl.alter_compile
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DDL.ALTER_COMPILE (
   type             VARCHAR2, 
   schema           VARCHAR2, 
   name             VARCHAR2
   reuse_settings   BOOLEAN := FALSE);
descriptionText: This procedure is equivalent to the following SQL statement:

name: dbms_ddl.alter_table_not_referenceable
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DDL.ALTER_TABLE_NOT_REFERENCEABLE (
   table_name        IN           VARCHAR2,
   table_schema      IN  DEFAULT  NULL,
   affected_schema   IN  DEFAULT  NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure alters the given object table table_schema.table_name so it becomes not the default referenceable table for the schema affected_schema. This is equivalent to SQL

name: dbms_ddl.alter_table_referenceable
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DDL.ALTER_TABLE_REFERENCEABLE
   table_name       IN  VARCHAR2,
   table_schema     IN  DEFAULT  NULL,
   affected_schema  IN  DEFAULT  NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure alters the given object table table_schema.table_name so it becomes the referenceable table for the given schema affected_schema. This is equivalent to SQL

name: dbms_ddl.create_wrapped
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DDL.CREATE_WRAPPED (
   ddl     VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: The procedure takes as input a single CREATE OR REPLACE statement that specifies creation of a PL/SQL package specification, package body, function, procedure, type specification or type body. It then generates a CREATE OR REPLACE statement with the PL/SQL source text obfuscated and executes the generated statement. In effect, this procedure bundles together the operations of wrapping the text and creating the PL/SQL unit.

name: dbms_ddl.is_trigger_fire_once
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DDL.IS_TRIGGER_FIRE_ONCE
   trig_owner         IN  VARCHAR2,
   trig_name          IN  VARCHAR2)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;
descriptionText: This function returns TRUE if the specified DML or DDL trigger is set to fire once. Otherwise, it returns FALSE.

name: dbms_ddl.set_trigger_firing_property
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DDL.SET_TRIGGER_FIRING_PROPERTY (
   trig_owner         IN  VARCHAR2,
   trig_name          IN  VARCHAR2,
   fire_once          IN  BOOLEAN);

DBMS_DDL.SET_TRIGGER_FIRING_PROPERTY (
   trig_owner         IN  VARCHAR2,
   trig_name          IN  VARCHAR2,
   property           IN INTEGER,
   setting            IN BOOLEAN);
descriptionText: This procedure sets the specified DML or DDL trigge\'s firing property whether or not the property is set for the trigger. Use this procedure to control a DML or DDL trigge\'s firing property for changes:

name: dbms_ddl.wrap
descriptionText: This function takes as input a single CREATE OR REPLACE statement that specifies creation of a PL/SQL package specification, package body, function, procedure, type specification or type body and returns a CREATE OR REPLACE statement where the text of the PL/SQL unit has been obfuscated.

name: dbms_debug.attach_session
descriptionText: This procedure notifies the debug session about the target program.

name: dbms_debug.continue
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DEBUG.CONTINUE (
   run_info       IN OUT runtime_info,
   breakflags     IN     BINARY_INTEGER,
   info_requested IN     BINARY_INTEGER := NULL)
  RETURN BINARY_INTEGER;
descriptionText: This function passes the given breakflags (a mask of the events that are of interest) to Probe in the target process. It tells Probe to continue execution of the target process, and it waits until the target process runs to completion or signals an event.

name: dbms_debug.debug_off
bodyFullText: DBMS_DEBUG.DEBUG_OFF;
descriptionText: Caution:

name: dbms_debug.debug_on
descriptionText: This procedure marks the target session so that all PL/SQL is run in debug mode. This must be done before any debugging can take place.

name: dbms_debug.delete_breakpoint
descriptionText: This function deletes a breakpoint.

name: dbms_debug.delete_oer_breakpoint
descriptionText: This function deletes an OER breakpoint.

name: dbms_debug.detach_session
bodyFullText: DBMS_DEBUG.DETACH_SESSION;
descriptionText: This procedure stops debugging the target program. This procedure may be called at any time, but it does not notify the target session that the debug session is detaching itself, and it does not terminate execution of the target session. Therefore, care should be taken to ensure that the target session does not hang itself.

name: dbms_debug.disable_breakpoint
descriptionText: This function makes an existing breakpoint inactive but leaves it in place.

name: dbms_debug.enable_breakpoint
descriptionText: This function is the reverse of disabling. This enables a previously disabled breakpoint.

name: dbms_debug.execute
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DEBUG.EXECUTE (
   what         IN VARCHAR2,
   frame#       IN BINARY_INTEGER,
   bind_results IN BINARY_INTEGER,
   results      IN OUT NOCOPY dbms_debug_vc2coll,
   errm         IN OUT NOCOPY VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure executes SQL or PL/SQL code in the target session. The target session is assumed to be waiting at a breakpoint (or other event). The call to DBMS_DEBUG.EXECUTE occurs in the debug session, which then asks the target session to execute the code.

name: dbms_debug.get_indexes
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DEBUG.GET_INDEXES (
   varname   IN  VARCHAR2,
   frame#    IN  BINARY_INTEGER,
   handle    IN  program_info,
   entries   OUT index_table) 
RETURN BINARY_INTEGER;
descriptionText: Given a name of a variable or parameter, this function returns the set of its indexes, if it is an indexed table. An error is returned if it is not an indexed table.

name: dbms_debug.get_line_map
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DEBUG.GET_LINE_MAP (
   program                IN   program_info,
   maxline                OUT  BINARY_INTEGER,
   number_of_entry_points OUT  BINARY_INTEGER,
   linemap                OUT  RAW)
  RETURN BINARY_INTEGER;
descriptionText: This function finds line and entrypoint information about a program so that a debugger can determine the source lines at which it is possible to place breakpoints.

name: dbms_debug.get_more_source
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DEBUG.GET_MORE_SOURCE (
   buffer          IN OUT VARCHAR2,
   buflen          IN BINARY_INTEGER,
   piece#          IN BINARY_INTEGER);
descriptionText: When source does not fit in the buffer provided by that version of the SHOW_SOURCE Procedures which produce a formatted buffer, this procedure provides additional source.

name: dbms_debug.get_runtime_info
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DEBUG.GET_RUNTIME_INFO (
   info_requested  IN  BINARY_INTEGER,
   run_info        OUT runtime_info)
  RETURN BINARY_INTEGER;
descriptionText: This function returns information about the current program. It is only needed if the info_requested parameter to SYNCHRONIZE or CONTINUE was set to 0.

name: dbms_debug.get_timeout_behaviour
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DEBUG.GET_TIMEOUT_BEHAVIOUR
 RETURN BINARY_INTEGER;
descriptionText: This procedure returns the current timeout behavior. This call is made in the target session.

name: dbms_debug.get_value
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DEBUG.GET_VALUE (
   variable_name  IN  VARCHAR2,
   frame#         IN  BINARY_INTEGER,
   scalar_value   OUT VARCHAR2,
   format         IN  VARCHAR2 := NULL)
RETURN BINARY_INTEGER;
descriptionText: This function gets a value from the currently-running program. There are two overloaded GET_VALUE functions.

name: dbms_debug.initialize
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DEBUG.INITIALIZE (
   debug_session_id  IN VARCHAR2       := NULL, 
   diagnostics       IN BINARY_INTEGER := 0)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function initializes the target session for debugging.

name: dbms_debug.ping
bodyFullText: DBMS_DEBUG.PING;
descriptionText: This procedure pings the target session to prevent it from timing out. Use this procedure when execution is suspended in the target session, for example at a breakpoint.

name: dbms_debug.print_backtrace
descriptionText: This procedure prints a backtrace listing of the current execution stack. This should only be called if a program is currently running.

name: dbms_debug.print_instantiations
descriptionText: This procedure returns a list of the packages that have been instantiated in the current session.

name: dbms_debug.probe_version
descriptionText: This procedure returns the version number of DBMS_DEBUG on the server.

name: dbms_debug.self_check
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DEBUG.SELF_CHECK (
   timeout IN binary_integer := 60);
descriptionText: This procedure performs an internal consistency check. SELF_CHECK also runs a communications test to ensure that the Probe processes are able to communicate.

name: dbms_debug.set_breakpoint
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DEBUG.SET_BREAKPOINT (
   program     IN  program_info,
   line#       IN  BINARY_INTEGER,
   breakpoint# OUT BINARY_INTEGER,
   fuzzy       IN  BINARY_INTEGER := 0,
   iterations  IN  BINARY_INTEGER := 0)
  RETURN BINARY_INTEGER;
descriptionText: This function sets a breakpoint in a program unit, which persists for the current session. Execution pauses if the target program reaches the breakpoint.

name: dbms_debug.set_oer_breakpoint
descriptionText: This function sets an OER breakpoint.

name: dbms_debug.set_timeout
descriptionText: This function sets the timeout value and returns the new timeout value.

name: dbms_debug.set_timeout_behaviour
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DEBUG.SET_TIMEOUT_BEHAVIOUR (
   behaviour IN PLS_INTEGER);
descriptionText: This procedure tells Probe what to do with the target session when a timeout occurs. This call is made in the target session.

name: dbms_debug.set_value
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DEBUG.SET_VALUE (
   frame#               IN binary_integer,
   assignment_statement IN varchar2) 
  RETURN BINARY_INTEGER;

DBMS_DEBUG.SET_VALUE (
   handle               IN program_info,
   assignment_statement IN VARCHAR2) 
  RETURN BINARY_INTEGER;
descriptionText: This function sets a value in the currently-running program. There are two overloaded SET_VALUE functions.

name: dbms_debug.show_breakpoints
descriptionText: There are two overloaded procedures that return a listing of the current breakpoints. There are three overloaded SHOW_BREAKPOINTS procedures.

name: dbms_debug.show_frame_source
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DEBUG.SHOW_FRAME_SOURCE (
   first_line  IN            BINARY_INTEGER,
   last_line   IN            BINARY_INTEGER,
   source      IN OUT NOCOPY vc2_table,
   frame_num   IN            BINARY_INTEGER);

name: dbms_debug.show_source
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DEBUG.SHOW_SOURCE (
   first_line  IN   BINARY_INTEGER,
   last_line   IN   BINARY_INTEGER,
   source      OUT  vc2_table);

DBMS_DEBUG.SHOW_SOURCE (
   first_line   IN     BINARY_INTEGER,
   last_line    IN     BINARY_INTEGER,
   window       IN     BINARY_INTEGER,
   print_arrow  IN     BINARY_INTEGER,
   buffer       IN OUT VARCHAR2,
   buflen       IN     BINARY_INTEGER,
   pieces       OUT    BINARY_INTEGER);
descriptionText: The procedure gets the source code. There are two overloaded SHOW_SOURCE procedures.

name: dbms_debug.synchronize
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DEBUG.SYNCHRONIZE (
   run_info       OUT  runtime_info,
   info_requested IN   BINARY_INTEGER := NULL)
  RETURN BINARY_INTEGER;
descriptionText: This function waits until the target program signals an event. If info_requested is not NULL, then it calls GET_RUNTIME_INFO.

name: dbms_debug.target_program_running
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DEBUG.TARGET_PROGRAM_RUNNING 
  RETURN BOOLEAN;
descriptionText: This procedure returns TRUE if the target session is currently executing a stored procedure, or FALSE if it is not.

name: dbms_defer.anydata_arg
descriptionText: This procedure provides the data that is to be passed to a deferred remote procedure call. Depending upon the type of the data that you must pass to a procedure, you must call one of the following procedures for each argument to the procedure.

name: dbms_defer.commit_work

name: dbms_defer.transaction

name: dbms_defer_sys.add_default_dest
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DEFER_SYS.ADD_DEFAULT_DEST (
   dblink   IN   VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure adds a destination database to the DEFDEFAULTDEST data dictionary view.

name: dbms_defer_sys.clear_prop_statistics
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DEFER_SYS.CLEAR_PROP_STATISTICS (
   dblink   IN   VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure clears the propagation statistics in the DEFSCHEDULE data dictionary view. When this procedure is executed successfully, all statistics in this view are returned to zero and statistic gathering starts fresh.

name: dbms_defer_sys.delete_def_destination
descriptionText: This procedure removes a destination database from the DEFSCHEDULE view.

name: dbms_defer_sys.delete_default_dest
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DEFER_SYS.DELETE_DEFAULT_DEST (
   dblink   IN   VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure removes a destination database from the DEFDEFAULTDEST view.

name: dbms_defer_sys.delete_error
descriptionText: This procedure deletes a transaction from the DEFERROR view.

name: dbms_defer_sys.delete_tran
descriptionText: This procedure deletes a transaction from the DEFTRANDEST view. If there are no other DEFTRANDEST or DEFERROR entries for the transaction, then the transaction is deleted from the DEFTRAN and DEFCALL views as well.

name: dbms_defer_sys.disabled
descriptionText: This function determines whether propagation of the deferred transaction queue from the current site to a specified site is enabled. The DISABLED function returns TRUE if the deferred remote procedure call (RPC) queue is disabled for the specified destination.

name: dbms_defer_sys.exclude_push
descriptionText: This function acquires an exclusive lock that prevents deferred transaction PUSH (either serial or parallel). This function performs a commit when acquiring the lock. The lock is acquired with RELEASE_ON_COMMIT => TRUE, so that pushing of the deferred transaction queue can resume after the next commit.

name: dbms_defer_sys.execute_error
descriptionText: This procedure reexecutes a deferred transaction that did not initially complete successfully in the security context of the original receiver of the transaction.

name: dbms_defer_sys.execute_error_as_user
descriptionText: This procedure reexecutes a deferred transaction that did not initially complete successfully. Each transaction is executed in the security context of the connected user.

name: dbms_defer_sys.purge
body:
purge_method => purge_method_quick
	, rollback_segment => NULL
	, startup_seconds => 0
	, execution_seconds => seconds_infinity
	, delay_seconds => 0
	, transaction_count => transactions_infinity
	, write_trace => NULL
bodyNoDefault:
purge_method => $1
	, rollback_segment => $2
	, startup_seconds => $3
	, execution_seconds => $4
	, delay_seconds => $5
	, transaction_count => $6
	, write_trace => $7
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DEFER_SYS.PURGE (
   purge_method         IN  BINARY_INTEGER := purge_method_quick,
   rollback_segment     IN  VARCHAR2       := NULL,
   startup_seconds      IN  BINARY_INTEGER := 0,
   execution_seconds    IN  BINARY_INTEGER := seconds_infinity,
   delay_seconds        IN  BINARY_INTEGER := 0,
   transaction_count    IN  BINARY_INTEGER := transactions_infinity,
   write_trace          IN  BOOLEAN        := NULL);
  RETURN BINARY_INTEGER;
descriptionText: This function purges pushed transactions from the deferred transaction queue at your current master site or materialized view site.

DBMS_DEFER_SYS.PUSH (

	, startup_seconds => $9
	, execution_seconds => $10
	, delay_seconds => $11
	, transaction_count => $12
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DEFER_SYS.SCHEDULE_PUSH (
   destination          IN  VARCHAR2,
   interval             IN  VARCHAR2,
   next_date            IN  DATE,
   reset                IN  BOOLEAN        := FALSE,
   parallelism          IN  BINARY_INTEGER := NULL,
   heap_size            IN  BINARY_INTEGER := NULL,
   stop_on_error        IN  BOOLEAN        := NULL,
   write_trace          IN  BOOLEAN        := NULL,
   startup_seconds      IN  BINARY_INTEGER := NULL,
   execution_seconds    IN  BINARY_INTEGER := NULL,
   delay_seconds        IN  BINARY_INTEGER := NULL,
   transaction_count    IN  BINARY_INTEGER := NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure schedules a job to push the deferred transaction queue to a remote site. This procedure performs a COMMIT.

name: dbms_defer_sys.set_disabled
body:
destination => $1
	, disabled => TRUE
	, catchup => '00'
	, override => FALSE
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DEFER_SYS.SET_DISABLED (
   destination   IN   VARCHAR2,
   disabled      IN   BOOLEAN := TRUE,
   catchup       IN   RAW := '00',
   override      IN   BOOLEAN := FALSE);
descriptionText: To disable or enable propagation of the deferred transaction queue from the current site to a specified destination site. If the disabled parameter is TRUE, then the procedure disables propagation to the specified destination and future invocations of PUSH do not push the deferred remote procedure call (RPC) queue. SET_DISABLED eventually affects a session already pushing the queue to the specified destination, but does not affect sessions appending to the queue with DBMS_DEFER.

name: dbms_defer_sys.unregister_propagator
descriptionText: To unregister a user as the propagator from the local database. This procedure:

DBMS_DEFER_SYS.UNSCHEDULE_PUSH (

name: dbms_distributed_trust_admin.allow_all

descriptionText: This procedure empties the Trusted Servers List and specifies that all servers that are members of a trusted domain in an enterprise directory service and that are in the same domain are allowed access.

bodyFullText:
DBMS_DISTRIBUTED_TRUST_ADMIN.ALLOW_SERVER (

name: dbms_distributed_trust_admin.deny_all
bodyFullText: DBMS_DISTRIBUTED_TRUST_ADMIN.DENY_ALL;

name: dbms_dnfs.clonedb_renamefile
descriptionText: This procedure is used to rename datafiles that were pointing to the backup set to the actual file name in cloned database. The srcfile is the file name that represents the data file in the backup image copy or a read-only storage snapshot. The destfile destination file path must point to a NFS volume where cloneDB datafiles will be created. When the procedure is run successfully, the control file record is updated with the new datafile name.

name: dbms_dst.begin_prepare
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DST.BEGIN_PREPARE (
   new_version                IN  BINARY_INTEGER);
descriptionText: This procedure starts a prepare window. Once a prepare window is started successfully, the database property\'DST_UPGRADE_STAT\' is set to\'PREPAR\', and the database property\'SECONDARY_TT_VERSIO\' is set to a new timezone version.

name: dbms_dst.begin_upgrade
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DST.BEGIN_UPGRADE (
   new_version                IN  BINARY_INTEGER,
   error_on_overlap_time      IN  BOOLEAN := FALSE,
   error_on_nonexisting_time  IN  BOOLEAN := FALSE);
descriptionText: This procedure starts an upgrade window. When an upgraded window is started successfully, the TSTZ data in the dictionary tables is upgraded to reflect the new timezone version, and the database property\'DST_UPGRADE_STAT\' is set to\'UPGRAD\'. Once BEGIN_UPGRADE has been performed successfully, the user must re-start the database. After a successful restart, the database property\'PRIMARY_TT_VERSIO\' is the new timezone version, and\'SECONDARY_TT_VERSIO\' is the old timezone version.

name: dbms_dst.create_affected_table
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DST.CREATE_AFFECTED_TABLE (
   table_name      IN  VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure creates a table that has the schema shown in the comments for the FIND_AFFECTED_TABLES Procedure.

name: dbms_dst.create_error_table
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DST.CREATE_ERROR_TABLE (
   table_name      IN  VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure creates a log error table which has the following schema:

name: dbms_dst.create_trigger_table
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DST.CREATE_TRIGGER_TABLE (
   table_name     IN    VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure creates a table that has the following schema.

name: dbms_dst.end_upgrade
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DST.END_UPGRADE (
  num_of_failures    OUT  BINARY_INTEGER);
descriptionText: This procedure ends an upgrade window. An upgraded window is ended if all the affected user tables have been upgraded. Otherwise, the OUT parameter num_of_failures indicates how many tables have not been converted.

name: dbms_dst.find_affected_tables
bodyFullText:
DBMS_DST.FIND_AFFECTED_TABLES (
   affected_tables             IN  VARCHAR2 =: 'sys.dst$affected_tables',
   log_errors                  IN  BOOLEAN := FALSE,
   log_errors_table            IN  VARCHAR2 =: 'sys.dst$error_table');
descriptionText: This procedure finds all the tables which have affected TSTZ data due to the new timezone version. This procedure can only be invoked during a prepare window. The tables which have affected TSTZ data are recorded into a table indicated by parameter affected_tables. If semantic errors must be logged, they are recorded into a table indicated by parameter log_errors_table.

name: dbms_dst.upgrade_database
body:

	, upgrade_data => TRUE
	, parallel => FALSE
	, continue_after_errors => TRUE
	, log_errors => FALSE

bodyNoDefault:

bodyFullText:
DBMS_DST.UPGRADE_DATABASE  (
   num_of_failures             OUT BINARY_INTEGER,
   upgrade_data                IN  BOOLEAN := TRUE,
   parallel                    IN  BOOLEAN := FALSE,
   continue_after_errors       IN  BOOLEAN := TRUE,
   log_errors                  IN  BOOLEAN := FALSE,
   log_errors_table            IN  VARCHAR2 =: 'sys.dst$error_table' ,
   error_on_overlap_time       IN  BOOLEAN := FALSE,
   error_on_nonexisting_time   IN  BOOLEAN := FALSE,
   log_triggers_table          IN  VARCHAR2 := 'sys.dst$trigger_table');
descriptionText: This procedure upgrades all tables in the database, which have one or more columns defined on the TSTZ type or an ADT containing the TSTZ type. This procedure can only be invoked after an upgrade window has been started. Each table is upgraded in an atomic transaction. Note that, a base table and its materialized view log table are upgraded in an atomic transaction.

name: dbms_editions_utilities.set_null_column_values_to_expr

name: dbms_epg.authorize_dad
descriptionText: This procedure authorizes a DAD to invoke procedures and access document tables with a database use\'s privileges. The invoker can always authorize the use of her/his own privileges.

name: dbms_epg.create_dad
descriptionText: This procedure creates a new DAD.

name: dbms_epg.deauthorize_dad
descriptionText: This procedure deauthorizes a DAD with regard to invoking procedures and accessing document tables with a database use\'s privileges. The invoker can always deauthorize the use of his own privileges.

name: dbms_epg.map_dad

name: dbms_epg.set_dad_attribute

name: dbms_epg.set_global_attribute

name: dbms_epg.unmap_dad
