   master              IN   VARCHAR2,
   { dblink_list       IN   VARCHAR2, 
   | dblink_table      IN   DBMS_UTILITY.DBLINK_ARRAY,}
   propagation_mode    IN   VARCHAR2 : ='ASYNCHRONOUS',
   comment             IN   VARCHAR2 := '');
descriptionText: This procedure alters the propagation method for a specified replication group at a specified master site. This replication group must be quiesced. You must call this procedure from the master definition site. If the master appears in the dblink_list or dblink_table, then ALTER_MASTER_PROPAGATION ignores that database link. You cannot change the propagation mode from a master to itself.

DBMS_REPCAT.ALTER_MASTER_REPOBJECT (

bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.ALTER_MVIEW_PROPAGATION (
   gname                IN  VARCHAR2, 
   propagation_mode     IN  VARCHAR2,
   comment              IN  VARCHAR2   := '',
   gowner               IN  VARCHAR2   := 'PUBLIC');

This procedure pushes the deferred transaction queue at the materialized view site, locks the materialized views, and regenerates any triggers and their associated packages. You must call this procedure from the materialized view site.

name: dbms_repcat.alter_priority
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.ALTER_PRIORITY (

bodyFullText:

   name          IN   VARCHAR2,

bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.ALTER_SITE_PRIORITY_SITE (

name: dbms_repcat.comment_on_priority_group
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.COMMENT_ON_PRIORITY_GROUP (
   gname       IN   VARCHAR2, 
   pgroup      IN   VARCHAR2, 
   comment     IN   VARCHAR2);

bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.COMMENT_ON_REPOBJECT (
   sname    IN   VARCHAR2, 
   oname    IN   VARCHAR2, 
   type     IN   VARCHAR2, 
   comment  IN   VARCHAR2);

name: dbms_repcat.comment_on_repsites

If the replication group is a materialized view group, this procedure updates the SCHEMA_COMMENT field in the DBA_REPGROUP view for a materialized view site.

DBMS_REPCAT.COMMENT_ON_SITE_PRIORITY (

DBMS_REPCAT.COMMENT_ON_UPDATE_RESOLUTION (

	, oname => $2
	, column_list => $3
	, column_table => $4

	, compare => TRUE
bodyNoDefault:

	, operation => $5

DBMS_REPCAT.COMPARE_OLD_VALUES(
   sname           IN  VARCHAR2,
   oname           IN  VARCHAR2,
   { column_list   IN  VARCHAR2,
   | column_table  IN  DBMS_UTILITY.VARCHAR2S | DBMS_UTILITY.LNAME_ARRAY,}
   operation       IN  VARCHAR2 := 'UPDATE',
   compare         IN  BOOLEAN  := TRUE );
descriptionText: This procedure specifies whether to compare old column values during propagation of deferred transactions at each master site for each nonkey column of a replicated table for updates and deletes. The default is to compare old values for all columns. You can change this behavior at all master sites and materialized view sites by invoking DBMS_REPCAT.COMPARE_OLD_VALUES at the master definition site.

	, fname => NULL
	, gowner => 'PUBLIC'
bodyNoDefault:
gname => $1
	, master => $2
	, comment => $3
	, propagation_mode => $4
	, fname => $5
	, gowner => $6
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.CREATE_MVIEW_REPGROUP (
   gname              IN   VARCHAR2, 
   master             IN   VARCHAR2, 
   comment            IN   VARCHAR2     := '',
   propagation_mode   IN   VARCHAR2     := 'ASYNCHRONOUS',
   fname              IN   VARCHAR2     := NULL
   gowner             IN   VARCHAR2     := 'PUBLIC');
descriptionText: This procedure creates a new, empty materialized view group in your local database. CREATE_MVIEW_REPGROUP automatically calls REGISTER_MIEW_REPGROUP, but ignores any errors that might have happened during registration.

name: dbms_repcat.create_mview_repobject
body:
sname => $1
	, oname => $2
	, type => $3
	, ddl_text => ''
	, comment => ''
	, gname => ''
	, gen_objs_owner => ''
	, min_communication => TRUE
	, generate_80_compatible => TRUE
	, gowner => 'PUBLIC'
bodyNoDefault:
sname => $1
	, oname => $2
	, type => $3
	, ddl_text => $4
	, comment => $5
	, gname => $6
	, gen_objs_owner => $7
	, min_communication => $8
	, generate_80_compatible => $9
	, gowner => $10
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.CREATE_MVIEW_REPOBJECT (
   sname                   IN   VARCHAR2,
   oname                   IN   VARCHAR2, 
   type                    IN   VARCHAR2, 
   ddl_text                IN   VARCHAR2  := '',
   comment                 IN   VARCHAR2  := '',
   gname                   IN   VARCHAR2  := '',
   gen_objs_owner          IN   VARCHAR2  := '',
   min_communication       IN   BOOLEAN   := TRUE,
   generate_80_compatible  IN   BOOLEAN   := TRUE,
   gowner                  IN   VARCHAR2  := 'PUBLIC');
descriptionText: This procedure adds a replicated object to a materialized view group.

name: dbms_repcat.define_column_group
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.DEFINE_COLUMN_GROUP ( 
   sname            IN   VARCHAR2,
   oname            IN   VARCHAR2,
   column_group     IN   VARCHAR2,
   comment          IN   VARCHAR2 := NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure creates an empty column group. You must call this procedure from the master definition site.

name: dbms_repcat.define_priority_group
body:
gname => $1
	, pgroup => $2
	, datatype => $3
	, fixed_length => NULL
	, comment => NULL
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.DEFINE_PRIORITY_GROUP (
   gname         IN   VARCHAR2, 
   pgroup        IN   VARCHAR2, 
   datatype      IN   VARCHAR2, 
   fixed_length  IN   INTEGER := NULL,
   comment       IN   VARCHAR2 := NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure creates a new priority group for a master group. You must call this procedure from the master definition site.

name: dbms_repcat.define_site_priority
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.DEFINE_SITE_PRIORITY (
   gname        IN   VARCHAR2, 
   name         IN   VARCHAR2,
   comment      IN   VARCHAR2 := NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure creates a new site priority group for a master group. You must call this procedure from the master definition site.

name: dbms_repcat.do_deferred_repcat_admin
descriptionText: This procedure executes the local outstanding deferred administrative procedures for the specified master group at the current master site, or (with assistance from job queues) for all master sites.

name: dbms_repcat.drop_column_group
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.DROP_COLUMN_GROUP (
   sname        IN   VARCHAR2,
   oname        IN   VARCHAR2,
   column_group IN   VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure drops a column group. You must call this procedure from the master definition site.

name: dbms_repcat.drop_grouped_column
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.DROP_GROUPED_COLUMN (
   sname                 IN   VARCHAR2,
   oname                 IN   VARCHAR2,
   column_group          IN   VARCHAR2,
   list_of_column_names  IN   VARCHAR2 | DBMS_REPCAT.VARCHAR2S);
descriptionText: This procedure removes members from a column group. You must call this procedure from the master definition site.

name: dbms_repcat.drop_master_repgroup
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.DROP_MASTER_REPGROUP (
   gname             IN VARCHAR2,
   drop_contents     IN BOOLEAN    := FALSE,
   all_sites         IN BOOLEAN    := FALSE);
descriptionText: This procedure drops a master group from your current site. To drop the master group from all master sites, including the master definition site, you can call this procedure at the master definition site, and set all_sites to TRUE.

name: dbms_repcat.drop_master_repobject
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.DROP_MASTER_REPOBJECT (
   sname          IN   VARCHAR2, 
   oname          IN   VARCHAR2, 
   type           IN   VARCHAR2, 
   drop_objects   IN   BOOLEAN     := FALSE);
descriptionText: This procedure drops a replicated object from a master group. You must call this procedure from the master definition site.

name: dbms_repcat.drop_mview_repgroup
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.DROP_MVIEW_REPGROUP (
   gname                 IN   VARCHAR2, 
   drop_contents         IN   BOOLEAN   := FALSE,
   gowner                IN   VARCHAR2  := 'PUBLIC');
descriptionText: This procedure drops a materialized view site from your replication environment. DROP_MVIEW_REPGROUP automatically calls UNREGISTER_MVIEW_REPGROUP at the master site or master materialized view site to unregister the materialized view, but ignores any errors that might have occurred during unregistration. If DROP_MVIEW_REPGROUP is unsuccessful, then connect to the master site or master materialized view site and run UNREGISTER_MVIEW_REPGROUP.

name: dbms_repcat.drop_mview_repobject
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.DROP_MVIEW_REPOBJECT ( 
   sname          IN   VARCHAR2, 
   oname          IN   VARCHAR2, 
   type           IN   VARCHAR2, 
   drop_objects   IN   BOOLEAN  := FALSE);
descriptionText: This procedure drops a replicated object from a materialized view site.

name: dbms_repcat.drop_priority
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.DROP_PRIORITY(
      gname          IN   VARCHAR2,
      pgroup         IN   VARCHAR2, 
      priority_num   IN   NUMBER);
descriptionText: This procedure drops a member of a priority group by priority level. You must call this procedure from the master definition site.

name: dbms_repcat.drop_priority_datatype
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.DROP_PRIORITY_datatype (
   gname    IN   VARCHAR2,
   pgroup   IN   VARCHAR2, 
   value    IN   datatype);
descriptionText: This procedure drops a member of a priority group by value. You must call this procedure from the master definition site. The procedure that you must call is determined by the data type of your priority column.

name: dbms_repcat.drop_priority_group
descriptionText: This procedure drops a priority group for a specified master group. You must call this procedure from the master definition site.

name: dbms_repcat.drop_site_priority
descriptionText: This procedure drops a site priority group for a specified master group. You must call this procedure from the master definition site.

name: dbms_repcat.drop_site_priority_site
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.DROP_SITE_PRIORITY_SITE (
   gname      IN   VARCHAR2, 
   name       IN   VARCHAR2,
   site       IN   VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure drops a specified site, by name, from a site priority group. You must call this procedure from the master definition site.

name: dbms_repcat.drop_update_resolution
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.DROP_UPDATE_RESOLUTION (
   sname              IN   VARCHAR2, 
   oname              IN   VARCHAR2, 
   column_group       IN   VARCHAR2, 
   sequence_no        IN   NUMBER);

DBMS_REPCAT.DROP_DELETE_RESOLUTION (
   sname              IN   VARCHAR2, 
   oname              IN   VARCHAR2, 
   sequence_no        IN   NUMBER);

DBMS_REPCAT.DROP_UNIQUE_RESOLUTION (
   sname              IN   VARCHAR2, 
   oname              IN   VARCHAR2, 
   constraint_name    IN   VARCHAR2, 
   sequence_no        IN   NUMBER);
descriptionText: This procedure drops an update, delete, or uniqueness conflict resolution routine. You must call these procedures from the master definition site. The procedure that you must call is determined by the type of conflict that the routine resolves.

name: dbms_repcat.execute_ddl
descriptionText: This procedure supplies DDL that you want to have executed at some or all master sites. You can call this procedure only from the master definition site.

name: dbms_repcat.generate_mview_support
body:
sname => $1
	, oname => $2
	, type => $3
	, gen_objs_owner => ''
	, min_communication => TRUE
	, generate_80_compatible => TRUE
bodyNoDefault:
sname => $1
	, oname => $2
	, type => $3
	, gen_objs_owner => $4
	, min_communication => $5
	, generate_80_compatible => $6
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.GENERATE_MVIEW_SUPPORT (
   sname                    IN VARCHAR2,
   oname                    IN VARCHAR2,
   type                     IN VARCHAR2,
   gen_objs_owner           IN VARCHAR2 := '',
   min_communication        IN BOOLEAN  := TRUE,
   generate_80_compatible   IN BOOLEAN  := TRUE);
descriptionText: This procedure activates triggers and generate packages needed to support the replication of updatable materialized views or procedural replication.You must call this procedure from the materialized view site.

name: dbms_repcat.generate_replication_support
body:
sname => $1
	, oname => $2
	, type => $3
	, package_prefix => NULL
	, procedure_prefix => NULL
	, distributed => TRUE
	, gen_objs_owner => NULL
	, min_communication => TRUE
	, generate_80_compatible => TRUE
bodyNoDefault:
sname => $1
	, oname => $2
	, type => $3
	, package_prefix => $4
	, procedure_prefix => $5
	, distributed => $6
	, gen_objs_owner => $7
	, min_communication => $8
	, generate_80_compatible => $9
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.GENERATE_REPLICATION_SUPPORT (
  sname                     IN    VARCHAR2, 
  oname                     IN    VARCHAR2, 
  type                      IN    VARCHAR2, 
  package_prefix            IN    VARCHAR2   := NULL, 
  procedure_prefix          IN    VARCHAR2   := NULL, 
  distributed               IN    BOOLEAN    := TRUE,
  gen_objs_owner            IN    VARCHAR2   := NULL,
  min_communication         IN    BOOLEAN    := TRUE,
  generate_80_compatible    IN    BOOLEAN    := TRUE);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the triggers and packages needed to support replication for a specified object. You must call this procedure from the master definition site.

name: dbms_repcat.make_column_group
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.MAKE_COLUMN_GROUP ( 
   sname                 IN   VARCHAR2,
   oname                 IN   VARCHAR2,
   column_group          IN   VARCHAR2,
   list_of_column_names  IN   VARCHAR2 | DBMS_REPCAT.VARCHAR2S);
descriptionText: This procedure creates a new column group with one or more members. You must call this procedure from the master definition site.

name: dbms_repcat.prepare_instantiated_master
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.PREPARE_INSTANTIATED_MASTER (
   extension_id             IN       RAW);
descriptionText: This procedure enables the propagation of deferred transactions from other prepared new master sites and existing master sites to the invocation master site. This procedure also enables the propagation of deferred transactions from the invocation master site to the other prepared new master sites and existing master sites.

name: dbms_repcat.purge_master_log
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.PURGE_MASTER_LOG (
   id      IN   BINARY_INTEGER, 
   source  IN   VARCHAR2, 
   gname   IN   VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure removes local messages in the DBA_REPCATLOG view associated with a specified identification number, source, or master group.

name: dbms_repcat.purge_statistics
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.PURGE_STATISTICS (
   sname      IN   VARCHAR2, 
   oname      IN   VARCHAR2, 
   start_date IN   DATE,
   end_date   IN   DATE);
descriptionText: This procedure removes information from the DBA_REPRESOLUTION_STATISTICS view.

name: dbms_repcat.refresh_mview_repgroup
body:
gname => $1
	, drop_missing_contents => FALSE
	, refresh_mviews => FALSE
	, refresh_other_objects => FALSE
	, gowner => 'PUBLIC'
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.REFRESH_MVIEW_REPGROUP (
   gname                  IN   VARCHAR2,
   drop_missing_contents  IN   BOOLEAN    := FALSE,
   refresh_mviews         IN   BOOLEAN    := FALSE,
   refresh_other_objects  IN   BOOLEAN    := FALSE,
   gowner                 IN   VARCHAR2   := 'PUBLIC');
descriptionText: This procedure refreshes a materialized view group with the most recent data from its associated master site or master materialized view site.

name: dbms_repcat.register_mview_repgroup
body:
gname => $1
	, mviewsite => $2
	, comment => NULL
	, rep_type => reg_unknown
	, fname => NULL
	, gowner => 'PUBLIC'
bodyNoDefault:
gname => $1
	, mviewsite => $2
	, comment => $3
	, rep_type => $4
	, fname => $5
	, gowner => $6
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.REGISTER_MVIEW_REPGROUP (
   gname            IN   VARCHAR2,
   mviewsite        IN   VARCHAR2,
   comment          IN   VARCHAR2  := NULL,
   rep_type         IN   NUMBER    := reg_unknown,
   fname            IN   VARCHAR2  := NULL,
   gowner           IN   VARCHAR2  := 'PUBLIC');
descriptionText: This procedure facilitates the administration of materialized views at their respective master sites or master materialized view sites by inserting or modifying a materialized view group in DBA_REGISTERED_MVIEW_GROUPS.

name: dbms_repcat.register_statistics
descriptionText: This procedure collects information about the successful resolution of update, delete, and uniqueness conflicts for a table.

name: dbms_repcat.relocate_masterdef
body:
gname => $1
	, old_masterdef => $2
	, new_masterdef => $3
	, notify_masters => TRUE
	, include_old_masterdef => TRUE
	, require_flavor_change => FALSE
bodyNoDefault:
gname => $1
	, old_masterdef => $2
	, new_masterdef => $3
	, notify_masters => $4
	, include_old_masterdef => $5
	, require_flavor_change => $6
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.RELOCATE_MASTERDEF (
   gname                  IN   VARCHAR2, 
   old_masterdef          IN   VARCHAR2, 
   new_masterdef          IN   VARCHAR2, 
   notify_masters         IN   BOOLEAN    := TRUE,
   include_old_masterdef  IN   BOOLEAN    := TRUE,
   require_flavor_change  IN   BOOLEAN    := FALSE);
descriptionText: This procedure changes your master definition site to another master site in your replication environment.

name: dbms_repcat.remove_master_databases
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.REMOVE_MASTER_DATABASES (
   gname           IN   VARCHAR2,
   master_list     IN   VARCHAR2 |
   master_table    IN   DBMS_UTILITY.DBLINK_ARRAY);
descriptionText: This procedure removes one or more master databases from a replication environment. This procedure regenerates the triggers and their associated packages at the remaining master sites. You must call this procedure from the master definition site.

name: dbms_repcat.rename_shadow_column_group
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.RENAME_SHADOW_COLUMN_GROUP (
   sname                IN VARCHAR2,
   oname                IN VARCHAR2,
   new_col_group_name   IN VARCHAR2)
descriptionText: This procedure renames the shadow column group of a replicated table to make it a named column group. The replicated tabl\'s master group does not need to be quiesced to run this procedure.

name: dbms_repcat.repcat_import_check
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.REPCAT_IMPORT_CHECK (
   gname      IN   VARCHAR2,
   master     IN   BOOLEAN,
   gowner     IN   VARCHAR2  := 'PUBLIC');
descriptionText: This procedure ensures that the objects in the master group have the appropriate object identifiers and status values after you perform an export/import of a replicated object or an object used by Advanced Replication.

name: dbms_repcat.resume_master_activity
descriptionText: This procedure resumes normal replication activity after quiescing a replication environment.

name: dbms_repcat.resume_propagation_to_mdef
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.RESUME_PROPAGATION_TO_MDEF (
   extension_id    IN    RAW);
descriptionText: During the process of adding new master sites to a master group without quiesce, this procedure indicates that export is effectively finished and propagation to the master definition site for both extended and unaffected replication groups existing at master sites can be enabled. Run this procedure after the export required to add new master sites to a master group is complete.

name: dbms_repcat.send_old_values
body:
sname => $1
	, oname => $2
	, column_list => $3
	, column_table => $4
	, operation => 'UPDATE'
	, send => TRUE
bodyNoDefault:
sname => $1
	, oname => $2
	, column_list => $3
	, column_table => $4
	, operation => $5
	, send => $6
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.SEND_OLD_VALUES(
   sname           IN  VARCHAR2,
   oname           IN  VARCHAR2,
   { column_list   IN  VARCHAR2,
   | column_table  IN  DBMS_UTILITY.VARCHAR2S | DBMS_UTILITY.LNAME_ARRAY,}
   operation       IN  VARCHAR2 := 'UPDATE',
   send            IN  BOOLEAN  := TRUE );
descriptionText: You have the option of sending old column values during propagation of deferred transactions for each nonkey column of a replicated table when rows are updated or deleted in the table. When min_communication is set to TRUE, the default is the following:

name: dbms_repcat.set_columns
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.SET_COLUMNS (
   sname           IN    VARCHAR2,
   oname           IN    VARCHAR2,
   { column_list   IN    VARCHAR2
   | column_table  IN    DBMS_UTILITY.NAME_ARRAY | DBMS_UTILITY.LNAME_ARRAY } );
descriptionText: This procedure enables you to use an alternate column or group of columns, instead of the primary key, to determine which columns of a table to compare when using row-level replication. You must call this procedure from the master definition site.

name: dbms_repcat.specify_new_masters
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.SPECIFY_NEW_MASTERS (
   gname           IN   VARCHAR2,
   { master_list   IN   VARCHAR2 
   | master_table  IN   DBMS_UTILITY.DBLINK_ARRAY});
descriptionText: This procedure specifies the master sites you intend to add to an existing replication group without quiescing the group. This procedure must be run at the master definition site of the specified master group.

name: dbms_repcat.streams_migration
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.STREAMS_MIGRATION ( 
     gnames              IN   DBMS_UTILITY.NAME_ARRAY, 
     file_location       IN   VARCHAR2, 
     filename            IN   VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: Generates a migration script that migrates an Advanced Replication environment to a Streams environment. Specifically, this procedure generates a script that sets up a Streams environment for the specified replication groups. The generated script can be customized and run at each master site to perform the migration.

name: dbms_repcat.suspend_master_activity
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.SUSPEND_MASTER_ACTIVITY (
   gname   IN   VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure suspends replication activity for a master group. You use this procedure to quiesce the master group. You must call this procedure from the master definition site.

name: dbms_repcat.switch_mview_master
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.SWITCH_MVIEW_MASTER (
   gname         IN   VARCHAR2, 
   master        IN   VARCHAR2,
   gowner        IN   VARCHAR2  := 'PUBLIC');
descriptionText: This procedure changes the master site of a materialized view group to another master site. This procedure does a full refresh of the affected materialized views and regenerates the triggers and their associated packages as needed. This procedure does not push the queue to the old master site before changing master sites.

name: dbms_repcat.undo_add_new_masters_request
descriptionText: This procedure undoes all of the changes made by the SPECIFY_NEW_MASTERS and ADD_NEW_MASTERS procedures for a specified extension_id.

name: dbms_repcat.unregister_mview_repgroup
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.UNREGISTER_MVIEW_REPGROUP (
   gname      IN   VARCHAR2,
   mviewsite  IN   VARCHAR2,
   gowner     IN   VARCHAR2  := 'PUBLIC');
descriptionText: This procedure facilitates the administration of materialized views at their respective master sites or master materialized view sites by deleting a materialized view group from DBA_REGISTERED_MVIEW_GROUPS. Run this procedure at the master site or master materialized view site.

name: dbms_repcat.validate
body:
gname => $1
	, check_genflags => FALSE
	, check_valid_objs => FALSE
	, check_links_sched => FALSE
	, check_links => FALSE
	, error_table => $2
bodyNoDefault:
gname => $1
	, check_genflags => $2
	, check_valid_objs => $3
	, check_links_sched => $4
	, check_links => $5
	, error_table => $6
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.VALIDATE (
   gname               IN  VARCHAR2, 
   check_genflags      IN  BOOLEAN := FALSE,
   check_valid_objs    IN  BOOLEAN := FALSE,
   check_links_sched   IN  BOOLEAN := FALSE,
   check_links         IN  BOOLEAN := FALSE,
   error_table         OUT DBMS_REPCAT.VALIDATE_ERR_TABLE)
  RETURN BINARY_INTEGER;

DBMS_REPCAT.VALIDATE (
   gname               IN  VARCHAR2, 
   check_genflags      IN  BOOLEAN := FALSE,
   check_valid_objs    IN  BOOLEAN := FALSE,
   check_links_sched   IN  BOOLEAN := FALSE,
   check_links         IN  BOOLEAN := FALSE,
   error_msg_table     OUT DBMS_UTILITY.UNCL_ARRAY,
   error_num_table     OUT DBMS_UTILITY.NUMBER_ARRAY )
  RETURN BINARY_INTEGER;
descriptionText: This function validates the correctness of key conditions of a multimaster replication environment.

name: dbms_repcat.wait_master_log
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT.WAIT_MASTER_LOG (
   gname          IN    VARCHAR2, 
   record_count   IN    NATURAL, 
   timeout        IN    NATURAL, 
   true_count     OUT   NATURAL);
descriptionText: This procedure determines whether changes that were asynchronously propagated to a master site have been applied.

name: dbms_repcat_admin.grant_admin_any_schema
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_ADMIN.GRANT_ADMIN_ANY_SCHEMA (
   username  IN   VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure grants the necessary privileges to the replication administrator to administer any replication groups at the current site.

name: dbms_repcat_admin.grant_admin_schema
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_ADMIN.GRANT_ADMIN_SCHEMA (
   username IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure grants the necessary privileges to the replication administrator to administer a schema at the current site. This procedure is most useful if your replication group does not span schemas.

name: dbms_repcat_admin.register_user_repgroup
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_ADMIN.REGISTER_USER_REPGROUP (
   username         IN   VARCHAR2,
   privilege_type   IN   VARCHAR2,
   {list_of_gnames  IN   VARCHAR2 |
   table_of_gnames  IN   DBMS_UTILITY.NAME_ARRAY)};
descriptionText: This procedure assigns proxy materialized view administrator or receiver privileges at the master site or master materialized view site for use with remote sites. This procedure grants only the necessary privileges to the proxy materialized view administrator or receiver. It does not grant the powerful privileges granted by the GRANT_ADMIN_SCHEMA or GRANT_ADMIN_ANY_SCHEMA procedures.

name: dbms_repcat_admin.revoke_admin_any_schema
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_ADMIN.REVOKE_ADMIN_ANY_SCHEMA (
   username IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure revokes the privileges and roles from the replication administrator that were granted by GRANT_ADMIN_ANY_SCHEMA.

name: dbms_repcat_admin.revoke_admin_schema
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_ADMIN.REVOKE_ADMIN_SCHEMA (
   username IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure revokes the privileges and roles from the replication administrator that were granted by GRANT_ADMIN_SCHEMA.

name: dbms_repcat_admin.unregister_user_repgroup
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_ADMIN.UNREGISTER_USER_REPGROUP (
   username         IN   VARCHAR2,
   privilege_type   IN   VARCHAR2,
   {list_of_gnames  IN   VARCHAR2 |
   table_of_gnames  IN   DBMS_UTILITY.NAME_ARRAY)};
descriptionText: This procedure revokes the privileges and roles from the proxy materialized view administrator or receiver that were granted by the REGISTER_USER_REPGROUP procedure.

name: dbms_repcat_instantiate.drop_site_instantiation
descriptionText: This procedure drops a template instantiation at a target site. This procedure removes all related metadata at the master site and disables the specified site from refreshing its materialized views. You must execute this procedure as the user who originally instantiated the template. To see who instantiated the template, query the ALL_REPCAT_TEMPLATE_SITES view.

name: dbms_repcat_instantiate.instantiate_offline
body:
refresh_template_name => $1
	, site_name => $2
	, runtime_parm_id => -1e-130
	, next_date => SYSDATE
	, interval => 'SYSDATE + 1'
	, use_default_gowner => TRUE
bodyNoDefault:
refresh_template_name => $1
	, site_name => $2
	, runtime_parm_id => $3
	, next_date => $4
	, interval => $5
	, use_default_gowner => $6
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_INSTANTIATE.INSTANTIATE_OFFLINE(
     refresh_template_name   IN   VARCHAR2,
     site_name               IN   VARCHAR2, 
     runtime_parm_id         IN   NUMBER    := -1e-130,
     next_date               IN   DATE      := SYSDATE,
     interval                IN   VARCHAR2  := 'SYSDATE + 1',
     use_default_gowner      IN   BOOLEAN   := TRUE)
     return NUMBER;
descriptionText: This function generates a file at the master site that is used to create the materialized view environment at the remote materialized view site while offline. This generated file is an offline instantiation file and should be used at remote materialized view sites that are not able to remain connected to the master site for an extended amount of time.

name: dbms_repcat_instantiate.instantiate_online
body:
refresh_template_name => $1
	, site_name => $2
	, runtime_parm_id => -1e-130
	, next_date => SYSDATE
	, interval => 'SYSDATE + 1'
	, use_default_gowner => TRUE
bodyNoDefault:
refresh_template_name => $1
	, site_name => $2
	, runtime_parm_id => $3
	, next_date => $4
	, interval => $5
	, use_default_gowner => $6
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_INSTANTIATE.INSTANTIATE_ONLINE(
     refresh_template_name   IN   VARCHAR2,
     site_name               IN   VARCHAR2, 
     runtime_parm_id         IN   NUMBER    := -1e-130,
     next_date               IN   DATE      := SYSDATE,
     interval                IN   VARCHAR2  := 'SYSDATE + 1',
     use_default_gowner      IN   BOOLEAN   := TRUE)
     return NUMBER;
descriptionText: This function generates a script at the master site that is used to create the materialized view environment at the remote materialized view site while online. This generated script should be used at remote materialized view sites that are able to remain connected to the master site for an extended amount of time, as the instantiation process at the remote materialized view site might be lengthy (depending on the amount of data that is populated to the new materialized views).

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.alter_refresh_template
body:
refresh_template_name => $1
	, new_owner => '-'
	, new_refresh_group_name => '-'
	, new_refresh_template_name => '-'
	, new_template_comment => '-'
	, new_public_template => '-'
	, new_last_modified => to_date('1'
	, new_modified_by => -1e-130
bodyNoDefault:
refresh_template_name => $1
	, new_owner => $2
	, new_refresh_group_name => $3
	, new_refresh_template_name => $4
	, new_template_comment => $5
	, new_public_template => $6
	, new_last_modified => $7
	, new_modified_by => $8
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.ALTER_REFRESH_TEMPLATE (
   refresh_template_name      IN   VARCHAR2,
   new_owner                  IN   VARCHAR2 := '-',
   new_refresh_group_name     IN   VARCHAR2 := '-',
   new_refresh_template_name  IN   VARCHAR2 := '-',
   new_template_comment       IN   VARCHAR2 := '-',
   new_public_template        IN   VARCHAR2 := '-',
   new_last_modified          IN   DATE := to_date('1', 'J'),
   new_modified_by            IN   NUMBER := -1e-130);
descriptionText: This procedure allows the DBA to alter existing deployment templates. Alterations can include defining a new deployment template name, a new refresh group, or a new owner and changing the public/private status.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.alter_template_object
body:
refresh_template_name => $1
	, object_name => $2
	, object_type => $3
	, new_refresh_template_name => '-'
	, new_object_name => '-'
	, new_object_type => '-'
	, new_ddl_text => '-'
	, new_master_rollback_seg => '-'
	, new_flavor_id => -1e-130
bodyNoDefault:
refresh_template_name => $1
	, object_name => $2
	, object_type => $3
	, new_refresh_template_name => $4
	, new_object_name => $5
	, new_object_type => $6
	, new_ddl_text => $7
	, new_master_rollback_seg => $8
	, new_flavor_id => $9
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.ALTER_TEMPLATE_OBJECT (
   refresh_template_name       IN   VARCHAR2, 
   object_name                 IN   VARCHAR2,
   object_type                 IN   VARCHAR2,
   new_refresh_template_name   IN   VARCHAR2 := '-',
   new_object_name             IN   VARCHAR2 := '-',
   new_object_type             IN   VARCHAR2 := '-',
   new_ddl_text                IN   CLOB     := '-',
   new_master_rollback_seg     IN   VARCHAR2 := '-',
   new_flavor_id               IN   NUMBER   := -1e-130);
descriptionText: This procedure alters objects that have been added to a specified deployment template. The most common changes are altering the object DDL and assigning the object to a different deployment template.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.alter_template_parm
body:
refresh_template_name => $1
	, parameter_name => $2
	, new_refresh_template_name => '-'
	, new_parameter_name => '-'
	, new_default_parm_value => NULL
	, new_prompt_string => '-'
	, new_user_override => '-'
bodyNoDefault:
refresh_template_name => $1
	, parameter_name => $2
	, new_refresh_template_name => $3
	, new_parameter_name => $4
	, new_default_parm_value => $5
	, new_prompt_string => $6
	, new_user_override => $7
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.ALTER_TEMPLATE_PARM (
   refresh_template_name       IN   VARCHAR2,
   parameter_name              IN   VARCHAR2,
   new_refresh_template_name   IN   VARCHAR2 := '-',
   new_parameter_name          IN   VARCHAR2 := '-',
   new_default_parm_value      IN   CLOB := NULL,
   new_prompt_string           IN   VARCHAR2 := '-',
   new_user_override           IN   VARCHAR2 := '-');
descriptionText: This procedure allows the DBA to alter the parameters for a specific deployment template. Alterations include renaming the parameter and redefining the default value and prompt string.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.alter_user_authorization
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.ALTER_USER_AUTHORIZATION (
   user_name                   IN   VARCHAR2,
   refresh_template_name       IN   VARCHAR2,
   new_user_name               IN   VARCHAR2 := '-',
   new_refresh_template_name   IN   VARCHAR2 := '-');
descriptionText: This procedure alters the contents of the DBA_REPCAT_USER_AUTHORIZATIONS view. Specifically, you can change user/deployment template authorization assignments. This procedure is helpful, for example, if an employee is reassigned and requires the materialized view environment of another deployment template. The DBA simply assigns the employee the new deployment template and the user is authorized to instantiate the target template.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.alter_user_parm_value
body:
refresh_template_name => $1
	, parameter_name => $2
	, user_name => $3
	, new_refresh_template_name => '-'
	, new_parameter_name => '-'
	, new_user_name => '-'
	, new_parm_value => NULL
bodyNoDefault:
refresh_template_name => $1
	, parameter_name => $2
	, user_name => $3
	, new_refresh_template_name => $4
	, new_parameter_name => $5
	, new_user_name => $6
	, new_parm_value => $7
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.ALTER_USER_PARM_VALUE(
   refresh_template_name         IN   VARCHAR2, 
   parameter_name                IN   VARCHAR2,
   user_name                     IN   VARCHAR2,
   new_refresh_template_name     IN   VARCHAR2 := '-',
   new_parameter_name            IN   VARCHAR2 := '-',
   new_user_name                 IN   VARCHAR2 := '-',
   new_parm_value                IN   CLOB := NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure changes existing parameter values that have been defined for a specific user. This procedure is especially helpful if your materialized view environment uses assignment tables. Change a user parameter value to quickly and securely change the data set of a remote materialized view site.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.compare_templates
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.COMPARE_TEMPLATES (
   source_template_name    IN   VARCHAR2,
   compare_template_name   IN   VARCHAR2)
  RETURN NUMBER;
descriptionText: This function allows a DBA to compare the contents of two deployment templates. Any discrepancies between the two deployment templates is stored in the USER_REPCAT_TEMP_OUTPUT temporary view.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.copy_template
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.COPY_TEMPLATE (
   old_refresh_template_name     IN   VARCHAR2, 
   new_refresh_template_name     IN   VARCHAR2,
   copy_user_authorizations      IN   VARCHAR2,
   dblink                        IN   VARCHAR2 := NULL)
  RETURN NUMBER;
descriptionText: This function enables you to copy a deployment template and is helpful when a new deployment template uses many of the objects contained in an existing deployment template. This function copies the deployment template, template objects, template parameters, and user parameter values. The DBA can optionally have the function copy the user authorizations for this template. The number returned by this function is used internally by Oracle to manage deployment templates.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.create_object_from_existing
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.CREATE_OBJECT_FROM_EXISTING(
     refresh_template_name  IN   VARCHAR2,
     object_name            IN   VARCHAR2,
     sname                  IN   VARCHAR2,
     oname                  IN   VARCHAR2,
     otype                  IN   VARCHAR2)
   RETURN NUMBER;
descriptionText: This function creates a template object definition from existing database objects and adds it to a target deployment template. The object DDL that created the original database object is executed when the target deployment template is instantiated at the remote materialized view site. This is ideal for adding existing triggers and procedures to your template. The number returned by this function is used internally by Oracle to manage deployment templates.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.create_refresh_template
body:
owner => $1
	, refresh_group_name => $2
	, refresh_template_name => $3
	, template_comment => NULL
	, public_template => NULL
	, last_modified => SYSDATE
	, modified_by => USER
	, creation_date => SYSDATE
	, created_by => USER
bodyNoDefault:
owner => $1
	, refresh_group_name => $2
	, refresh_template_name => $3
	, template_comment => $4
	, public_template => $5
	, last_modified => $6
	, modified_by => $7
	, creation_date => $8
	, created_by => $9
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.CREATE_REFRESH_TEMPLATE (
   owner                  IN   VARCHAR2, 
   refresh_group_name     IN   VARCHAR2, 
   refresh_template_name  IN   VARCHAR2, 
   template_comment       IN   VARCHAR2 := NULL,
   public_template        IN   VARCHAR2 := NULL,
   last_modified          IN   DATE := SYSDATE,
   modified_by            IN   VARCHAR2 := USER,
   creation_date          IN   DATE := SYSDATE,
   created_by             IN   VARCHAR2 := USER)
  RETURN NUMBER;
descriptionText: This function creates the deployment template, which enables you to define the template name, private/public status, and target refresh group. Each time that you create a template object, user authorization, or template parameter, you reference the deployment template created with this function. This function adds a row to the DBA_REPCAT_REFRESH_TEMPLATES view. The number returned by this function is used internally by Oracle to manage deployment templates.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.create_template_object
body:
refresh_template_name => $1
	, object_name => $2
	, object_type => $3
	, ddl_text => $4
	, master_rollback_seg => NULL
	, flavor_id => -1e-130
bodyNoDefault:
refresh_template_name => $1
	, object_name => $2
	, object_type => $3
	, ddl_text => $4
	, master_rollback_seg => $5
	, flavor_id => $6
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.CREATE_TEMPLATE_OBJECT (
   refresh_template_name  IN   VARCHAR2, 
   object_name            IN   VARCHAR2, 
   object_type            IN   VARCHAR2,
   ddl_text               IN   CLOB,
   master_rollback_seg    IN   VARCHAR2 := NULL,
   flavor_id              IN   NUMBER := -1e-130)
  RETURN NUMBER;
descriptionText: This function adds object definitions to a target deployment template container. The specified object DDL is executed when the target deployment template is instantiated at the remote materialized view site. In addition to adding materialized views, this function can add tables, procedures, and other objects to your template. The number returned by this function is used internally by Oracle to manage deployment templates.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.create_template_parm
body:
refresh_template_name => $1
	, parameter_name => $2
	, default_parm_value => NULL
	, prompt_string => NULL
	, user_override => NULL
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.CREATE_TEMPLATE_PARM (
   refresh_template_name  IN   VARCHAR2, 
   parameter_name         IN   VARCHAR2,
   default_parm_value     IN   CLOB := NULL,
   prompt_string          IN   VARCHAR2 := NULL,
   user_override          IN   VARCHAR2 := NULL)
 RETURN NUMBER;
descriptionText: This function creates parameters for a specific deployment template to allow custom data sets to be created at the remote materialized view site. This function is only required when the DBA wants to define a set of template variables before adding any template objects. When objects are added to the template using the CREATE_TEMPLATE_OBJECT function, any variables in the object DDL are automatically added to the DBA_REPCAT_TEMPLATE_PARMS view.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.create_user_authorization
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.CREATE_USER_AUTHORIZATION (
   user_name               IN   VARCHAR2, 
   refresh_template_name   IN   VARCHAR2)
 RETURN NUMBER;
descriptionText: This function authorizes specific users to instantiate private deployment templates. Users not authorized for a private deployment template are not able to instantiate the private template. This function adds a row to the DBA_REPCAT_USER_AUTHORIZATIONS view.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.create_user_parm_value
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.CREATE_USER_PARM_VALUE (
   refresh_template_name    IN   VARCHAR2, 
   parameter_name           IN   VARCHAR2,
   user_name                IN   VARCHAR2,
   parm_value               IN   CLOB := NULL)
 RETURN NUMBER;
descriptionText: This function predefines deployment template parameter values for specific users. For example, to predefine the region parameter as west for user 33456, use the this function.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.delete_runtime_parms
descriptionText: Use this procedure before instantiating a deployment template to delete a run-time parameter value that you defined using the INSERT_RUNTIME_PARMS procedure.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.drop_all_objects
descriptionText: This procedure allows the DBA to drop all objects or specific object types from a deployment template.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.drop_all_template_parms
descriptionText: This procedure lets you drop template parameters for a specified deployment template. You can use this procedure to drop all parameters that are not referenced by a template object or to drop from the template all objects that reference any parameter, along with all of the parameters themselves.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.drop_all_template_sites
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.DROP_ALL_TEMPLATE_SITES (
   refresh_template_name   IN   VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure removes all entries from the DBA_REPCAT_TEMPLATE_SITES view, which keeps a record of sites that have instantiated a particular deployment template.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.drop_all_templates
bodyFullText: DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.DROP_ALL_TEMPLATES;
descriptionText: This procedure removes all deployment templates at the site where the procedure is called.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.drop_all_user_authorizations
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.DROP_ALL_USER_AUTHORIZATIONS (
   refresh_template_name   IN   VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure enables the DBA to drop all user authorizations for a specified deployment template. Executing this procedure removes rows from the DBA_REPCAT_USER_AUTHORIZATIONS view.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.drop_all_user_parm_values
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.DROP_ALL_USER_PARM_VALUES (
   refresh_template_name   IN   VARCHAR2,
   user_name               IN   VARCHAR2,
   parameter_name          IN   VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure drops user parameter values for a specific deployment template. This procedure is very flexible and enables you to define a set of user parameter values to be deleted.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.drop_refresh_template
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.DROP_REFRESH_TEMPLATE (
   refresh_template_name  IN   VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure drops a deployment template. Dropping a deployment template has a cascading effect, removing all related template parameters, user authorizations, template objects, and user parameters (this procedure does not drop template sites).

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.drop_site_instantiation
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.DROP_SITE_INSTANTIATION (
     refresh_template_name  IN   VARCHAR2,
     user_name              IN   VARCHAR2,
     site_name              IN   VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure drops a template instantiation at any target site. This procedure removes all related metadata at the master site and disables the specified site from refreshing its materialized views.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.drop_template_object
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.DROP_TEMPLATE_OBJECT (
   refresh_template_name  IN   VARCHAR2, 
   object_name            IN   VARCHAR2,
   object_type            IN   VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure removes a template object from a specific deployment template. For example, a DBA would use this procedure to remove an outdated materialized view from a deployment template. Changes made to the template are reflected at new sites instantiating the deployment template. Remote sites that have already instantiated the template must reinstantiate the deployment template to apply the changes.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.drop_template_parm
descriptionText: This procedure removes an existing template parameter from the DBA_REPCAT_TEMPLATE_PARMS view. This procedure is useful when you have dropped a template object and a particular parameter is no longer needed.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.drop_user_authorization
descriptionText: This procedure removes a user authorization entry from the DBA_REPCAT_USER_AUTHORIZATIONS view. This procedure is used when removing a use\'s template authorization. If a use\'s authorization is removed, then the user is no longer able to instantiate the target deployment template.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.drop_user_parm_value
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.DROP_USER_PARM_VALUE (
   refresh_template_name    IN   VARCHAR2, 
   parameter_name           IN   VARCHAR2,
   user_name                IN   VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure removes a predefined user parameter value for a specific deployment template. This procedure is often executed after a use\'s template authorization has been removed.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.get_runtime_parm_id
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.GET_RUNTIME_PARM_ID
  RETURN NUMBER;
descriptionText: This function retrieves an identification to be used when defining a run-time parameter value. All run-time parameter values are assigned to this identification and are also used during the instantiation process.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.insert_runtime_parms
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.INSERT_RUNTIME_PARMS (
   runtime_parm_id    IN   NUMBER, 
   parameter_name     IN   VARCHAR2,
   parameter_value    IN   CLOB);
descriptionText: This procedure defines run-time parameter values before instantiating a template. Use this procedure to define parameter values when no user parameter values have been defined and you do not want to accept the default parameter values.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.instantiate_offline
body:
refresh_template_name => $1
	, site_name => $2
	, user_name => NULL
	, runtime_parm_id => -1e-130
	, next_date => SYSDATE
	, interval => 'SYSDATE + 1'
	, use_default_gowner => TRUE
bodyNoDefault:
refresh_template_name => $1
	, site_name => $2
	, user_name => $3
	, runtime_parm_id => $4
	, next_date => $5
	, interval => $6
	, use_default_gowner => $7
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.INSTANTIATE_OFFLINE(
     refresh_template_name   IN   VARCHAR2,
     site_name               IN   VARCHAR2, 
     user_name               IN   VARCHAR2  := NULL,
     runtime_parm_id         IN   NUMBER    := -1e-130,
     next_date               IN   DATE      := SYSDATE,
     interval                IN   VARCHAR2  := 'SYSDATE + 1',
     use_default_gowner      IN   BOOLEAN   := TRUE)
   RETURN NUMBER;
descriptionText: This function generates a script at the master site that is used to create the materialized view environment at the remote materialized view site while the materialized view site disconnected from the master (that is, while the materialized view site is offline). This generated script should be used at remote materialized view sites that are not able to remain connected to the master site for an extended amount of time, as the instantiation process at the remote materialized view site might be lengthy (depending on the amount of data that is populated to the new materialized views). This function must be executed separately for each user instantiation.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.instantiate_online
body:
refresh_template_name => $1
	, site_name => NULL
	, user_name => NULL
	, runtime_parm_id => -1e-130
	, next_date => SYSDATE
	, interval => 'SYSDATE + 1'
	, use_default_gowner => TRUE
bodyNoDefault:
refresh_template_name => $1
	, site_name => $2
	, user_name => $3
	, runtime_parm_id => $4
	, next_date => $5
	, interval => $6
	, use_default_gowner => $7
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.INSTANTIATE_ONLINE(
   refresh_template_name   IN   VARCHAR2,
   site_name               IN   VARCHAR2  := NULL,
   user_name               IN   VARCHAR2  := NULL, 
   runtime_parm_id         IN   NUMBER    := -1e-130,
   next_date               IN   DATE      := SYSDATE,
   interval                IN   VARCHAR2  := 'SYSDATE + 1',
   use_default_gowner      IN   BOOLEAN   := TRUE)
 RETURN NUMBER;
descriptionText: This function generates a script at the master site that is used to create the materialized view environment at the remote materialized view site while the materialized view site is connected to the master (that is, while the materialized view site is online). This generated script should be used at remote materialized view sites that are able to remain connected to the master site for an extended amount of time, as the instantiation process at the remote materialized view site might be lengthy (depending on the amount of data that is populated to the new materialized views). This function must be executed separately for each user instantiation.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.lock_template_exclusive
bodyFullText: DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.LOCK_TEMPLATE_EXCLUSIVE();
descriptionText: When a deployment template is being updated or modified, use the LOCK_TEMPLATE_EXCLUSIVE procedure to prevent users from reading or instantiating the template.

name: dbms_repcat_rgt.lock_template_shared
bodyFullText: DBMS_REPCAT_RGT.LOCK_TEMPLATE_SHARED();
descriptionText: The LOCK_TEMPLATE_SHARED procedure is used to make a specified deployment template "read-only." This procedure should be called before instantiating a template, as this ensures that nobody can change the deployment template while it is being instantiated.

name: dbms_reputil.from_remote
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPUTIL.FROM_REMOTE()
   return BOOLEAN;
descriptionText: This function returns TRUE at the beginning of procedures in the internal replication packages, and returns FALSE at the end of these procedures. You might need to check this function if you have any triggers that could be fired as the result of an update by an internal package.

name: dbms_reputil.global_name
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPUTIL.GLOBAL_NAME()
   return VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function determines the global database name of the local database (the global name is the returned value).

name: dbms_reputil.make_internal_pkg
descriptionText: This procedure synchronizes the existence of an internal package with a table or materialized view in the replication catalog. If the table has replication support, then execute this procedure to create the internal package. If replication support does not exist, then this procedure destroys any related internal package. This procedure does not accept the storage table of a nested table.

name: dbms_reputil.replication_is_on
bodyFullText:
DBMS_REPUTIL.REPLICATION_IS_ON()
  return BOOLEAN;
descriptionText: This function determines whether replication is running. A returned value of TRUE indicates that the generated replication triggers are enabled. A return value of FALSE indicates that replication is disabled at the current site for the replication group.

name: dbms_reputil.replication_off
bodyFullText: DBMS_REPUTIL.REPLICATION_OFF();
descriptionText: This procedure enables you to modify tables without replicating the modifications to any other sites in the replication environment. It also disables row-level replication when using procedural replication. In general, you should suspend replication activity for all master groups in your replication environment before setting this flag.

name: dbms_reputil.replication_on
bodyFullText: DBMS_REPUTIL.REPLICATION_ON();
descriptionText: This procedure reenables replication of changes after replication has been temporarily suspended.

name: dbms_reputil.sync_up_rep
descriptionText: This procedure synchronizes the existence of an internal trigger with a table or materialized view in the replication catalog. If the table or materialized view has replication support, then execute this procedure to create the internal replication trigger. If replication support does not exist, then this procedure destroys any related internal trigger. This procedure does not accept the storage table of a nested table.

name: dbms_resconfig.addrepositoryresconfig
descriptionText: This procedure inserts the resource configuration specified by absolute path of the resource configuration at the specified position of the repositor\'s configuration list. It shifts the element currently at that position (if any) and any subsequent elements to the right.

name: dbms_resconfig.addresconfig
bodyFullText:
DBMS_RESCONFIG.ADDRESCONFIG(
   respath    IN   VARCHAR2, 
   rcpath     IN   VARCHAR2, 
   pos        IN   PLS_INTEGER := NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure inserts the resource configuration specified by the absolute path of the resource configuration at the given position in the target resourc\'s configuration list. It shifts the element currently at that position (if any) and any subsequent elements to the right.

name: dbms_resconfig.deleterepositoryresconfig
bodyFullText:
DBMS_RESCONFIG.DELETEREPOSITORYRESCONFIG(
   pos           IN   PLS_INTEGER);
descriptionText: This procedure removes the configuration at the given position in the repositor\'s configuration list. It shifts any subsequent elements to the left.

name: dbms_resconfig.deleteresconfig
bodyFullText:
DBMS_RESCONFIG.DELETERESCONFIG(
   respath       IN   VARCHAR2, 
   pos           IN   PLS_INTEGER);
DBMS_RESCONFIG.DELETERESCONFIG(
   respath        IN  VARCHAR2,
   rcpath         IN  VARCHAR2, 
   deleteOption   IN  PLS_INTEGER);
descriptionText: This procedure removes the configuration at the given position in the target resourc\'s configuration list. It shifts any subsequent elements to the left. Users can use the overloaded for recursive deletion.

name: dbms_resconfig.getlisteners
descriptionText: This function returns the list of listeners applicable for a given resource.

name: dbms_resconfig.getrepositoryresconfig
descriptionText: This function returns the resource configuration at the specified position of the repositor\'s configuration list.

name: dbms_resconfig.getrepositoryresconfigpaths
bodyFullText:
DBMS_RESCONFIG.GETREPOSITORYRESCONFIGPATHS
 RETURN XDB$STRING_LIST_T;
descriptionText: This function returns a list of resource configuration paths defined for the repository.

name: dbms_resconfig.getresconfig
bodyFullText:
DBMS_RESCONFIG.GETRESCONFIG(
   respath IN VARCHAR2,  
   pos IN PLS_INTEGER)
 RETURN XMLTYPE;
descriptionText: This function returns the resource configuration at the specified position of the target resourc\'s configuration list.

name: dbms_resconfig.getresconfigpaths
descriptionText: This function returns a list of resource configuration paths defined in the target resourc\'s configuration list.

name: dbms_resconfig.patchrepositoryresconfiglist
bodyFullText: DBMS_RESCONFIG.PATCHREPOSITORYRESCONFIGLIST;
descriptionText: Under normal circumstances, deletion of a resource configuration resource cannot be performed if it is part of the repository resource configuration list. If, for some reason, the deletion of a resource configuration resource that is part of the repository resource configuration list succeeds, then any repository operation results in a\'dangling referenc\' error. This procedure removes invalid references from the repository resource configuration list, and makes the repository available. This procedure must be run as SYS.

name: dbms_resource_manager.begin_sql_block
bodyFullText: DBMS_RESOURCE_MANAGER.BEGIN_SQL_BLOCK;
descriptionText: This procedure, to be used with parallel statement queuing, indicates the start of a block of SQL statements that should be treated as a group by resource manager.

name: dbms_resource_manager.calibrate_io
bodyFullText:
DBMS_RESOURCE_MANAGER.CALIBRATE_IO (
   num_physical_disks      IN  PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT 1,
   max_latency             IN  PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT 20,
   max_iops                OUT PLS_INTEGER,
   max_mbps                OUT PLS_INTEGER,
   actual_latency          OUT PLS_INTEGER);
descriptionText: This procedure calibrates the I/O capabilities of storage. Calibration status is available from the V$IO_CALIBRATION_STATUS view and results for a successful calibration run are located in DBA_RSRC_IO_CALIBRATE table.

name: dbms_resource_manager.clear_pending_area
bodyFullText: DBMS_RESOURCE_MANAGER.CLEAR_PENDING_AREA;
descriptionText: This procedure clears pending changes for the resource manager.

name: dbms_resource_manager.create_category
descriptionText: This procedure creates a new consumer group category. The primary purpose of this attribute is to support Exadata I/O Resource Manager category plans. The view DBA_RSRC_CATEGORIES defines the currently defined categories. The ADMINISTRATIVE, INTERACTIVE, BATCH, MAINTENANCE, and OTHER categories are available.

name: dbms_resource_manager.delete_category
descriptionText: This procedure deletes an existing resource consumer group category.

name: dbms_resource_manager.delete_cdb_plan
bodyFullText:
DBMS_RESOURCE_MANAGER.DELETE_CDB_PLAN (
   plan                    IN    VARCHAR2(32)   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure deletes the consolidation resource plan.

name: dbms_resource_manager.delete_cdb_plan_directive
descriptionText: This procedure deletes the plan directives of the consolidation resource plan. Once the plan directive is deleted, the pluggable database will get the default resource allocation.

name: dbms_resource_manager.delete_consumer_group
bodyFullText:
DBMS_RESOURCE_MANAGER.DELETE_CONSUMER_GROUP (
   consumer_group IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure deletes entries which define resource consumer groups.

name: dbms_resource_manager.delete_plan
bodyFullText:
DBMS_RESOURCE_MANAGER.DELETE_PLAN (
   plan IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure deletes the specified plan as well as all the plan directives to which it refers.

name: dbms_resource_manager.delete_plan_cascade
bodyFullText:
DBMS_RESOURCE_MANAGER.DELETE_PLAN_CASCADE (
   plan IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure deletes the specified plan and all of its descendants (plan directives, subplans, consumer groups). Mandatory objects and directives are not deleted.

name: dbms_resource_manager.delete_plan_directive
descriptionText: This procedure deletes resource plan directives.

name: dbms_resumable.abort
bodyFullText:
DBMS_RESUMABLE.ABORT (
   session_id  IN NUMBER);
descriptionText: This procedure aborts a suspended resumable space allocation. The parameter session_id is the session ID in which the statement is executed. For a parallel DML/DDL, session_id is any session ID that participates in the parallel DML/DDL. This operation is guaranteed to succeed. The procedure can be called either inside or outside of the AFTER SUSPEND trigger.

name: dbms_resumable.get_session_timeout

name: dbms_resumable.get_timeout

 RETURN NUMBER;
descriptionText: This function returns the current timeout value of resumable space allocations for the current session.

name: dbms_resumable.set_session_timeout
descriptionText: This procedure sets the timeout of resumable space allocations for a session with session_id. The new timeout setting applies to the session immediately. If session_id does not exist, no operation occurs.

name: dbms_resumable.set_timeout
bodyFullText:
DBMS_RESUMABLE.SET_TIMEOUT (
   timeout  IN NUMBER);
descriptionText: This procedure sets the timeout of resumable space allocations for the current session. The new timeout setting applies to the session immediately.

name: dbms_resumable.space_error_info

   object_owner      OUT VARCHAR2, 
   table_space_name  OUT VARCHAR2, 
   object_name       OUT VARCHAR2, 
   sub_object_name   OUT VARCHAR2) 
RETURN BOOLEAN;
descriptionText: This function looks for space-related errors in the error stack. If it cannot find a space related error, it will return FALSE. Otherwise, TRUE is returned and information about the particular object that causes the space error is returned.

name: dbms_rolling.build_plan
bodyFullText: DBMS_ROLLING.BUILD_PLAN ();
descriptionText: This procedure validates plan parameters and creates or modifies a rolling operation plan. A successfully constructed plan is required in order to perform a rolling operation. This procedure must return successfully before the START_PLAN procedure can be called to start the rolling operation. Parameter changes made after a plan has been created may require calling the BUILD_PLAN procedure to modify the existing plan. The DBA_ROLLING_EVENTS view will indicate if any invocation of the SET_PARAMETER procedure requires a plan rebuild. Failure to rebuild the plan will result in an ORA-45416 error when attempting to resume the rolling operation.

name: dbms_rolling.destroy_plan
bodyFullText: DBMS_ROLLING.DESTROY_PLAN ();
descriptionText: This procedure destroys any existing upgrade plan, its parameters, and all resources associated with a rolling operation.

name: dbms_rolling.finish_plan
bodyFullText: DBMS_ROLLING.FINISH_PLAN ();
descriptionText: This procedure finalizes the rolling operation. It configures the former primary (also known as the TGM) as a physical standby, and configures remaining physical standbys to recover the upgrade redo from the future primary.

name: dbms_rolling.init_plan
bodyFullText:
DBMS_ROLLING.INIT_PLAN (
   future_primary   IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure initializes a rolling operation plan with system-generated default values.

name: dbms_rolling.rollback_plan
bodyFullText: DBMS_ROLLING.ROLLBACK_PLAN;
descriptionText: This procedure rolls back the configuration-wide rolling operation. Once completed, all of the databases in the leading group become physical standbys of the original primary database. This procedure can only be called if the configuration has not yet gone through a switchover operation since the START_PLAN procedure was invoked.

name: dbms_rolling.set_parameter
bodyFullText:
DBMS_ROLLING.SET_PARAMETER (
   scope    IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   name     IN NUMBER,
   value    IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure modifies a rolling operation parameter.

name: dbms_rolling.start_plan
bodyFullText: DBMS_ROLLING.START_PLAN ();
descriptionText: This procedure starts the rolling operation. This procedure must be executed on the primary database to formally start the rolling operation. When the START_PLAN procedure is complete, the LGM (identified with the future_primary parameter in the INIT_PLAN procedure) will be converted into a fully configured transient logical standby database.

name: dbms_rolling.switchover
bodyFullText: DBMS_ROLLING.SWITCHOVER ();
descriptionText: This procedure performs a switchover between the current primary database (also known as the TGM) and the transient logical standby database (also known as the LGM). At the successful completion of the procedure, the LGM assumes the primary role for the Data Guard configuration.

DBMS_RULE.IS_FAST(
   expression            IN       VARCHAR2,
   table_aliases         IN       SYS.RE$TABLE_ALIAS_LIST:= NULL,
   variable_types        IN       SYS.RE$VARIABLE_TYPE_LIST:= NULL,
   result_val            OUT      BOOLEAN);
descriptionText: Given an expression, of either rule or Independent Expression, this procedure will return TRUE if the expression can be evaluated as fast. An expression can be evaluated as fast if the engine does not need to run any internal SQL and does not need to go to PL/SQL layer in case there are any PL/SQL functions referred.

DBMS_SCHEDULER.ADD_JOB_EMAIL_NOTIFICATION (

name: dbms_scheduler.alter_chain
bodyFullText:
DBMS_SCHEDULER.ALTER_CHAIN (
   chain_name              IN VARCHAR2,
   step_name               IN VARCHAR2,
   attribute               IN VARCHAR2,
   value                   IN BOOLEAN);
descriptionText: This procedure alters an attribute of the specified steps of a chain. This affects all future runs of the specified steps, both in the currently running chain job and in future runs of the same chain job or other chain jobs that point to the chain.

name: dbms_scheduler.alter_running_chain
bodyFullText:
DBMS_SCHEDULER.ALTER_RUNNING_CHAIN (
   job_name                IN VARCHAR2,
   step_name               IN VARCHAR2,
   attribute               IN VARCHAR2,
   value                   IN {BOOLEAN|VARCHAR2});
descriptionText: This procedure alters an attribute of the specified steps of a chain. This affects only steps of the instance of the chain for the specified running chain job.

name: dbms_scheduler.close_window
bodyFullText:
DBMS_SCHEDULER.CLOSE_WINDOW (
   window_name             IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure closes an open window prematurely. A closed window means that it is no longer in effect. When a window is closed, the Scheduler switches the resource plan to the one that is in effect outside the window, or in the case of overlapping windows, to another window.

name: dbms_scheduler.copy_job
descriptionText: This procedure copies all attributes of an existing job to a new job. The new job is created disabled, while the state of the existing job is unaltered.

name: dbms_scheduler.create_chain

descriptionText: This procedure creates a new chain. The chain name can be optionally qualified with a schema name (for example, myschema.myname).

After you create a file watcher, you reference it in an event-based job or event schedule.

bodyFullText:
DBMS_SCHEDULER.CREATE_JOB (
   job_name             IN VARCHAR2,
   job_type             IN VARCHAR2,
   job_action           IN VARCHAR2,
   number_of_arguments  IN PLS_INTEGER              DEFAULT 0,
   start_date           IN TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NULL,
   repeat_interval      IN VARCHAR2                 DEFAULT NULL,
   end_date             IN TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NULL,
   job_class            IN VARCHAR2                 DEFAULT 'DEFAULT_JOB_CLASS',
   enabled              IN BOOLEAN                  DEFAULT FALSE,
   auto_drop            IN BOOLEAN                  DEFAULT TRUE,
   comments             IN VARCHAR2                 DEFAULT NULL,
   credential_name      IN VARCHAR2                 DEFAULT NULL,
   destination_name     IN VARCHAR2                 DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure creates a single job (regular or lightweight). If you create the job as enabled by setting the enabled attribute to TRUE, the Scheduler automatically runs the job according to its schedule. If you create the job disabled, the job does not run until you enable it with the SET_ATTRIBUTE Procedure.

name: dbms_scheduler.define_chain_event_step
bodyFullText:
DBMS_SCHEDULER.DEFINE_CHAIN_EVENT_STEP (
   chain_name              IN VARCHAR2,
   step_name               IN VARCHAR2,
   event_schedule_name     IN VARCHAR2,
   timeout                 IN INTERVAL DAY TO SECOND DEFAULT NULL);

DBMS_SCHEDULER.DEFINE_CHAIN_EVENT_STEP (
   chain_name              IN VARCHAR2,
   step_name               IN VARCHAR2,
   event_condition         IN VARCHAR2,
   queue_spec              IN VARCHAR2,
   timeout                 IN INTERVAL DAY TO SECOND DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure adds or replaces a chain step and associates it with an event schedule or an inline event. Once started in a running chain, this step does not complete until the specified event has occurred. Every step in a chain must be defined before the chain can be enabled and used. Defining a step gives it a name and specifies what happens during the step. If a step already exists with this name, the new step replaces the old one.

name: dbms_scheduler.define_chain_rule
body:
chain_name => $1
	, condition => $2
	, action => $3
	, rule_name => NULL
	, comments => NULL
bodyFullText:
DBMS_SCHEDULER.DEFINE_CHAIN_RULE (
   chain_name              IN VARCHAR2,
   condition               IN VARCHAR2,
   action                  IN VARCHAR2,
   rule_name               IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   comments                IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure adds a new rule to an existing chain, specified as a condition-action pair. The condition is expressed using either SQL or the Scheduler chain condition syntax and indicates the prerequisites for the action to occur. The action is a result of the condition being met.

name: dbms_scheduler.define_chain_step
bodyFullText:
DBMS_SCHEDULER.DEFINE_CHAIN_STEP (
   chain_name              IN VARCHAR2,
   step_name               IN VARCHAR2,
   program_name            IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure adds or replaces a chain step and associates it with a program or a nested chain. When the chain step is started, the specified program or chain is run. If a step already exists with the name supplied in the chain_name argument, the new step replaces the old one.

name: dbms_scheduler.define_metadata_argument
bodyFullText:
DBMS_SCHEDULER.DEFINE_METADATA_ARGUMENT (
  program_name            IN VARCHAR2,
  metadata_attribute      IN VARCHAR2,
  argument_position       IN PLS_INTEGER,
  argument_name           IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure defines a special metadata argument for the program. The Scheduler can pass Scheduler metadata through this argument to your stored procedure or other executable. You cannot set values for jobs using this argument.

name: DBMS_SCHEDULER.define_program_argument
body:
program_name => $1
	, argument_position => $2
	, argument_name => NULL
	, argument_type => $3
	, out_argument => FALSE
bodyFullText:
define_program_argument(
   program_name            IN VARCHAR2,
   argument_position       IN PLS_INTEGER,
   argument_name           IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   argument_type           IN VARCHAR2,
   out_argument            IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
descriptionText: This procedure defines a name or default value for a program argument. If no default value is defined for a program argument, the job that references the program must supply an argument value. (The job can also override a default value.)

name: dbms_scheduler.disable
bodyFullText:
DBMS_SCHEDULER.DISABLE (
   name              IN VARCHAR2,
   force             IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   commit_semantics  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'STOP_ON_FIRST_ERROR');
descriptionText: This procedure disables a program, job, chain, window, database destination, external destination, file watcher, or group. When an object is disabled, its enabled attribute is set to FALSE.

name: dbms_scheduler.drop_agent_destination
bodyFullText:
DBMS_SCHEDULER.DROP_AGENT_DESTINATION (
   destination_name        IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure drops one or more external destinations, also known as agent destinations. It should be used only when the preferred method of dropping an external destination, using the schagent utility to unregister a Scheduler agent with a database, is unavailable due to failures.

name: dbms_scheduler.drop_chain
descriptionText: This procedure drops an existing chain.

name: dbms_scheduler.drop_chain_rule
bodyFullText:
DBMS_SCHEDULER.DROP_CHAIN_RULE (
   chain_name              IN VARCHAR2,
   rule_name               IN VARCHAR2,
   force                   IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
descriptionText: This procedure removes a rule from an existing chain. The rule object corresponding to this rule will also be dropped. The chain will not be disabled. If dropping this rule makes the chain invalid, the user should first disable the chain to ensure that it does not run.

name: dbms_scheduler.drop_chain_step
bodyFullText:
DBMS_SCHEDULER.DROP_CHAIN_STEP (
   chain_name              IN VARCHAR2,
   step_name               IN VARCHAR2,
   force                   IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
descriptionText: This procedure drops a chain step. If this chain step is still used in the chain rules, the chain will be disabled.

name: dbms_scheduler.drop_group

name: dbms_scheduler.drop_job
body:
job_name => $1
	, force => FALSE
	, defer => FALSE
	, commit_semantics => 'STOP_ON_FIRST_ERROR'
bodyFullText:
DBMS_SCHEDULER.DROP_JOB (
   job_name                IN VARCHAR2,
   force                   IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   defer                   IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   commit_semantics        IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'STOP_ON_FIRST_ERROR');
descriptionText: This procedure drops one or more jobs or all jobs in one or more job classes. Dropping a job also drops all argument values set for that job.

name: dbms_scheduler.drop_job_class
descriptionText: This procedure drops a job class. Dropping a job class means that all the metadata about the job class is removed from the database.

name: dbms_scheduler.drop_program
descriptionText: This procedure drops a program. Any arguments that pertain to the program are also dropped when the program is dropped.

name: dbms_scheduler.drop_program_argument
descriptionText: This procedure drops a program argument. An argument can be specified by either name (if one has been given) or position.

name: dbms_scheduler.drop_schedule
descriptionText: This procedure drops a schedule.

name: dbms_scheduler.drop_window
descriptionText: This procedure drops a window. All metadata about the window is removed from the database. The window is removed from any groups that reference it.

name: dbms_scheduler.enable
descriptionText: This procedure enables a program, job, chain, window, database destination, external destination, file watcher, or group. When an object is enabled, its enabled attribute is set to TRUE. By default, jobs, chains, and programs are created disabled and database destinations, external destinations, file watchers, windows, and groups are created enabled.

name: dbms_scheduler.end_detached_job_run
bodyFullText:
DBMS_SCHEDULER.END_DETACHED_JOB_RUN (
   job_name          IN VARCHAR2,
   error_number      IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
   additional_info   IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure ends a detached job run. A detached job points to a detached program, which is a program with the detached attribute set to TRUE. A detached job run does not end until this procedure or the STOP_JOB Procedure is called.

name: dbms_scheduler.evaluate_calendar_string
bodyFullText:
DBMS_SCHEDULER.EVALUATE_CALENDAR_STRING (
   calendar_string    IN  VARCHAR2,
   start_date         IN  TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE,
   return_date_after  IN  TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE,
   next_run_date      OUT TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE);
descriptionText: You can define repeat intervals of jobs, windows or schedules using the Scheduler calendaring syntax. This procedure evaluates the calendar expression and tells you the next execution date and time of a job or window. This is very useful for testing the correct definition of the calendar string without actually scheduling the job or window.

name: dbms_scheduler.evaluate_running_chain
bodyFullText:
DBMS_SCHEDULER.EVALUATE_RUNNING_CHAIN (
   job_name              IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure forces reevaluation of the rules of a running chain to trigger any rules for which the conditions have been satisfied. The job passed as an argument must point to a chain and must be running. If the job is not running, an error is thrown. (RUN_JOB can be used to start the job.)

name: dbms_scheduler.generate_job_name
bodyFullText:
DBMS_SCHEDULER.GENERATE_JOB_NAME (
   prefix        IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'JOB$_') RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function returns a unique name for a job. The name will be of the form {prefix}N where N is a number from a sequence. If no prefix is specified, the generated name will, by default, be JOB$_1, JOB$_2, JOB$_3, and so on. If\'SCOT\' is specified as the prefix, the name will be SCOTT1, SCOTT2, and so on.

name: dbms_scheduler.get_agent_info
descriptionText: This function can return job information specific to an agent, such as how many are running and so on, depending on the attribute selected.

name: dbms_scheduler.get_agent_version
bodyFullText:
DBMS_SCHEDULER.GET_AGENT_VERSION (
   agent_host        IN VARCHAR2) RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function returns the version string of a Scheduler agent that is registered with the database and is currently running. GET_AGENT_VERSION throws an error if the agent is not registered with the database or if the agent is not currently running.

name: dbms_scheduler.open_window

The window opens and the resource plan associated with it takes effect immediately, for the duration specified or for the normal duration of the window, if no duration is given. Only an enabled window can be manually opened.

name: dbms_scheduler.purge_log
