bodyNoDefault:
replay_id1 => $1
	, replay_id2 => $2
	, format => $3
	, r_level => $4
	, r_sections => $5
	, result => $6
bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.COMPARE_SQLSET_REPORT (
   replay_id1    IN NUMBER,
   replay_id2    IN NUMBER,
   format        IN VARCHAR2,
   r_level       IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'ALL',
   r_sections    IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'ALL',
   result        OUT CLOB )
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This procedure generates a report comparing a sqlset captured during replay to one captured during workload capture or to one captured during another replay of the same capture.

name: dbms_workload_replay.create_filter_set
bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.CREATE_FILTER_SET(
   replay_dir       IN  VARCHAR2,
   filter_set       IN  VARCHAR2,
   default_action   IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'INCLUDE');
descriptionText: This procedure creates a new filter set for the replays at replay_dir. It includes all the replay filters that have already been added by the ADD_FILTER Procedure. After the procedure has completed and replay initiated, the newly-created filter set can be used to filter the replay in replay_dir by calling the USE_FILTER_SET Procedure.

name: dbms_workload_replay.delete_filter
bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.DELETE_FILTER(
   fname    IN  VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure deletes the named filter.

name: dbms_workload_replay.delete_replay_info
bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.DELETE_REPLAY_INFO (
   replay_id    IN  NUMBER);
descriptionText: This procedure deletes the rows in DBA_WORKLOAD_REPLAYS that correspond to the given workload replay ID.

name: dbms_workload_replay.end_replay_schedule
bodyFullText: DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.END_REPLAY_SCHEDULE;
descriptionText: This procedure wraps up the creation of the current schedule. The schedule is now saved and associated with the replay directory and can be used for a replay.

name: dbms_workload_replay.export_awr
bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.EXPORT_AWR (
   replay_id    IN  NUMBER);
descriptionText: This procedure exports the AWR snapshots associated with a stipulated replay ID.

name: dbms_workload_replay.generate_capture_subset
body:
input_capture_dir => $1
	, output_capture_dir => $2
	, new_capture_name => $3
	, begin_time => $4
	, begin_include_incomplete => TRUE
	, end_time => $5
	, end_include_incomplete => FALSE
	, parallel_level => NULL
bodyNoDefault:
input_capture_dir => $1
	, output_capture_dir => $2
	, new_capture_name => $3
	, begin_time => $4
	, begin_include_incomplete => $5
	, end_time => $6
	, end_include_incomplete => $7
	, parallel_level => $8
bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.GENERATE_CAPTURE_SUBSET (
   input_capture_dir          IN   VARCHAR2,
   output_capture_dir         IN   VARCHAR2,
   new_capture_name           IN   VARCHAR2,
   begin_time                 IN   NUMBER,
   begin_include_incomplete   IN   BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
   end_time                   IN   NUMBER,
   end_include_incomplete     IN   BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   parallel_level             IN   NUMBER DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure creates a new capture from an existing workload capture.

name: dbms_workload_replay.get_diverging_statement
bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.GET_DIVERGING_STATEMENT (
   replay_id    IN NUMBER,
   stream_id    IN NUMBER,
   call_counter IN NUMBER)
  RETURN CLOB;
descriptionText: This function retrieves information about a diverging call, including the statement text, the SQL ID, and the binds. If the replay of a recorded user call has data or error divergence, it is a diverging call.

name: dbms_workload_replay.get_replay_directory
bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.GET_REPLAY_DIRECTORY
   RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function returns the current replay directory set by the SET_REPLAY_DIRECTORY Procedure. It returns NULL if no replay directory has been set.

name: dbms_workload_replay.get_replay_info
descriptionText: This function retrieves information about the workload capture and the history of all the workload replay attempts from the stipulated directory.

name: dbms_workload_replay.get_replay_timeout
bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.GET_REPLAY_TIMEOUT (
   enabled       OUT  BOOLEAN, 
   min_delay     OUT  NUMBER,
   max_delay     OUT  NUMBER,
   delay_factor  OUT  NUMBER);
descriptionText: This procedure gets the replay timeout setting.

name: dbms_workload_replay.import_awr
bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.IMPORT_AWR (
   replay_id       IN   NUMBER,
   staging_schema  IN   VARCHAR2)
  RETURN NUMBER;
descriptionText: This procedure imports the AWR snapshots from a given replay.

name: dbms_workload_replay.initialize_consolidated_replay
descriptionText: This procedure puts the database state in INIT for a multiple-capture replay. It uses the replay_dir which has already been defined by the SET_REPLAY_DIRECTORY Procedure, pointing to a directory that contains all the capture directories involved in the schedule. It reads data about schedule schedule_name from the directory, and loads required connection data into the replay system.

name: dbms_workload_replay.initialize_replay
descriptionText: This procedure puts the database state in INIT for REPLAY mode, and loads data into the replay system that is required before preparing for the replay (by executing the PAUSE_REPLAY Procedure).

name: dbms_workload_replay.is_replay_paused
bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.IS_REPLAY_PAUSED
   RETURN BOOLEAN;
descriptionText: This function reports whether the replay is currently paused.

name: dbms_workload_replay.pause_replay
bodyFullText: DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.PAUSE_REPLAY;
descriptionText: This procedure pauses the in-progress workload replay. All subsequent user calls from the replay clients will be stalled until either a call to the RESUME_REPLAY Procedure is issued or the replay is cancelled.

name: dbms_workload_replay.populate_divergence
bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.POPULATE_DIVERGENCE (
   replay_id    IN   NUMBER,
   stream_id    IN   NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
   call_counter IN   NUMBER DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure precomputes the divergence information for the given call, stream, or the whole replay so that the GET_DIVERGING_STATEMENT Function returns as quickly as possible for the precomputed calls.

name: dbms_workload_replay.prepare_consolidated_replay
body:
synchronization => $1
	, connect_time_scale => 100
	, think_time_scale => 100
	, think_time_auto_correct => TRUE
	, capture_sts => FALSE
	, sts_cap_interval => 300
bodyNoDefault:
synchronization => $1
	, connect_time_scale => $2
	, think_time_scale => $3
	, think_time_auto_correct => $4
	, capture_sts => $5
	, sts_cap_interval => $6
bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.PREPARE_CONSOLIDATED_REPLAY (
   synchronization           IN BOOLEAN,
   connect_time_scale        IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 100,
   think_time_scale          IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 100,
   think_time_auto_correct   IN BOOLEAN   DEFAULT TRUE,
   capture_sts               IN BOOLEAN   DEFAULT FALSE,
   sts_cap_interval          IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 300);

DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.PREPARE_CONSOLIDATED_REPLAY (
   synchronization           IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT 'OBJECT_ID',,
   connect_time_scale        IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 100,
   think_time_scale          IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 100,
   think_time_auto_correct   IN BOOLEAN   DEFAULT TRUE,
   capture_sts               IN BOOLEAN   DEFAULT FALSE,
   sts_cap_interval          IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 300);
descriptionText: Similar to the PREPARE_REPLAY Procedure, this procedure puts the database in a special "Prepare" mode for a multiple-capture replay. The difference is that this subprogram should be used only for consolidated replays.

name: dbms_workload_replay.prepare_replay
body:
synchronization => TRUE
	, connect_time_scale => 100
	, think_time_scale => 100
	, think_time_auto_correct => TRUE
	, scale_up_multiplier => 1
	, capture_sts => FALSE
	, sts_cap_interval => 300
bodyNoDefault:
synchronization => $1
	, connect_time_scale => $2
	, think_time_scale => $3
	, think_time_auto_correct => $4
	, scale_up_multiplier => $5
	, capture_sts => $6
	, sts_cap_interval => $7
bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.PREPARE_REPLAY (
   synchronization           IN BOOLEAN   DEFAULT TRUE,
   connect_time_scale        IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 100,
   think_time_scale          IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 100,
   think_time_auto_correct   IN BOOLEAN   DEFAULT TRUE,
   scale_up_multiplier       IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 1,
   capture_sts               IN BOOLEAN   DEFAULT FALSE,
   sts_cap_interval          IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 300);

DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.PREPARE_REPLAY (
   synchronization           IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT 'OBJECT_ID',
   connect_time_scale        IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 100,
   think_time_scale          IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 100,
   think_time_auto_correct   IN BOOLEAN   DEFAULT TRUE,
   scale_up_multiplier       IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 1,
   capture_sts               IN BOOLEAN   DEFAULT FALSE,
   sts_cap_interval          IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 300);
descriptionText: This procedure puts the database state in PREPARE FOR REPLAY mode.

name: dbms_workload_replay.process_capture
descriptionText: This procedure processes the workload capture found in capture_dir in place.

name: dbms_workload_replay.remap_connection
bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.REMAP_CONNECTION (
   connection_id         IN  NUMBER,
   replay_connection     IN  VARCHAR2);

DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.REMAP_CONNECTION (
   capture_number        IN  VARCHAR2,
   connection_id         IN  NUMBER,
   replay_connection     IN  VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure remaps the captured connection to a new one so that the user sessions can connect to the database in a desired way during workload replay.

name: dbms_workload_replay.remove_capture
bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.REMOVE_CAPTURE (
   schedule_capture_number    IN     NUMBER);
descriptionText: This procedure removes the given capture from the current schedule.

name: dbms_workload_replay.remove_schedule_ordering
descriptionText: This procedure removes an existing schedule order from the current replay schedule. Together, schedule_capture_id and waitfor_capture_id form a schedule ordering that previously added by the ADD_SCHEDULE_ORDERING Function (schedule_capture_id, waitfor_capture_id). The order is that replay of capture indicated by schedule_capture_id will not start unless the replay of capture indicated by waiting_for_capture_id finishes.

name: dbms_workload_replay.report
bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.REPORT (
   replay_id          IN NUMBER,
   format             IN VARCHAR2)
  RETURN CLOB;
descriptionText: This function generates a report on the stipulated workload replay.

name: dbms_workload_replay.resume_replay
bodyFullText: DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.RESUME_REPLAY;
descriptionText: This procedure resumes a paused workload replay.

name: dbms_workload_replay.reuse_replay_filter_set
descriptionText: This procedure reuses filters in the specified filter set as if each were added using the ADD_SCHEDULE_ORDERING Function. Each call adds one filter set, which is a collection of individual filters on various attributes. Also, a new filter rule can be added, and an existing filter can be deleted before invoking the CREATE_FILTER_SET Procedure to create a new filter set.

name: dbms_workload_replay.set_advanced_parameter
descriptionText: This procedure sets an advanced parameter for replay besides the ones used with the PREPARE_REPLAY Procedure. The advanced parameters control aspects of the replay that are more specialized. The advanced parameters are reset to their default values after the replay has finished.

name: dbms_workload_replay.set_replay_directory
bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.SET_REPLAY_DIRECTORY (
   replay_dir    IN    VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure sets a directory that contains multiple workload captures as the current replay directory.

name: dbms_workload_replay.set_replay_timeout
bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.SET_REPLAY_TIMEOUT (
   enabled       OUT  BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE, 
   min_delay     OUT  NUMBER DEFAULT 10,
   max_delay     OUT  NUMBER DEFAULT 120,
   delay_factor  OUT  NUMBER DEFAULT 8);
descriptionText: This procedure sets the replay timeout setting. The purpose is to abort user calls that might make the replay much slower or even cause a replay hang.

name: dbms_workload_replay.set_user_mapping
bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.SET_USER_MAPPING (
   schedule_cap_id      IN NUMBER,
   capture_user         IN VARCHAR2,
   replay_user          IN VARCHAR2);

DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.SET_USER_MAPPING (
   capture_user         IN VARCHAR2,
   replay_user          IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure sets a new schema or user name to be used during replay instead of the captured user.

name: dbms_workload_replay.start_consolidated_replay
bodyFullText: DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.START_CONSOLIDATED_REPLAY;
descriptionText: This procedure starts the replay of a multiple-capture capture. It should be used only for consolidated replays.

name: dbms_workload_replay.start_replay
bodyFullText: DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.START_REPLAY;
descriptionText: This procedure starts the workload replay. All the external replay clients (WRC) that are currently connected to the replay database will automatically be notified, and those replay clients (WRC) will begin issuing the captured workload. It should only be used for consolidated replays.

name: dbms_workload_replay.use_filter_set
descriptionText: This procedure applies a filter set to a capture in the current replay schedule. The filter set must have been created by calling the CREATE_FILTER_SET Procedure.

name: dbms_workload_repository.add_colored_sql
descriptionText: This procedure adds a colored SQL ID. If an SQL ID is colored, it will be captured in every snapshot, independent of its level of activities (so that it does not have to be a TOP SQL). Capture occurs if the SQL is found in the cursor cache at snapshot time.To uncolor the SQL, invoke the REMOVE_COLORED_SQL Procedure.

name: dbms_workload_repository.update_object_info

DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPOSITORY.UPDATE_OBJECT_INFO(
   maxrows   IN  NUMBER  DEFAULT 0);
descriptionText: This procedure updates rows of WRH$_SEG_STAT_OBJ table that represent objects in the local database. It attempts to determine the current names for all object belonging to the local database, except those with\'MISSIN\' and/or\'TRANSIEN\' values in the name columns. The amount of work performed at each invocation of this routine may be controlled by setting the input parameter.

name: dbms_xdb_repos.deleteresourcemetadata
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XDB_REPOS.DELETERESOURCEMETADATA (
   abspath        IN  VARCHAR2, 
   metadata       IN  REF SYS.XMLTYPE,
   delete_option  IN  pls_integer := DBMS_XDB_REPOS.DELETE_RESOURCE_METADATA_CASCADE);
descriptionText: This procedure takes in a resource by absolute path and removes either the schema-based metadata identified by the REF, or the metadata identified by the namespace and name combination, which can be either schema-based or non-schema based. It also takes an additional (optional) parameter that specifies how to delete it. This parameter is only relevant for schema-based resource metadata that needs to be deleted. For non-schema based metadata, this parameter is ignored.

name: dbms_xdb_version.getpredecessors
descriptionText: This function retrieves the list of predecessors by the path name.

name: dbms_xdb_version.getpredsbyresid
descriptionText: This function retrieves the list of predecessors by resource id.

name: dbms_xdb_version.getresourcebyresid

name: dbms_xdb_version.getsuccsbyresid
descriptionText: This function retrieves the list of the successors of the resource by resource id using version resource or VCR.

name: dbms_xdb_version.makeversioned
descriptionText: This function turns a regular resource whose path name is given into a version-controlled resource. This new resource is then put under version control. All other path names continue to refer to the original resource.

name: dbms_xdb_version.uncheckout
descriptionText: This function checks-in a checked-out resource and returns the resource id of the version before the resource is checked out.

name: dbms_xdbz.disable_hierarchy
descriptionText: This procedure disables repository support for a particular XMLType table or view.

name: dbms_xdbz.enable_hierarchy
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XDBZ.ENABLE_HIERARCHY(
   object_schema   IN   VARCHAR2,
   object_name     IN   VARCHAR2,
   hierarchy_type  IN   PLS_INTEGER := DBMS_XDBZ.ENABLE_CONTENTS);
descriptionText: This procedure enables repository support for a particular XMLType table or view. This allows the use of a uniform ACL-based security model across all documents in the repository.

name: dbms_xdbz.get_acloid
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XDBZ.GET_ACLOID(
   aclpath   IN   VARCHAR2,
   acloid    OUT  RAW)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;
descriptionText: This function retrieves the ACL Object ID for the specified resource, if the repository path is known.

name: dbms_xdbz.get_userid
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XDBZ.GET_USERID(
   username IN  VARCHAR2,
   userid   OUT RAW,
   format   IN  BINARY_INTEGER := NAME_FORMAT_SHORT)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;
descriptionText: This function retrieves the user ID for the specified user name. The local database is searched first, and if found, the USERID is returned in 4-byte database format. Otherwise, the LDAP directory is searched, if available, and if found, the USERID is returned in 4-byte database format.

name: dbms_xdbz.is_hierarchy_enabled
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XDBZ.IS_HIERARCHY_ENABLED(
   object_schema   IN  VARCHAR2,
   object_name     IN  VARCHAR2,
   hierarchy_type  IN  PLS_INTEGER := IS_ENABLED_CONTENTS)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;
descriptionText: This function determines if repository support for the specified XMLType table or view is enabled.

name: dbms_xdbz.purgeldapcache
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XDBZ.PURGELDAPCACHE
 RETURN BOOLEAN;
descriptionText: This function purges the LDAP nickname cache. Returns TRUE if successful.

name: dbms_xevent.clear
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XEVENT.CLEAR (
    hl       IN OUT   XDBHandlerList);
descriptionText: this procedure clears the handler list.

name: dbms_xevent.getapplicationdata
descriptionText: This function returns the <applicationData> element extracted from the resource configuration that defines the invoking handler.

name: dbms_xevent.getchildoid
descriptionText: This function returns the OID of the resource to which the link is pointing.

name: dbms_xevent.getcurrentuser
descriptionText: This function returns the name of the user executing the operation that triggers the event.

name: dbms_xevent.getevent
descriptionText: This function returns the name of the user executing the operation that triggers the event.

name: dbms_xevent.getfirst
descriptionText: This function returns the first handler in the list.

name: dbms_xevent.gethandlerlist
descriptionText: This function returns an XDBHandlerList object containing the list of handlers that will be executed after the currently executing handler. The current handler can then filter out some of the subsequent handlers if necessary, subject to security checks. An insufficient privilege exception is raised if the executing user does not have the required access privilege to any of the resource configuration associating with a handler in the list.

name: dbms_xevent.getinterface
descriptionText: This function returns the top-level interface used to initiate the operation that triggered the event. This could be HTTP, FTP or SQL.

name: dbms_xevent.getlanguage
descriptionText: This function returns the implementation language of the handler.

name: dbms_xevent.getlink
descriptionText: This function returns an XDBLink object for the target resource. For a link* or unlink* event, this will be the link involved in the operation. For other events, an error is returned. Using this object the handler can access link properties, such as, ParentName, ParentOID, ChildOID and LinkName.

name: dbms_xevent.getlinkname
descriptionText: This function returns the name of the link.

name: dbms_xevent.getlock
descriptionText: This function returns the lock object corresponding to the current operation.I t is only valid for lock and unlock events.

name: dbms_xevent.getname
descriptionText: This function returns the string representation of the path.

name: dbms_xevent.getnext
descriptionText: This function returns the next handler in the list.

name: dbms_xevent.getoldresource
descriptionText: This function returns the original XDBResource object before the operation was executed. This method applies only to update event. For other events, an error is returned. This is a read-only object, and consequently none of the modifier methods will work on this object.

name: dbms_xevent.getopenaccessmode
descriptionText: This function returns the access mode for the open operation.

name: dbms_xevent.getopendenymode
descriptionText: This function returns the deny mode for the open operation. It is only valid for the open event.

name: dbms_xevent.getoutputstream
descriptionText: This function returns the output BLOB in which the handler can write the rendered data. It is only valid for the render event.

name: dbms_xevent.getparameter
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XEVENT.GETPARAMETER (
    ev   IN   XDBRepositoryEvent,
    key  IN   VARCHAR2) 
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function returns the value of a request or session-specific parameter. The definition of the key parameter can be found in RFC 2616 (HTTP/1.1). They will be mapped to equivalent SQL session parameters (if any).

name: dbms_xevent.getparent
descriptionText: This function returns the resource object corresponding to a parent folder of the target resource. Note that this could be any folder that contains a link to the target resource. This is a read-only object, and consequently none of the modifier methods will work on this object. For a link* or unlink* event, this method returns the lin\'s parent folder.

name: dbms_xevent.getparentname
descriptionText: This function returns the lin\'s parent folde\'s name.

name: dbms_xevent.getparentoid
descriptionText: This function returns the lin\'s parent folde\'s OID.

name: dbms_xevent.getparentpath
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XEVENT.GETPARENTPATH (
    path   IN   XDBPath,
   level   IN   INTEGER) 
  RETURN XDBPath;
descriptionText: This function returns the paren\'s path. The level indicates the number of levels up the hierarchy. This value must be greater than zero. Level 1 means the immediate parent. If level exceeds the height of the tree then a NULL is returned.

name: dbms_xevent.getpath
descriptionText: This function returns the XDBPath object representing the path of the resource for which the event was fired. From this object, functions are provided to get the different path segments.

name: dbms_xevent.getresource
descriptionText: This function returns an XDBResource object that provides methods to access and modify the contents and metadata of the target resource. This object reflects any changes made by previous handlers to the resource.

name: dbms_xevent.getschema
descriptionText: This function returns the schema of the handle\'s source.

name: dbms_xevent.getsource
descriptionText: This function returns the name of the Java class, PL/SQL package or object type implementing the handler.

name: dbms_xevent.getupdatebytecount
descriptionText: If the current operation is a byte-range write, the function returns the byte count. It is only valid for the inconsistent-update event.

name: dbms_xevent.getupdatebyteoffset
descriptionText: If the current operation is a byte-range write, function returns the byte offset at which the range begins. It is only valid for the inconsistent-update event.

name: dbms_xevent.getxdbetevent
descriptionText: This function converts an XDBRepositoryEvent object to an XDBEvent type.

name: dbms_xevent.isnull
descriptionText: This function returns TRUE if input argument is NULL.

name: dbms_xevent.remove
descriptionText: This procedure removes the specified handler from the handler list.

name: dbms_xevent.setrenderpath
descriptionText: This procedure specifies the path of the resource that contains the rendered contents. This should not be called after the stream returned by GETOUTPUTSTREAM Function is written to or after the SETRENDERSTREAM Procedure is called; doing so will result in an error. This is only valid for the render event.

name: dbms_xevent.setrenderstream
descriptionText: This procedure sets the BLOB from which the rendered contents can be read. This should not be called after the stream returned by GETOUTPUTSTREAM is written to or after SETRENDERPATH is called; doing so will result in an error. This is only valid for the render event.

name: dbms_xmldom.adoptnode
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.ADOPTNODE(
   doc            IN   DOMDocument,
   importedNode   IN   DOMNode)
 RETURN DOMNODE;
descriptionText: This function adopts a node from another document, and returns this new node.

name: dbms_xmldom.appendchild
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.APPENDCHILD(
   n          IN    DOMNode,
   newchild   IN    DOMNode)
 RETURN DOMNODE;
descriptionText: This function adds the node newchild to the end of the list of children of this node, and returns the newly added node. If the newchild is already in the tree, it is first removed.

name: dbms_xmldom.appenddata
descriptionText: This procedure appends the string to the end of the character data of the node. Upon success, data provides access to the concatenation of data and the specified string argument.

name: dbms_xmldom.clonenode
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.CLONENODE(
   n       IN    DOMNODE,
   deep    IN    BOOLEAN)
 RETURN DOMNODE;
descriptionText: This function returns a duplicate of this node, and serves as a generic copy constructor for nodes. The duplicate node has no parent, its parent node is NULL.

name: dbms_xmldom.createattribute
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.CREATEATTRIBUTE(
   doc     IN    DOMDOCUMENT,
   name    IN    VARCHAR2)
 RETURN DOMATTR;
descriptionText: This function creates a DOMATTR node.

DBMS_XMLDOM.CREATECDATASECTION(

DBMS_XMLDOM.CREATECOMMENT(

descriptionText: This function creates a DOMCOMMENT node.

name: dbms_xmldom.createdocumentfragment

name: dbms_xmldom.createentityreference

   offset    IN     NUMBER,
   cnt       IN     NUMBER);
descriptionText: This procedure removes a range of characters from the node. Upon success, data and length reflect the change.

DBMS_XMLDOM.FREEDOCFRAG(
   df    IN    DOMDOCUMENTFRAGMENT);

   elem      IN     DOMELEMENT);

bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.GETATTRIBUTE(
   elem       IN      DOMELEMENT,
   name       IN      VARCHAR2)
 RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function returns the value of an attribute of an DOMELEMENT by name.

name: dbms_xmldom.getattributenode
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.GETATTRIBUTENODE(
   elem      IN     DOMElement,
   name      IN     VARCHAR2)
 RETURN DOMATTR;
descriptionText: This function returns an attribute node from the DOMELEMENT by name. The function is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

name: dbms_xmldom.getattributes
descriptionText: This function retrieves a NAMEDNODEMAP containing the attributes of this node (if it is an Element) or NULL otherwise.

name: dbms_xmldom.getcharset
descriptionText: This function retrieves the characterset of the DOM document.

name: dbms_xmldom.getchildnodes
descriptionText: This function retrieves a DOMNODELIST that contains all children of this node. If there are no children, this is a DOMNODELIST containing no nodes.

name: dbms_xmldom.getchildrenbytagname
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.GETCHILDRENBYTAGNAME(
   elem      IN      DOMElement, 
   name      IN      VARCHAR2) 
 RETURN DOMNODELIST;
descriptionText: This function returns the children of the DOMELEMENT.

name: dbms_xmldom.getdata
descriptionText: This function is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

name: dbms_xmldom.getdoctype
descriptionText: This function returns the DTD associated to the DOMDOCUMENT.

name: dbms_xmldom.getdocumentelement
descriptionText: This function returns the root element of the DOMDOCUMENT.

name: dbms_xmldom.getelementsbytagname
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.GETELEMENTSBYTAGNAME(
   doc         IN      DOMDOCUMENT,
   tagname     IN      VARCHAR2)
 RETURN DOMNODELIST;
descriptionText: This function is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

name: dbms_xmldom.getentities
descriptionText: This function retrieves a DOMNAMEDNODEMAP containing the general entities, both external and internal, declared in the DTD.

name: dbms_xmldom.getexpandedname
descriptionText: This subprogram is overloaded as a procedure and two functions. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

name: dbms_xmldom.getfirstchild
descriptionText: This function retrieves the first child of this node. If there is no such node, this returns NULL.

name: dbms_xmldom.getimplementation
descriptionText: This function returns the DOMIMPLEMENTATION object that handles this DOMDOCUMENT.

name: dbms_xmldom.getlastchild
descriptionText: This function retrieves the last child of this node. If there is no such node, this returns NULL.

name: dbms_xmldom.getlength
descriptionText: This function is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

name: dbms_xmldom.getlocalname
descriptionText: This function is overloaded as a procedure and two functions. The specific forms of functionality are described alongside the syntax declarations.

name: dbms_xmldom.getname
descriptionText: This function is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described alongside the syntax declarations.

name: dbms_xmldom.getnameditem
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.GETNAMEDITEM(
   nnm    IN  DOMNAMEDNODEMAP,
   name   IN  VARCHAR2)
 RETURN DOMNODE;
descriptionText: This function retrieves a node specified by name.

name: dbms_xmldom.getnamespace
descriptionText: This subprogram is overloaded as a procedure and two functions. The specific forms of functionality are described alongside the syntax declarations.

name: dbms_xmldom.getnextsibling
descriptionText: This function retrieves the node immediately following this node. If there is no such node, this returns NULL.

name: dbms_xmldom.getnodename
descriptionText: This function gets the name of the node depending on its type.

name: dbms_xmldom.getnodetype
descriptionText: This function retrieves a code representing the type of the underlying object.

name: dbms_xmldom.getnodevalue
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.GETNODEVALUE(
   n       IN     DOMNODE)
 RETURN VARCHAR2;*
descriptionText: This function gets the value of this node, depending on its type.

name: dbms_xmldom.getnodevalueasbinarystream
descriptionText: The operation of these subprograms is described with each syntax implementation.

name: dbms_xmldom.getnodevalueascharacterstream
descriptionText: The operation of these subprograms is described with each syntax implementation.

name: dbms_xmldom.getnotationname
descriptionText: This function returns the notation name of the DOMENTITY.

name: dbms_xmldom.getnotations
descriptionText: This function retrieves a DOMNAMEDNODEMAP containing the notations declared in the DTD.

name: dbms_xmldom.getownerdocument
descriptionText: This function retrieves the Document object associated with this node. This is also the Document object used to create new nodes. When this node is a Document or a Document Type that is not used with any Document yet, this is NULL.

name: dbms_xmldom.getownerelement
descriptionText: This function retrieves the Element node to which the specified Attribute is attached.

name: dbms_xmldom.getparentnode
descriptionText: This function retrieves the parent of this node. All nodes, except Attr, Document, DocumentFragment, Entity, and Notation may have a parent. However, if a node has just been created and not yet added to the tree, or if it has been removed from the tree, this is NULL.

name: dbms_xmldom.getprefix
descriptionText: This function retrieves the namespace prefix of the node.

name: dbms_xmldom.getprevioussibling
descriptionText: This function retrieves the node immediately preceding this node. If there is no such node, this returns NULL.

name: dbms_xmldom.getpublicid
descriptionText: This function is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

name: dbms_xmldom.getqualifiedname
descriptionText: This function is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

name: dbms_xmldom.getschemanode
descriptionText: This function retrieves the schema URI associated with the node.

name: dbms_xmldom.getspecified
descriptionText: If this attribute was explicitly specified, a value in the original document, this is true; otherwise, it is false.

name: dbms_xmldom.getstandalone
descriptionText: This function returns the standalone property associated with the DOMDOCUMENT.

name: dbms_xmldom.getsystemid
descriptionText: This function is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

name: dbms_xmldom.gettagname
descriptionText: This function returns the name of the DOMELEMENT.

name: dbms_xmldom.gettarget
descriptionText: This function returns the target of the DOMPROCESSINGINSTRUCTION.

name: dbms_xmldom.getvalue
descriptionText: This function retrieves the value of the attribute.

name: dbms_xmldom.getversion
descriptionText: This function returns the version of the DOMDOCUMENT.

name: dbms_xmldom.getxmltype
descriptionText: This function returns the XMLType associated with the DOMDOCUMENT.

name: dbms_xmldom.hasattribute
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.HASATTRIBUTE(
   elem     IN  DOMELEMENT,
   name     IN  VARCHAR2)
 RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: Verifies whether an attribute has been defined for DOMELEMENT, or has a default value.

name: dbms_xmldom.hasattributes
descriptionText: This function returns whether this node has any attributes.

name: dbms_xmldom.haschildnodes
descriptionText: This function determines whether this node has any children.

name: dbms_xmldom.hasfeature
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.HASFEATURE(
   di       IN     DOMIMPLEMENTATION,
   feature  IN     VARCHAR2,
   version  IN     VARCHAR2)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;
descriptionText: This function tests if the DOMIMPLEMENTATION implements a specific feature.

name: dbms_xmldom.importnode
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.IMPORTNODE(
   doc            IN  DOMDOCUMENT,
   importedNode   IN  DOMNODE,
   deep           IN  BOOLEAN)
  RETURN DOMNODE;
descriptionText: This function imports a node from an external document and returns this new node.

name: dbms_xmldom.insertbefore
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.INSERTBEFORE(
   n          IN     DOMNODE,
   newchild   IN     DOMNODE,
   refchild   IN     DOMNODE)
  RETURN DOMNode;
descriptionText: This function inserts the node newchild before the existing child node refchild. If refchild is NULL, insert newchild at the end of the list of children.

name: dbms_xmldom.insertdata
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.INSERTDATA(
   cd       IN     DOMCHARACTERDATA,
   offset   IN     NUMBER,
   arg      IN     VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure inserts a string at the specified character offset.

name: dbms_xmldom.isnull
descriptionText: This function is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

name: dbms_xmldom.item
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.ITEM(
   nnm       IN     DOMNAMEDNODEMAP,
   index     IN     NUMBER)
 RETURN DOMNODE;
descriptionText: This function is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

name: dbms_xmldom.makeattr
descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMATTR, and returns the DOMATTR.

name: dbms_xmldom.makecdatasection
descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMCDATASECTION.

name: dbms_xmldom.makecharacterdata
descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMCHARACTERDATA, and returns the DOMCHARACTERDATA.

name: dbms_xmldom.makecomment
descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMCOMMENT, and returns the DOMCOMMENT.

name: dbms_xmldom.makedocument
descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMDOCUMENT, and returns the DOMDOCUMENT.

name: dbms_xmldom.makedocumentfragment
descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMDOCUMENTFRAGMENT, and returns the DOMDOCUMENTFRAGMENT.

name: dbms_xmldom.makedocumenttype
descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMDOCUMENTTYPE and returns the DOMDOCUMENTTYPE.

name: dbms_xmldom.makeelement
descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMELEMENT, and returns the DOMELEMENT.

name: dbms_xmldom.makeentity
descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMENTITY, and returns the DOMENTITY.

name: dbms_xmldom.makeentityreference
descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMENTITYREFERENCE, and returns the DOMENTITYREFERENCE.

name: dbms_xmldom.makenode
descriptionText: This function is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

name: dbms_xmldom.makenotation
descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMNOTATION, and returns the DOMNOTATION.

name: dbms_xmldom.makeprocessinginstruction
descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMPROCESSINGINSTRUCTION, and returns the Domprocessinginstruction.

name: dbms_xmldom.maketext
descriptionText: This function casts a specified DOMNODE to a DOMTEXT, and returns the DOMTEXT.

name: dbms_xmldom.newdomdocument
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.NEWDOMDOCUMENT
 RETURN DOMDOCUMENT;
descriptionText: This function returns a new DOMDOCUMENT instance.

name: dbms_xmldom.normalize
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.NORMALIZE(
   elem       IN     DOMELEMENT);
descriptionText: This procedure normalizes the text children of the DOMELEMENT.

name: dbms_xmldom.removeattribute
descriptionText: This procedure removes an attribute from the DOMELEMENT by name.

name: dbms_xmldom.removeattributenode
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.REMOVEATTRIBUTENODE(
   elem       IN     DOMELEMENT,
   oldAttr    IN     DOMATTR)
  RETURN DOMAttr;
descriptionText: This function removes the specified attribute node from the DOMELEMENT. The method returns the removed node.

name: dbms_xmldom.removechild
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.REMOVECHILD(
   n          IN     DOMNode,
   oldchild   IN     DOMNode)
 RETURN DOMNODE;
descriptionText: This function removes the child node indicated by oldchild from the list of children, and returns it.

name: dbms_xmldom.removenameditem
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.REMOVENAMEDITEM(
   nnm      IN     DOMNamedNodeMap,
   name     IN     VARCHAR2)
 RETURN DOMNode;
descriptionText: This function removes from the map a node specified by name, and returns this node. When this map contains the attributes attached to an element, if the removed attribute is known to have a default value, an attribute immediately appears containing the default value as well as the corresponding namespace URI, local name, and prefix when applicable.

name: dbms_xmldom.replacechild
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.REPLACECHILD(
   n           IN     DOMNode,
   newchild    IN     DOMNode,
   oldchild    IN     DOMNode)
 RETURN DOMNode;
descriptionText: This function replaces the child node oldchild with newchild in the list of children, and returns the oldchild node. If newchild is a DocumentFragment object, oldchild is replaced by all of the DocumentFragment children, which are inserted in the same order. If the newchild is already in the tree, it is first removed.

name: dbms_xmldom.replacedata
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.REPLACEDATA(
   cd        IN     DOMCHARACTERDATA,
   offset    IN     NUMBER,
   cnt       IN     NUMBER,
   arg       IN     VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure changes a range of characters in the node. Upon success, data and length reflect the change.

name: dbms_xmldom.resolvenamespaceprefix
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.RESOLVENAMESPACEPREFIX(
   elem       IN     DOMELEMENT,
   prefix     IN     VARCHAR2) 
 RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function resolves the specified namespace prefix, and returns the resolved namespace.

name: dbms_xmldom.setattribute
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.SETATTRIBUTE(
   elem       IN  DOMELEMENT,
   name       IN  VARCHAR2,
   newvalue   IN  VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: Sets the value of a DOMELEMEN\'s attribute by name.

name: dbms_xmldom.setattributenode
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.SETATTRIBUTENODE(
   elem      IN  DOMELEMENT,
   newAttr   IN  DOMATTR)
 RETURN DOMATTR;
descriptionText: Adds a new attribute node to the DOMELEMENT.

name: dbms_xmldom.setcharset
descriptionText: This function sets the characterset of the DOM document.

name: dbms_xmldom.setdata
descriptionText: This procedure is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

name: dbms_xmldom.setdoctype
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.SETDOCTYPE(
  doc     IN   DOMDocument, 
  name    IN   VARCHAR2,
  sysid   IN   VARCHAR2, 
  pubid   IN   VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: Given a DOM document, this procedure creates a new DTD with the specified name, system id and public id and sets it in the document. This DTD can later be retrieved using the GETDOCTYPE Function.

name: dbms_xmldom.setnameditem
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.SETNAMEDITEM(
   nnm     IN     DOMNAMEDNODEMAP,
   arg     IN     DOMNODE)
 RETURN DOMNode;
descriptionText: This function adds a node using its NodeName attribute. If a node with that name is already present in this map, it is replaced by the new one. The old node is returned on replacement; if no replacement is made, NULL is returned.

name: dbms_xmldom.setnodevalue
descriptionText: This procedure sets the value of this node, depending on its type. When it is defined to be NULL, setting it has no effect.

name: dbms_xmldom.setnodevalueasbinarystream
descriptionText: The operation of these subprograms is described with each syntax implementation.

name: dbms_xmldom.setnodevalueascharacterstream
descriptionText: The operation of these subprograms is described with each syntax implementation.

name: dbms_xmldom.setprefix
descriptionText: This procedure sets the namespace prefix for this node to the specified value.

name: dbms_xmldom.setstandalone
descriptionText: This procedure sets the standalone property of the DOMDOCUMENT.

name: dbms_xmldom.setvalue
descriptionText: This procedure sets the value of the attribute.

name: dbms_xmldom.setversion
descriptionText: This procedure sets the version of the DOMDOCUMENT.

name: dbms_xmldom.splittext
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.SPLITTEXT(
   t        IN     DOMTEXT,
   offset   IN     NUMBER)
 RETURN DOMText;
descriptionText: This function breaks this DOMTEXT node into two DOMTEXT nodes at the specified offset.

name: dbms_xmldom.substringdata
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLDOM.SUBSTRINGDATA(
   cd        IN     DOMCHARACTERDATA,
   offset    IN     NUMBER,
   cnt       IN     NUMBER)
 RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function extracts a range of data from the node.

name: dbms_xmldom.usebinarystream
descriptionText: This function returns TRUE if the datatype of the node is RAW or BLOB so that the node value may be read or written using an UTL_BINARYINPUTSTREAM or UTL_BINARYOUTPUTSTREAM. If a value of FALSE is returned, the node value may only be accessed through an UTL_CHARACTERINPUTSTREAM or UTL_CHARACTEROUTPUTSTREAM.

name: dbms_xmldom.writetobuffer
descriptionText: This procedure is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

name: dbms_xmldom.writetoclob
descriptionText: This procedure is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

name: dbms_xmldom.writetofile
descriptionText: This procedure is overloaded. The specific forms of functionality are described along with the syntax declarations.

name: dbms_xmlgen.closecontext
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLGEN.CLOSECONTEXT (
   ctx  IN ctxHandle);
descriptionText: This procedure closes a given context and releases all resources associated with it, including the SQL cursor and bind and define buffers. After this call, the handle cannot be used for a subsequent function call.

name: dbms_xmlgen.convert
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLGEN.CONVERT (
   xmlData IN VARCHAR2,
   flag    IN NUMBER := ENTITY_ENCODE)
RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function converts the XML data into the escaped or unescapes XML equivalent, and returns XML CLOB data in encoded or decoded format. There are several version of the function.

name: dbms_xmlgen.getnumrowsprocessed
descriptionText: This function retrieves the number of SQL rows processed when generating the XML using the GETXML Functions call. This count does not include the number of rows skipped before generating the XML. Note that GETXML Functions always generates an XML document, even if there are no rows present.

name: dbms_xmlgen.getxml
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLGEN.GETXML (
   ctx          IN ctxHandle, 
   tmpclob      IN OUT NCOPY CLOB,
   dtdOrSchema  IN number := NONE)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;
descriptionText: This function gets the XML document. The function is overloaded.

name: dbms_xmlgen.getxmltype
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLGEN.GETXMLTYPE (
   ctx           IN ctxhandle,
   dtdOrSchema   IN number := NONE)
 RETURN sys.XMLType;
descriptionText: This function gets the XML document and returns it as an XMLTYPE. XMLTYPE operations can be performed on the results.This function is overloaded.

name: dbms_xmlgen.newcontext
descriptionText: This function generates and returns a new context handle. This context handle is used in GETXML Functions and other functions to get XML back from the result. There are several version of the function.

name: dbms_xmlgen.newcontextfromhierarchy
descriptionText: This function obtains a handle to use in the GETXML Functions and other functions to get a hierarchical XML with recursive elements from the result.

name: dbms_xmlgen.restartquery
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLGEN.RESTARTQUERY (
ctx  IN ctxHandle);
descriptionText: This procedure restarts the query and generates the XML from the first row. It can be used to start executing the query again, without having to create a new context.

name: dbms_xmlgen.setconvertspecialchars
descriptionText: This procedure sets whether or not special characters in the XML data must be converted into their escaped XML equivalent. For example, the < sign is converted to <. The default is to perform conversions. This function improves performance of XML processing when the input data cannot contain any special characters such as <, >, "\', which must be escaped. It is expensive to scan the character data to replace the special characters, particularly if it involves a lot of data.

name: dbms_xmlgen.setmaxrows
descriptionText: This procedure sets the maximum number of rows to fetch from the SQL query result for every invocation of the GETXML Functions call. It is used when generating paginated results. For example, when generating a page of XML or HTML data, restrict the number of rows converted to XML or HTML by setting the maxrows parameter.

name: dbms_xmlgen.setnullhandling
descriptionText: This procedure sets NULL handling options, handled through the flag parameter setting.

name: dbms_xmlgen.setrowsettag
descriptionText: This procedure sets the name of the root element of the document. The default name is ROWSET.

name: dbms_xmlgen.setrowtag
descriptionText: This procedure sets the name of the element separating all the rows. The default name is ROW.

name: dbms_xmlgen.setskiprows
descriptionText: This procedure skips a given number of rows before generating the XML output for every call to the GETXML Functions. It is used when generating paginated results for stateless Web pages using this utility. For example, when generating the first page of XML or HTML data, set skiprows to zero. For the next set, set the skiprows to the number of rows obtained in the first case. See GETNUMROWSPROCESSED Function.

name: dbms_xmlgen.useitemtagsforcoll
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLGEN.USEITEMTAGSFORCOLL (
   ctx  IN ctxHandle);
descriptionText: This procedure overrides the default name of the collection elements. The default name for collection elements is the type name itself.

name: dbms_xmlgen.usenullattributeindicator
descriptionText: This procedure specifies whether to use an XML attribute to indicate NULLness, or to do it by omitting the inclusion of the particular entity in the XML document. It is used as a shortcut for the SETNULLHANDLING Procedure.

name: dbms_xmlindex.createdateindex
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLINDEX.CREATEDATEINDEX  (
   xml_index_schema   IN   VARCHAR2,
   xml_index_name     IN   VARCHAR2,
   date_index_name    IN   VARCHAR2,
   xmltypename        IN   VARCHAR2,
   date_index_clause  IN   VARCHAR2);

DBMS_XMLINDEX.CREATEDATEINDEX  (
   xml_index_schema   IN   VARCHAR2
   xml_index_name     IN   VARCHAR2,
   date_index_name    IN   VARCHAR2,
   xmltypename        IN   VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure creates a secondary index for date values in the VALUE column of a PATH TABLE which is the storage table of an XMLIndex. The second form of the procedure allows for the date_index_clause to be set to an empty string.

name: dbms_xmlindex.createnumberindex
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLINDEX.CREATENUMBERINDEX (
   xml_index_schema   IN   VARCHAR2,
   xml_index_name     IN   VARCHAR2,
   num_index_name     IN   VARCHAR2,
   num_index_clause   IN   VARCHAR2,
   xmltypename        IN   VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure creates a secondary index for number values in the VALUE column of a PATH TABLE which is the storage table of an XMLIndex.

name: dbms_xmlindex.dropparameter
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLINDEX.DROPPARAMETER (
   name        IN      VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure drops the XMLIndex parameter string that is associated with a given parameter identifier.

name: dbms_xmlindex.modifyparameter
descriptionText: This procedure modifies the XMLIndex parameter string that is associated with a given parameter identifier.

name: dbms_xmlindex.process_pending
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLINDEX.PROCESS_PENDING (
   xml_index_schema    IN     VARCHAR2,
   xml_index_name      IN     VARCHAR2,
   pending_row_count   OUT    BINARY_INTEGER,
   error_row_count     OUT    BINARY_INTEGER);
descriptionText: This procedure processes executes DMLs required to complete a NONBLOCKING ALTER INDEX ADD_GROUP/ADD_COLUMN operation on an XMLIndex.

name: dbms_xmlindex.registerparameter
descriptionText: This procedure registers a parameter identifier and XMLIndex parameter string pair in XDB.

name: dbms_xmlindex.syncindex
body:
xml_index_schema => $1
	, xml_index_name => $2
	, partition_name => NULL
	, reindex => FALSE
bodyFullText:
DBMS_XMLINDEX.SYNCINDEX (
   xml_index_schema      IN VARCHAR2,
   xml_index_name        IN VARCHAR2,
   partition_name        IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   reindex               IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
descriptionText: This function synchronizes an asynchronously maintained XMLIndex. It applies to the XMLIndex changes that are logged in the pending table, and brings the path table up-to-date with the base XMLTYPE column.

name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.freeparser
bodyFullText:
freeParser(
    p Parser);
descriptionText: Frees a parser object.

name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.getdoctype
descriptionText: Returns the parsed DTD; this function must be called only after a DTD is parsed.

name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.getdocument
descriptionText: Returns the document node of a DOM tree document built by the parser; this function must be called only after a document is parsed.

name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.getreleaseversion
bodyFullText:
getReleaseVersion
RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: Returns the release version of the Oracle XML parser for PL/SQL.

name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.getvalidationmode
descriptionText: Retrieves validation mode; TRUE for validating, FALSE otherwise.

name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.newparser
bodyFullText:
newParser 
RETURN Parser;
descriptionText: Returns a new parser instance. This function must be called before the default behavior of Parser can be changed and if other parse methods need to be used.

name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.parsebuffer
descriptionText: Parses XML stored in the given buffer. Any changes to the default parser behavior should be effected before calling this procedure. An application error is raised if parsing fails.

name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.parseclob
descriptionText: Parses XML stored in the given clob. Any changes to the default parser behavior should be effected before calling this procedure. An application error is raised if parsing fails.

name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.parsedtd
bodyFullText:
PARSEDTD(
p     Parser,
url   VARCHAR2,
root  VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: Parses the DTD stored in the given URL or file. Any changes to the default parser behavior should be effected before calling this procedure. An application error is raised if parsing fails.

name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.parsedtdbuffer
bodyFullText:
PARSEDTDBUFFER(
p    Parser,
dtd  VARCHAR2,
root VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: Parses the DTD stored in the given buffer. Any changes to the default parser behavior should be effected before calling this procedure. An application error is raised if parsing fails.

name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.parsedtdclob
bodyFullText:
PARSEDTDCLOB(
p    Parser,
dtd  CLOB,
root VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: Parses the DTD stored in the given clob. Any changes to the default parser behavior should be effected before calling this procedure. An application error is raised if parsing fails.

name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.setbasedir
descriptionText: Sets base directory used to resolve relative URLs. An application error is raised if parsing fails.

name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.setdoctype
descriptionText: Sets a DTD to be used by the parser for validation. This call should be made before the document is parsed.

name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.seterrorlog
descriptionText: Sets errors to be sent to the specified file.

name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.setpreservewhitespace
descriptionText: Sets whitespace preserving mode.

name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.setvalidationmode
descriptionText: Sets validation mode.

name: DBMS_XMLPARSER.showwarnings
descriptionText: Turns warnings on or off.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.closecontext
bodyFullText:
CLOSECONTEXT(
ctxHdl IN ctxType);
descriptionText: Closes or deallocates a particular query context

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.getexceptioncontent
bodyFullText:
GETEXCEPTIONCONTENT(
ctxHdl IN ctxType,
errNo OUT NUMBER,
errMsg OUT VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: Returns the thrown exceptio\'s SQL error code and error message through the procedur\'s OUT parameters. This procedure is a work around the JVM functionality that obscures the original exception by its own exception, rendering PL/SQL unable to access the original exception content.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.getnumrowsprocessed
descriptionText: Return the number of rows processed for the query.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.getversion
bodyFullText: GETVERSION();
descriptionText: Prints the version of the XSU in use.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.propagateoriginalexception
descriptionText: Specifies whether to throw every original exception raised or to wrap it in an OracleXMLSQLException.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.removexsltparam
descriptionText: Removes the value of a top-level stylesheet parameter. If no stylesheet is registered, this method is not operational.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setbindvalue
bodyFullText:
SETBINDVALUE(
ctxHdl IN ctxType,
bindName IN VARCHAR2,
bindValue IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: Sets a value for a particular bind name.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setcollidattrname
descriptionText: Sets the name of the id attribute of the collection elemen\'s separator tag. Passing NULL or an empty string for the tag causes the row id attribute to be omitted.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setdataheader
bodyFullText:
SETDATAHEADER(
ctxHdl IN ctxType,
header IN CLOB := null,
tag IN VARCHAR2 := null);
descriptionText: Sets the XML data header. The data header is an XML entity that is appended at the beginning of the query-generated XML entity, the rowset. The two entities are enclosed by the docTag argument. The last data header specified is used. Passing in NULL for the header parameter unsets the data header.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setdateformat
descriptionText: Sets the format of the generated dates in the XML document. The syntax of the date format pattern, the date mask, should conform to the requirements of the java.text.SimpleDateFormat class. Setting the mask to NULL or an empty string sets the default mask -- DEFAULT_DATE_FORMAT.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setencodingtag
descriptionText: Sets the encoding processing instruction in the XML document.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.seterrortag
descriptionText: Sets the tag to be used to enclose the XML error documents.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setmaxrows
descriptionText: Sets the maximum number of rows to be converted to XML. By default, there is no set maximum.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setmetaheader
descriptionText: Sets the XML meta header. When set, the header is inserted at the beginning of the metadata part (DTD or XMLSchema) of each XML document generated by this object. The last meta header specified is used. Passing in NULL for the header parameter unsets the meta header.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setnullattributeindicator
descriptionText: Specifies whether to use an XML attribute to indicate NULLness, or to do this by omitting the particular entity in the XML document.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setraiseexception
descriptionText: Specifies whether to throw raised exceptions. If this call is\'t made or if FALSE is passed to the flag argument, the XSU catches the SQL exceptions and generates an XML document from the exception message.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setraisenorowsexception
descriptionText: Specifies whether to throw an OracleXMLNoRowsException when the generated XML document is empty. By default, the exception is not thrown.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setrowidattrname
descriptionText: Sets the name of the id attribute of the row enclosing tag. Passing NULL or an empty string for the tag causes the row id attribute to be omitted.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setrowidattrvalue
descriptionText: Specifies the scalar column whose value is to be assigned to the id attribute of the row enclosing tag. Passing NULL or an empty string for the colName assigns the row count value (0, 1, 2 and so on) to the row id attribute.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setrowsettag
descriptionText: Sets the tag to be used to enclose the XML dataset.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setrowtag
descriptionText: Sets the tag to be used to enclose the XML element corresponding to a db.record.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setskiprows
descriptionText: Sets the number of rows to skip. By default, 0 rows are skipped.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setsqltoxmlnameescaping
descriptionText: This turns on or off escaping of XML tags in the case that the SQL object name, which is mapped to a XML identifier, is not a valid XML identifier.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setstylesheetheader
bodyFullText:
SETSTYLESHEETHEADER(
ctxHdl IN ctxType,
uri IN VARCHAR2,
type IN VARCHAR2 := 'text/xsl');
descriptionText: Sets the stylesheet header (the stylesheet processing instructions) in the generated XML document. Passing NULL for the uri argument will unset the stylesheet header and the stylesheet type.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.settagcase
descriptionText: Specifies the case of the generated XML tags.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.setxsltparam
bodyFullText:
SETXSLTPARAM(
ctxHdl IN ctxType,
name IN VARCHAR2,
value IN VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: Sets the value of a top-level stylesheet parameter. The parameter value is expected to be a valid XPath expression; the string literal values would therefore have to be quoted explicitly. If no stylesheet is registered, this method is not operational.

name: DBMS_XMLQUERY.usetypeforcollelemtag
descriptionText: Specifies whether to use the collection elemen\'s type name as its element tag name. By default, the tag name for elements of a collection is the collectio\'s tag name followed by _item.

name: DBMS_XMLSAVE.clearkeycolumnlist
bodyFullText:
clearKeyColumnList(
   ctxHdl IN ctxType);
descriptionText: Clears the key column list.

name: DBMS_XMLSAVE.clearupdatecolumnlist
bodyFullText:
clearUpdateColumnList(
   ctxHdl IN ctxType);
descriptionText: Clears the update column list.

name: DBMS_XMLSAVE.newcontext
descriptionText: Creates a save context, and returns the context handle.

name: DBMS_XMLSAVE.setbatchsize
descriptionText: Changes the batch size used during DML operations. When performing inserts, updates or deletes, it is better to batch the operations so that they get executed in one shot rather than as separate statements. The flip side is that more memory is needed to buffer all the bind values. Note that when batching is used, a commit occurs only after a batch is executed. So if one of the statement inside a batch fails, the whole batch is rolled back. This is a small price to pay considering the performance gain; nevertheless, if this behavior is unacceptable, then set the batch size to 1.

name: DBMS_XMLSAVE.setcommitbatch
descriptionText: Sets the commit batch size. The commit batch size refers to the number or records inserted after which a commit should follow. If batchSize is less than 1 or the session is in "auto-commit" mode, using the XSU does not make any explicit commits. By default, commitBatch is 0.

name: DBMS_XMLSAVE.setignorecase
descriptionText: The XSU does mapping of XML elements to db columns/attributes based on the element names (XML tags). This function tells the XSU to do this match case insensitive.

name: DBMS_XMLSAVE.setkeycolumn
descriptionText: This method adds a column to the "key column list". The value for the column cannot be NULL. In case of update or delete, the columns in the key column list make up the WHERE clause of the statement. The key columns list must be specified before updates can complete; this is optional for delete operations.

name: DBMS_XMLSAVE.setupdatecolumn
descriptionText: Adds a column to the update column list. In case of insert, the default is to insert values to all the columns in the table; on the other hand, in case of updates, the default is to only update the columns corresponding to the tags present in the ROW element of the XML document. When the update column list is specified, the columns making up this list alone will get updated or inserted into.

name: dbms_xstream_adm.recover_operation
descriptionText: This procedure provides options for split and merge operations that stopped because they encountered an errors. This procedure either rolls forward the operation, rolls back the operation, or purges all of the metadata about the operation. Split and merge operations might be run in an XStream Out environment in which multiple outbound servers use the same capture process.

bodyFullText: DEBUG_EXTPROC.STARTUP_EXTPROC_AGENT;

name: htf.formimage
body:
cname => $1
	, csrc => $2
	, calign => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTF.FORMIMAGE(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="image" which creates an image field that the user clicks to submit the form immediately. The coordinates of the selected point are measured in pixels, and returned (along with other contents of the form) in two name/value pairs. The x coordinate is submitted under the name of the field with .x appended, and the y coordinate with .y appended. Any VALUE attribute is ignored.

Each radio button in the same set has the same name, but different values. The selected radio button generates a name/value pair.

name: htf.img2
body:
curl => NULL
	, calign => NULL
	, calt => NULL
	, cismap => NULL
	, cusemap => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyNoDefault:
curl => $1
	, calign => $2
	, calt => $3
	, cismap => $4
	, cusemap => $5
	, cattributes => $6
bodyFullText:
HTF.IMG2(
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   calt           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cismap         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cusemap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the tag, which directs the browser to load an image onto the HTML page. The IMG Function performs the same operation but does not use the cusemap parameter.

name: htf.isindex
bodyFullText:
HTF.ISINDEX(
   cprompt        IN       VARCHAR2    DEFAULT NULL,
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2    DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function creates a single entry field with a prompting text, such as "enter value," then sends that value to the URL of the page or program.

name: htf.italic
bodyFullText:
HTF.ITALIC(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the and tags which direct the browser to render the text in italics.

name: htf.kbd
bodyFullText:
HTF.KBD(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <KBD> and </KBD> tags which direct the browser to render the text in monospace font. This subprogram performs the same operation as the KEYBOARD Function.

name: htf.keyboard
bodyFullText:
HTF.KEYBOARD(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <KBD> and </KBD> tags, which direct the browser to render the text in monospace font. This subprogram performs the same operation as the KBD Function.

name: htf.line
body:
cclear => NULL
	, csrc => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTF.LINE(
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <HR> tag, which generates a line in the HTML document. This subprogram performs the same operation as the HR Function.

name: htf.linkrel
bodyFullText:
HTF.LINKREL(
   crel           IN       VARCHAR2,
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2,
   ctitle         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <LINK> tag with the REL attribute which delineates the relationship described by the hypertext link from the anchor to the target. This is only used when the HREF attribute is present. This is the opposite of LINKREV Function. This tag indicates a relationship between documents but does not create a link. To create a link, use the ANCHOR Function.

name: htf.linkrev
bodyFullText:
HTF.LINKREV(
   crev           IN       VARCHAR2,
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2,
   ctitle         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <LINK> tag with the REV attribute which delineates the relationship described by the hypertext link from the target to the anchor. This is the opposite of the LINKREL Function. This tag indicates a relationship between documents, but does not create a link. To create a link, use the ANCHOR Function.

name: htf.listheader
bodyFullText:
HTF.LISTHEADER(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <LH> and </LH> tags which print an HTML tag at the beginning of the list.

name: htf.listingclose
bodyFullText:
HTF.LISTINGCLOSE
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the </LISTING> tags which marks the end of a section of fixed-width text in the body of an HTML page. To mark the beginning of a section of fixed-width text in the body of an HTML page, use the LISTINGOPEN Function.

name: htf.listingopen
bodyFullText:
HTF.LISTINGOPEN
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <LISTING> tag which marks the beginning of a section of fixed-width text in the body of an HTML page. To mark the end of a section of fixed-width text in the body of an HTML page, use the LISTINGCLOSE Function.

name: htf.listitem
body:
ctext => NULL
	, cclear => NULL
	, cdingbat => NULL
	, csrc => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTF.LISTITEM(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cdingbat       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <LI> tag, which indicates a list item.

name: htf.mailto
bodyFullText:
HTF.MAILTO(
   caddress       IN       VARCHAR2,
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <A> tag with the HREF set to\'mailt\' prepended to the mail address argument.

name: htf.mapclose
bodyFullText:
HTF.MAPCLOSE
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the </MAP> tag which marks the end of a set of regions in a client-side image map. To mark the beginning of a set of regions in a client-side image map, use the MAPOPEN Function.

name: htf.mapopen
bodyFullText:
HTF.MAPOPEN(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <MAP> tag which mark the beginning of a set of regions in a client-side image map. To mark the end of a set of regions in a client-side image map, use the MAPCLOSE Function.

name: htf.menulistclose
bodyFullText:
HTF.MENULISTCLOSE
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the </MENU> tag which ends a list that presents one line for each item. To begin a list of this kind, use the MENULISTOPEN Function. The items in the list appear more compact than an unordered list. The LISTITEM Function defines the list items in a menu list.

name: htf.menulistopen
bodyFullText:
HTF.MENULISTOPEN
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <MENU> tag which begins a list that presents one line for each item. To end a list of this kind, use the MENULISTCLOSE Function.The items in the list appear more compact than an unordered list. The LISTITEM Function defines the list items in a menu list.

name: htf.meta
bodyFullText:
HTF.META(
   chttp_equiv    IN       VARCHAR2,
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   ccontent       IN       VARCHAR2)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <META> tag, which embeds meta-information about the document and also specifies values for HTTP headers. For example, you can specify the expiration date, keywords, and author name.

name: htf.nl
bodyFullText:
HTF.NL(
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText:
This function generates the
tag which begins a new line of text. It performs the same operation as the BR Function.

name: htf.nobr
descriptionText: This function generates the <NOBR> and </NOBR> tags which turn off line-breaking in a section of text.

name: htf.noframesclose
bodyFullText:
HTF.NOFRAMESCLOSE
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the </NOFRAMES> tag which marks the end of a no-frames section. To mark the beginning of a no-frames section, use the FRAMESETOPEN Function. See also FRAME Function, FRAMESETOPEN Function and FRAMESETCLOSE Function.

name: htf.noframesopen
bodyFullText:
HTF.NOFRAMESOPEN
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <NOFRAMES> tag which mark the beginning of a no-frames section. To mark the end of a no-frames section, use the FRAMESETCLOSE Function. See also FRAME Function, FRAMESETOPEN Function and FRAMESETCLOSE Function.

name: htf.olistclose
bodyFullText:
HTF.OLISTCLOSE
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the tag which defines the end of an ordered list. An ordered list presents a list of numbered items. To mark the beginning of a list of this kind, use the OLISTOPEN Function. Numbered items are added using LISTITEM Function.

name: htf.olistopen
body:
cclear => NULL
	, cwrap => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTF.OLISTOPEN(
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cwrap          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <OL> tag which marks the beginning of an ordered list. An ordered list presents a list of numbered items. To mark the end of a list of this kind, use the OLISTCLOSE Function. Numbered items are added using LISTITEM Function.

name: htf.para
bodyFullText:
HTF.PARA
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText:
This function generates the

tag which indicates that the text that comes after the tag is to be formatted as a paragraph. You can add attributes to the tag by means of the PARAGRAPH Function.

name: htf.paragraph
body:
calign => NULL
	, cnowrap => NULL
	, cclear => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTF.PARAGRAPH(
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText:
You can use this function to add attributes to the

tag created by the PARA Function.

name: htf.param
bodyFullText:
HTF.PARAM(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <PARAM> tag which specifies parameter values for Java applets. The values can reference HTML variables. To invoke a Java applet from a Web page, use APPLETOPEN Function to begin the invocation. Use one PARAM Function for each desired name-value pair, and use APPLETCLOSE Function to end the applet invocation.

name: htf.plaintext
bodyFullText:
HTF.PLAINTEXT(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <PLAINTEXT> and </PLAINTEXT> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in fixed-width type.

name: htf.preclose
bodyFullText:
HTF.PRECLOSE
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the tag which marks the end of a section of preformatted text in the body of the HTML page. To mark the beginning of a section of preformatted text in the body of the HTML page, use the PREOPEN Function.

name: htf.preopen
body:
cclear => NULL
	, cwidth => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTF.PREOPEN(
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cwidth         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <PRE> tag which marks the beginning of a section of preformatted text in the body of the HTML page. To mark the end of a section of preformatted text in the body of the HTML page, use the PRECLOSE Function.

name: htf.print
descriptionText: These functions generate the specified parameter as a string terminated with the\\ newline character. The PRN Functions performs the same operation but does not terminate with a newline character.

name: htf.prn
descriptionText: These functions generate the specified parameter as a string. Unlike the PRINT Functions the string is not terminated with the\\ newline character.

name: htf.s
bodyFullText:
HTF.S (
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <S> and </S> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in strikethrough type. This performs the same operation as STRIKE Function.

name: htf.sample
bodyFullText:
HTF.SAMPLE (
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <SAMP> and </SAMP> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in monospace font or however "sample" is defined stylistically.

name: htf.script
bodyFullText:
HTF.SCRIPT (
   cscript        IN       VARCHAR2,
   clanguage      IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <SCRIPT> and </SCRIPT> tags which contain a script written in languages such as JavaScript and VBscript.

name: htf.small
bodyFullText:
HTF.SMALL (
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <SMALL> and </SMALL> tags, which direct the browser to render the text they surround using a small font.

name: HTF.strike
bodyFullText:
STRIKE (
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <STRIKE> and </STRIKE> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in strikethrough type. This performs the same operation as S Function.

name: htf.strong
bodyFullText:
HTF.STRONG(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the and tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in bold or however "strong" is defined.

name: htf.style
descriptionText: This function generates the <STYLE> and </STYLE> tags which include a style sheet in a Web page. You can get more information about style sheets at http://www.w3.org. This feature is not compatible with browsers that support only HTML versions 2.0 or earlier. Such browsers will ignore this tag.

name: htf.sub
bodyFullText:
HTF.SUB(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   calign         in       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,

descriptionText: This function generates the <SUB> and </SUB> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround as subscript.

name: htf.sup
bodyFullText:
HTF.SUP(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   calign         in       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <SUP> and </SUP> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround as superscript.

name: htf.tablecaption

name: htf.tableclose
bodyFullText:
HTF.TABLECLOSE
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the tag which marks the end of an HTML table. To define the beginning of an HTML table, use the TABLEOPEN Function.

name: htf.tableheader

cvalue => NULL
	, calign => NULL
	, cdp => NULL
	, cnowrap => NULL
	, crowspan => NULL
	, ccolspan => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyNoDefault:
cvalue => $1
	, calign => $2

	, cnowrap => $4
	, crowspan => $5
	, ccolspan => $6
	, cattributes => $7
bodyFullText:
HTF.TABLEHEADER(
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
