body:
cborder => NULL
	, calign => NULL
	, cnowrap => NULL
	, cclear => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTF.TABLEOPEN(
   cborder        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <TABLE> tag which marks the beginning of an HTML table. To define the end of an HTML table, use the TABLECLOSE Function.

name: htf.tablerowclose
bodyFullText:
HTF.TABLEROWCLOSE
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the </TR> tag which marks the end of a new row in an HTML table. To mark the beginning of a new row, use the TABLEROWOPEN Function.

name: htf.tablerowopen
body:
calign => NULL
	, cvalign => NULL
	, cdp => NULL
	, cnowrap => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTF.TABLEROWOPEN(
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cvalign        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cdp            IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <TR> tag which marks the beginning of a new row in an HTML table. To mark the end of a new row, use the TABLEROWCLOSE Function.

name: htf.teletype
bodyFullText:
HTF.TELETYPE(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <TT> and </TT> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in a fixed width typewriter font, for example, the courier font.

name: htf.title
descriptionText: This function generates the <TITLE> and </TITLE> tags which specify the text to display in the titlebar of the browser window.

name: htf.ulistclose
bodyFullText:
HTF.ULISTCLOSE
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the tag which marks the end of an unordered list. An unordered list presents items with bullets. To mark the beginning of an unordered list, use the ULISTOPEN Function. Add list items with LISTITEM Function.

name: htf.ulistopen
body:
cclear => NULL
	, cwrap => NULL
	, cdingbat => NULL
	, csrc => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTF.ULISTOPEN(
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cwrap          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cdingbat       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <UL> tag which marks the beginning of an unordered list. An unordered list presents items with bullets. To mark the end of an unordered list, use the ULISTCLOSE Function. Add list items with LISTITEM Function.

name: htf.underline
bodyFullText:
HTF.UNDERLINE(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <U> and </U> tags, which direct the browser to render the text they surround with an underline.

name: htf.variable
bodyFullText:
HTF.VARIABLE(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <VAR> and </VAR> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in italics or however "variable" is defined stylistically.

name: htf.wbr
bodyFullText:
HTF.WBR
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function generates the <WBR> tag, which inserts a soft line break within a section of NOBR text.

name: htp.address
body:
cvalue => NULL
	, cclear => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.ADDRESS (
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <ADDRESS> and </ADDRESS> tags which specify the address, author and signature of a document.

name: htp.anchor
body:
curl => $1
	, ctext => $2
	, cname => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.ANCHOR (
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2,
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure and the ANCHOR2 Procedure procedures generate the and HTML tags which specify the source or destination of a hypertext link. The difference between these subprograms is that the ANCHOR2 Procedure provides a target and therefore can be used for a frame.

name: htp.anchor2
body:
curl => $1
	, ctext => $2
	, cname => NULL
	, ctarget => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.ANCHOR2 (
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2,
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   ctarget        in       varchar2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure and the ANCHOR Procedure generate the and HTML tags which specify the source or destination of a hypertext link. The difference between these subprograms is that this procedures provides a target and therefore can be used for a frame.

name: htp.appletclose
bodyFullText: HTP.APPLETCLOSE;
descriptionText: This procedure closes the applet invocation with the </APPLET> tag. You must first invoke the a Java applet using APPLETOPEN Procedure.

name: htp.appletopen
bodyFullText:
HTP.APPLETOPEN (
   ccode          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cheight        IN       NUMBER,
   cwidth         IN       NUMBER,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <APPLET> tag which begins the invocation of a Java applet. You close the applet invocation with APPLETCLOSE Procedure which generates the </APPLET> tag.

name: htp.area
body:
ccoords => NULL
	, chref => NULL
	, cnohref => NULL
	, ctarget => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.AREA (
   ccoords        IN       VARCHAR2
   cshape         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   chref          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnohref        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   ctarget        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <AREA> tag, which defines a client-side image map. The <AREA> tag defines areas within the image and destinations for the areas.

name: htp.base
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <BASE> tag which records the URL of the document.

name: htp.basefont
bodyFullText:
HTP.BASEFONT (
   nsize    IN    INTEGER);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <BASEFONT> tag which specifies the base font size for a Web page.

name: htp.bgsound
bodyFullText:
HTP.BGSOUND (
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2,
   cloop          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <BGSOUND> tag which includes audio for a Web page.

name: htp.big
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <BIG> and </BIG> tags which direct the browser to render the text in a bigger font.

name: htp.blockquoteclose
bodyFullText: HTP.BLOCKQUOTECLOSE;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the tag which mark the end of a section of quoted text. You mark the beginning of a section of text by means of the BLOCKQUOTEOPEN Procedure.

name: htp.blockquoteopen
body:
cnowrap => NULL
	, cclear => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.BLOCKQUOTEOPEN (
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <BLOCKQUOTE> tag, which marks the beginning of a section of quoted text. You mark the end of a section of text by means of the BLOCKQUOTECLOSE Procedure.

name: htp.bodyclose
bodyFullText: HTP.BODYCLOSE;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the </BODY> tag which marks the end of a body section of an HTML document.You mark the beginning of a body section by means of the BODYOPEN Procedure.

name: htp.bodyopen
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <BODY> tag which marks the beginning of the body section of an HTML document. You mark the end of a body section by means of the BODYCLOSE Procedure.

name: htp.bold
descriptionText: This procedure generates the and tags which direct the browser to display the text in boldface.

name: htp.br
descriptionText:
This procedure generates the
tag which begins a new line of text. It performs the same operation as the NL Procedure.

name: htp.center
bodyFullText:
HTP.CENTER (
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <CENTER> and </CENTER> tags which center a section of text within a Web page.

name: htp.centerclose
bodyFullText: HTP.CENTERCLOSE;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the </CENTER> tag which marks the end of a section of text to center. You mark the beginning of a of a section of text to center by means of the CENTEROPEN Procedure.

name: htp.centeropen
bodyFullText: HTP.CENTEROPEN;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <CENTER> tag which mark the beginning of a section of text to center.You mark the beginning of a of a section of text to center by means of the CENTERCLOSE Procedure.

name: htp.cite
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <CITE> and </CITE> tags which direct the browser to render the text as a citation.

name: htp.code
descriptionText: This procedure generates the and tags which direct the browser to render the text in monospace font or however "code" is defined stylistically.

name: htp.comment
bodyFullText:
HTP.COMMENT (
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the comment tags.

name: htp.dfn
bodyFullText:
HTP.DFN (
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <DFN> and </DFN> tags which direct the browser to mark the text in italics or however "definition" is described stylistically.

name: htp.dirlistclose
bodyFullText: HTP.DIRLISTCLOSE;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the </DIR> tag which ends a directory list section. You start a directory list section with the DIRLISTOPEN Procedure.

name: htp.dirlistopen
bodyFullText: HTP.DIRLISTOPEN;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <DIR> which starts a directory list section. You end a directory list section with the DIRLISTCLOSE Procedure.

name: htp.div
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <DIV> tag which creates document divisions.

name: htp.dlistclose
bodyFullText: HTP.DLISTCLOSE;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the </DL> tag which ends a definition list. You start a definition list by means of the DLISTOPEN Procedure.

name: htp.dlistdef
body:
ctext => NULL
	, cclear => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.DLISTDEF (
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <DD> tag, which inserts definitions of terms. Use this tag for a definition list <DL>. Terms are tagged <DT> and definitions are tagged <DD>.

name: htp.dlistopen
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <DL> tag which starts a definition list. You end a definition list by means of the DLISTCLOSE Procedure.

name: htp.dlistterm
body:
ctext => NULL
	, cclear => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.DLISTTERM (
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <DT> tag which defines a term in a definition list <DL>.

name: htp.em
descriptionText: This procedure generates the and tags, which define text to be emphasized. It performs the same task as the EMPHASIS Procedure.

name: htp.emphasis
descriptionText: This procedure generates the and tags, which define text to be emphasized. It performs the same task as the EM Procedure.

name: htp.escape_sc
bodyFullText:
HTP.ESCAPE_SC(
     ctext          IN       VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure replaces characters that have special meaning in HTML with their escape sequences. The following characters are converted:

name: htp.fontclose
bodyFullText: HTP.FONTCLOSE;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the</FONT> tag which marks the end of a section of text with the specified font characteristics. You mark the beginning of the section text by means of the FONTOPEN Procedure.

name: htp.fontopen
body:
ccolor => NULL
	, cface => NULL
	, csize => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.FONTOPEN(
   ccolor         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cface          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   csize          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <FONT> which marks the beginning of section of text with the specified font characteristics. You mark the end of the section text by means of the FONTCLOSE Procedure.

name: htp.formcheckbox
body:
cname => $1
	, cvalue => 'ON'
	, cchecked => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMCHECKBOX(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT 'ON',
   cchecked       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="checkbox" which inserts a checkbox element in a form. A checkbox element is a button that the user toggles on or off.

name: htp.formclose
bodyFullText: HTP.FORMCLOSE;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the </FORM> tag which marks the end of a form section in an HTML document.You mark the beginning of the form section by means of the FORMOPEN Procedure.

name: htp.formfile
bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMFILE(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   caccept        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="file" which inserts a file form element. This is used for file uploading for a given page.

name: htp.formhidden
bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMHIDDEN(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="hidden", which inserts a hidden form element. This element is not seen by the user. It submits additional values to the script.

name: htp.formimage
body:
cname => $1
	, csrc => $2
	, calign => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMIMAGE(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="image" which creates an image field that the user clicks to submit the form immediately. The coordinates of the selected point are measured in pixels, and returned (along with other contents of the form) in two name/value pairs. The x coordinate is submitted under the name of the field with .x appended, and the y coordinate with .y appended. Any VALUE attribute is ignored.

name: htp.formopen
body:
curl => $1
	, cmethod => 'POST'
	, ctarget => NULL
	, cenctype => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMOPEN(
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2,
   cmethod        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT 'POST',
   ctarget        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cenctype       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <FORM> tag which marks the beginning of a form section in an HTML document. You mark the end of the form section by means of the FORMCLOSE Procedure.

name: htp.formpassword
body:
cname => $1
	, csize => $2
	, cmaxlength => NULL
	, cvalue => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMPASSWORD(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   csize          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cmaxlength     IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="password" which creates a single-line text entry field. When the user enters text in the field, each character is represented by one asterisk. This is used for entering passwords.

name: htp.formradio
body:
cname => $1
	, cvalue => $2
	, cchecked => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMRADIO(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2,
   cchecked       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="radio", which creates a radio button on the HTML form. Within a set of radio buttons, the user selects only one. Each radio button in the same set has the same name, but different values. The selected radio button generates a name/value pair.

name: htp.formreset
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="reset" which creates a button that, when selected, resets the form fields to their initial values.

name: htp.formselectclose
bodyFullText: HTP.FORMSELECTCLOSE;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the </SELECT> tag which marks the end of a Select form element. A Select form element is a listbox where the user selects one or more values. You mark the beginning of Select form element by means of the FORMSELECTOPEN Procedure.The values are inserted using FORMSELECTOPTION Procedure.

name: HTP.formselectopen
body:
cname => $1
	, cprompt => NULL
	, nsize => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
FORMSELECTOPEN(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cprompt        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   nsize          IN       INTEGER    DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <SELECT> tags which creates a Select form element. A Select form element is a listbox where the user selects one or more values. You mark the end of Select form element by means of the FORMSELECTCLOSE Procedure.The values are inserted using FORMSELECTOPTION Procedure.

name: htp.formselectoption
bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMSELECTOPTION(
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2,
   cselected      IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <OPTION> tag which represents one choice in a Select element.

name: htp.formsubmit
bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMSUBMIT(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cvalue        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT 'Submit',
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="submit" which creates a button that, when clicked, submits the form. If the button has a NAME attribute, the button contributes a name/value pair to the submitted data.

name: htp.formtext
body:
cname => $1
	, csize => NULL
	, cmaxlength => NULL
	, cvalue => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMTEXT(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   csize          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cmaxlength     IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="text", which creates a field for a single line of text.

name: htp.formtextarea
body:
cname => $1
	, nrows => $2
	, ncolumns => $3
	, calign => $4
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMTEXTAREA(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   nrows          IN       INTEGER,
   ncolumns       IN       INTEGER,
   calign      , IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <TEXTAREA> tag, which creates a text field that has no predefined text in the text area. This field enables entering several lines of text. The same operation is performed by the FORMTEXTAREA2 Procedure which in addition has the cwrap parameter that lets you specify a wrap style.

name: htp.formtextarea2
body:
cname => $1
	, nrows => $2
	, ncolumns => $3
	, calign => NULL
	, cwrap => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyNoDefault:
cname => $1
	, nrows => $2
	, ncolumns => $3
	, calign => $4
	, cwrap => $5
	, cattributes => $6
bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMTEXTAREA2(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   nrows          IN       INTEGER,
   ncolumns       IN       INTEGER,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cwrap          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <TEXTAREA> tag, which creates a text field that has no predefined text in the text area. This field enables entering several lines of text.The same operation is performed by the FORMTEXTAREA Procedure except that in that case you cannot specify a wrap style.

name: htp.formtextareaclose
bodyFullText: HTP.FORMTEXTAREACLOSE;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the </TEXTAREA> tag which ends a text area form element. You open a text area element by means of eitherFORMTEXTAREAOPEN Procedure or FORMTEXTAREAOPEN2 Procedure.

name: htp.formtextareaopen
body:
cname => $1
	, nrows => $2
	, ncolumns => $3
	, calign => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMTEXTAREAOPEN(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   nrows          IN       INTEGER,
   ncolumns       IN       INTEGER,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <TEXTAREA> which marks the beginning of a text area form element. The same operation is performed by the FORMTEXTAREAOPEN2 Procedure which in addition has the cwrap parameter that lets you specify a wrap style. You mark the end of a text area form element by means of the FORMTEXTAREACLOSE Procedure.

name: htp.formtextareaopen2
body:
cname => $1
	, nrows => $2
	, ncolumns => $3
	, calign => NULL
	, cwrap => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyNoDefault:
cname => $1
	, nrows => $2
	, ncolumns => $3
	, calign => $4
	, cwrap => $5
	, cattributes => $6
bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMTEXTAREAOPEN2(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   nrows          IN       INTEGER,
   ncolumns       IN       INTEGER,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cwrap          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <TEXTAREA> which marks the beginning of a text area form element. The same operation is performed by the FORMTEXTAREAOPEN Procedure except that in that case you cannot specify a wrap style. You mark the end of a text area form element by means of the FORMTEXTAREACLOSE Procedure.

name: htp.frame
body:
csrc => $1
	, cname => NULL
	, cmarginwidth => NULL
	, cmarginheight => NULL
	, cscrolling => NULL
	, cnoresize => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyNoDefault:
csrc => $1
	, cname => $2
	, cmarginwidth => $3
	, cmarginheight => $4
	, cscrolling => $5
	, cnoresize => $6
	, cattributes => $7
bodyFullText:
HTP.FRAME(
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2,
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cmarginwidth   IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cmarginheight  IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cscrolling     IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnoresize      IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <FRAME> tag which begins the characteristics of a frame created by a <FRAMESET> tag.

name: htp.framesetclose
bodyFullText: HTP.FRAMESETCLOSE;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the </FRAMESET> tag which ends a frameset section. You mark the beginning of a frameset section by means of the FRAMESETOPEN Procedure.

name: htp.framesetopen
body:
crows => NULL
	, ccols => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.FRAMESETOPEN(
   crows          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   ccols          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <FRAMESET> tag which define a frameset section. You mark the end of a frameset section by means of the FRAMESETCLOSE Procedure.

name: htp.headclose
bodyFullText: HTP.HEADCLOSE;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the </HEAD> tag which marks the end of an HTML document head section. You mark the beginning of an HTML document head section by means of the HEADOPEN Procedure.

name: htp.header
body:
nsize => $1
	, cheader => $2
	, calign => NULL
	, cnowrap => NULL
	, cclear => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyNoDefault:
nsize => $1
	, cheader => $2
	, calign => $3
	, cnowrap => $4
	, cclear => $5
	, cattributes => $6
bodyFullText:
HTP.HEADER(
   nsize          IN       INTEGER,
   cheader        IN       VARCHAR2,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText:
This procedure generates opening heading tags (

to

) and their corresponding closing tags (
to ).

name: htp.headopen
bodyFullText: HTP.HEADOPEN;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <HEAD> tag which marks the beginning of the HTML document head section. You mark the end of an HTML document head section by means of the HEADCLOSE Procedure.

name: htp.hr
body:
cclear => NULL
	, csrc => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.HR(
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <HR> tag, which generates a line in the HTML document.This subprogram performs the same operation as the LINE Procedure.

name: htp.htmlclose
bodyFullText: HTP.HTMLCLOSE;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the </HTML> tag which marks the end of an HTML document. You use the HTMLOPEN Procedure to mark the beginning of an HTML document.

name: htp.htmlopen
bodyFullText: HTP.HTMLOPEN;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <HTML> tag which marks the beginning of an HTML document. You use the HTMLCLOSE Procedure to mark the end of the an HTML document.

name: htp.img
body:
curl => NULL
	, calign => NULL
	, calt => NULL
	, cismap => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.IMG(
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   calt           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cismap         IN       VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the tag which directs the browser to load an image onto the HTML page. The IMG2 Procedure performs the same operation but additionally uses the cusemap parameter.

name: htp.img2
body:
curl => NULL
	, calign => NULL
	, calt => NULL
	, cismap => NULL
	, cusemap => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyNoDefault:
curl => $1
	, calign => $2
	, calt => $3
	, cismap => $4
	, cusemap => $5
	, cattributes => $6
bodyFullText:
HTP.IMG2(
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   calt           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cismap         IN       VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   cusemap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the tag, which directs the browser to load an image onto the HTML page. The IMG Procedure performs the same operation but does not use the cusemap parameter.

name: htp.isindex
descriptionText: This procedure creates a single entry field with a prompting text, such as "enter value," then sends that value to the URL of the page or program.

name: htp.italic
descriptionText: This procedure generates the and tags which direct the browser to render the text in italics.

name: htp.kbd
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <KBD> and </KBD> tags which direct the browser to render the text in monospace font. This subprogram performs the same operation as the KEYBOARD Procedure.

name: htp.keyboard
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <KBD> and </KBD> tags, which direct the browser to render the text in monospace font. This subprogram performs the same operation as the KBD Procedure.

name: htp.line
body:
cclear => NULL
	, csrc => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.LINE(
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <HR> tag, which generates a line in the HTML document. This subprogram performs the same operation as the HR Procedure.

name: htp.linkrel
bodyFullText:
HTP.LINKREL(
   crel           IN       VARCHAR2,
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2,
   ctitle         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <LINK> tag with the REL attribute which delineates the relationship described by the hypertext link from the anchor to the target. This is only used when the HREF attribute is present. This is the opposite of LINKREV Procedure. This tag indicates a relationship between documents but does not create a link. To create a link, use the ANCHOR Procedure.

name: htp.linkrev
bodyFullText:
HTP.LINKREV(
   crev           IN       VARCHAR2,
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2,
   ctitle         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <LINK> tag with the REV attribute which delineates the relationship described by the hypertext link from the target to the anchor. This is the opposite of the LINKREL Procedure. This tag indicates a relationship between documents, but does not create a link. To create a link, use the ANCHOR Procedure.

name: htp.listheader
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <LH> and </LH> tags which print an HTML tag at the beginning of the list.

name: htp.listingclose
bodyFullText: HTP.LISTINGCLOSE;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the </LISTING> tags which marks the end of a section of fixed-width text in the body of an HTML page. To mark the beginning of a section of fixed-width text in the body of an HTML page, use the LISTINGOPEN Procedure.

name: htp.listingopen
bodyFullText: HTP.LISTINGOPEN;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <LISTING> tag which marks the beginning of a section of fixed-width text in the body of an HTML page. To mark the end of a section of fixed-width text in the body of an HTML page, use the LISTINGCLOSE Procedure.

name: htp.listitem
body:
ctext => NULL
	, cclear => NULL
	, cdingbat => NULL
	, csrc => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.LISTITEM(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cdingbat       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <LI> tag, which indicates a list item.

name: htp.mailto
bodyFullText:
HTP.MAILTO(
   caddress       IN       VARCHAR2,
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <A> tag with the HREF set to\'mailt\' prepended to the mail address argument.

name: htp.mapclose
bodyFullText: HTP.MAPCLOSE;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the </MAP> tag which marks the end of a set of regions in a client-side image map. To mark the beginning of a set of regions in a client-side image map, use the MAPOPEN Procedure.

name: htp.mapopen
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <MAP> tag which mark the beginning of a set of regions in a client-side image map. To mark the end of a set of regions in a client-side image map, use the MAPCLOSE Procedure.

name: htp.menulistclose
bodyFullText: HTP.MENULISTCLOSE;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the </MENU> tag which ends a list that presents one line for each item. To begin a list of this kind, use the MENULISTOPEN Procedure. The items in the list appear more compact than an unordered list. The LISTITEM Procedure defines the list items in a menu list.

name: htp.menulistopen
bodyFullText: HTP.MENULISTOPEN;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <MENU> tag which begins a list that presents one line for each item. To end a list of this kind, use the MENULISTCLOSE Procedure.The items in the list appear more compact than an unordered list. The LISTITEM Procedure defines the list items in a menu list.

name: htp.meta
bodyFullText:
HTP.META(
   chttp_equiv    IN       VARCHAR2,
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   ccontent       IN       VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <META> tag, which embeds meta-information about the document and also specifies values for HTTP headers. For example, you can specify the expiration date, keywords, and author name.

name: htp.nl
descriptionText:
This procedure generates the
tag which begins a new line of text. It performs the same operation as the BR Procedure.

name: htp.nobr
bodyFullText:
HTP.NOBR(
ctext        IN        VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <NOBR> and </NOBR> tags which turn off line-breaking in a section of text.

name: htp.noframesclose
bodyFullText: HTP.NOFRAMESCLOSE;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the </NOFRAMES> tag which marks the end of a no-frames section. To mark the beginning of a no-frames section, use the FRAMESETOPEN Procedure. See also FRAME Procedure, FRAMESETOPEN Procedure and FRAMESETCLOSE Procedure.

name: htp.noframesopen
bodyFullText: HTP.NOFRAMESOPEN;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <NOFRAMES> tag which mark the beginning of a no-frames section. To mark the end of a no-frames section, use the FRAMESETCLOSE Procedure. See also FRAME Procedure, FRAMESETOPEN Procedure and FRAMESETCLOSE Procedure.

name: htp.olistclose
bodyFullText: HTP.OLISTCLOSE;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the tag which defines the end of an ordered list. An ordered list presents a list of numbered items. To mark the beginning of a list of this kind, use the OLISTOPEN Procedure. Numbered items are added using LISTITEM Procedure.

name: htp.olistopen
body:
cclear => NULL
	, cwrap => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.OLISTOPEN(
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cwrap          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <OL> tag which marks the beginning of an ordered list. An ordered list presents a list of numbered items. To mark the end of a list of this kind, use the OLISTCLOSE Procedure. Numbered items are added using LISTITEM Procedure.

name: htp.para
bodyFullText: HTP.PARA;
descriptionText:
This procedure generates the

tag which indicates that the text that comes after the tag is to be formatted as a paragraph. You can add attributes to the tag by means of the PARAGRAPH Procedure.

name: htp.paragraph
body:
calign => NULL
	, cnowrap => NULL
	, cclear => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.PARAGRAPH(
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText:
You can use this procedure to add attributes to the

tag created by the PARA Procedure.

name: htp.param
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <PARAM> tag which specifies parameter values for Java applets. The values can reference HTML variables. To invoke a Java applet from a Web page, use APPLETOPEN Procedure to begin the invocation. Use one PARAM Procedure for each desired name-value pair, and use APPLETCLOSE Procedure to end the applet invocation.

name: htp.plaintext
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <PLAINTEXT> and </PLAINTEXT> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in fixed-width type.

name: htp.preclose
bodyFullText: HTP.PRECLOSE;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the tag which marks the end of a section of preformatted text in the body of the HTML page. To mark the beginning of a section of preformatted text in the body of the HTML page, use the PREOPEN Procedure.

name: htp.preopen
body:
cclear => NULL
	, cwidth => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.PREOPEN(
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cwidth         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <PRE> tag which marks the beginning of a section of preformatted text in the body of the HTML page. To mark the end of a section of preformatted text in the body of the HTML page, use the PRECLOSE Procedure.

name: htp.print
descriptionText: These procedures generate the specified parameter as a string terminated with the\\ newline character. The PRN Procedures performs the same operation but does not terminate with a newline character.

name: htp.prints
bodyFullText:
HTP.PRINTS (
   ctext      IN       VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure generates a string and replaces the following characters with the corresponding escape sequence.

name: htp.prn
descriptionText: These procedures generate the specified parameter as a string. Unlike the PRINT Procedures the string is not terminated with the\\ newline character.

name: htp.ps
bodyFullText:
HTP.PS (
   ctext      IN       VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure generates a string and replaces the following characters with the corresponding escape sequence.

name: htp.s
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <S> and </S> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in strikethrough type. This performs the same operation as STRIKE Procedure.

name: htp.sample
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <SAMP> and </SAMP> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in monospace font or however "sample" is defined stylistically.

name: htp.script
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <SCRIPT> and </SCRIPT> tags which contain a script written in languages such as JavaScript and VBscript.

name: htp.small
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <SMALL> and </SMALL> tags, which direct the browser to render the text they surround using a small font.

name: htp.strike
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <STRIKE> and </STRIKE> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in strikethrough type. This performs the same operation as S Procedure.

name: htp.strong
descriptionText: This procedure generates the and tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in bold or however "strong" is defined.

name: htp.style
bodyFullText:
HTP.STYLE(
   cstyle          IN       VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <STYLE> and </STYLE> tags which include a style sheet in a Web page. You can get more information about style sheets at http://www.w3.org. This feature is not compatible with browsers that support only HTML versions 2.0 or earlier. Such browsers will ignore this tag.

name: htp.sub
bodyFullText:
HTP.SUB(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   calign         in       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <SUB> and </SUB> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround as subscript.

name: htp.sup
bodyFullText:
HTP.SUP(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   calign         in       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <SUP> and </SUP> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround as superscript.

name: htp.tablecaption
bodyFullText:
HTP.TABLECAPTION(
   ccaption       IN       VARCHAR2,
   calign         in       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <CAPTION> and </CAPTION> tags which place a caption in an HTML table.

name: htp.tableclose
bodyFullText: HTP.TABLECLOSE;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the tag which marks the end of an HTML table. To define the beginning of an HTML table, use the TABLEOPEN Procedure.

name: htp.tabledata
body:
cvalue => NULL
	, calign => NULL
	, cdp => NULL
	, cnowrap => NULL
	, crowspan => NULL
	, ccolspan => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyNoDefault:
cvalue => $1
	, calign => $2
	, cdp => $3
	, cnowrap => $4
	, crowspan => $5
	, ccolspan => $6
	, cattributes => $7
bodyFullText:
HTP.TABLEDATA(
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cdp            IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   crowspan       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   ccolspan       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the and tags which insert data into a cell of an HTML table.

name: htp.tableheader
body:
cvalue => NULL
	, calign => NULL
	, cdp => NULL
	, cnowrap => NULL
	, crowspan => NULL
	, ccolspan => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyNoDefault:
cvalue => $1
	, calign => $2
	, cdp => $3
	, cnowrap => $4
	, crowspan => $5
	, ccolspan => $6
	, cattributes => $7
bodyFullText:
HTP.TABLEHEADER(
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cdp            IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   crowspan       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   ccolspan       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <TH> and </TH> tags which insert a header cell in an HTML table. The <TH> tag is similar to the <TD> tag except that the text in this case the rows are usually rendered in bold type.

name: htp.tableopen
body:
cborder => NULL
	, calign => NULL
	, cnowrap => NULL
	, cclear => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.TABLEOPEN(
   cborder        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <TABLE> tag which marks the beginning of an HTML table. To define the end of an HTML table, use the TABLECLOSE Procedure.

name: htp.tablerowclose
bodyFullText: HTP.TABLEROWCLOSE;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the </TR> tag which marks the end of a new row in an HTML table. To mark the beginning of a new row, use the TABLEROWOPEN Procedure.

name: htp.tablerowopen
body:
calign => NULL
	, cvalign => NULL
	, cdp => NULL
	, cnowrap => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.TABLEROWOPEN(
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cvalign        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cdp            IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <TR> tag which marks the beginning of a new row in an HTML table. To mark the end of a new row, use the TABLEROWCLOSE Procedure.

name: htp.teletype
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <TT> and </TT> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in a fixed width typewriter font, for example, the courier font.

name: htp.title
bodyFullText:
HTP.TITLE(
   ctitle          IN       VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <TITLE> and </TITLE> tags which specify the text to display in the titlebar of the browser window.

name: htp.ulistclose
bodyFullText: HTP.ULISTCLOSE;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the tag which marks the end of an unordered list. An unordered list presents items with bullets. To mark the beginning of an unordered list, use the ULISTOPEN Procedure. Add list items with LISTITEM Procedure.

name: htp.ulistopen
body:
cclear => NULL
	, cwrap => NULL
	, cdingbat => NULL
	, csrc => NULL
	, cattributes => NULL
bodyFullText:
HTP.ULISTOPEN(
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cwrap          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cdingbat       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <UL> tag which marks the beginning of an unordered list. An unordered list presents items with bullets. To mark the end of an unordered list, use the ULISTCLOSE Procedure. Add list items with LISTITEM Procedure.

name: htp.underline
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <U> and </U> tags, which direct the browser to render the text they surround with an underline.

name: htp.variable
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <VAR> and </VAR> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in italics or however "variable" is defined stylistically.

name: htp.wbr
bodyFullText: HTP.WBR;
descriptionText: This procedure generates the <WBR> tag, which inserts a soft line break within a section of NOBR text.

name: owa_cache.disable
bodyFullText: OWA_CACHE.DISABLE;
descriptionText: This procedure disables the cache for this particular request.

name: owa_cache.get_etag
bodyFullText:
OWA_CACHE.GET_ETAG
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function returns the tag associated with the cached content. It is used in the Validation technique only.

name: owa_cache.get_level
bodyFullText:
OWA_CACHE.GET_LEVEL
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This returns the caching level. It is used in the Validation technique model only.

name: owa_cache.set_cache
descriptionText: This sets up the cache headers for validation model cache type.

name: owa_cache.set_expires
descriptionText: This procedure sets up the cache headers for expires model cache type.

name: owa_cache.set_not_modified
bodyFullText: OWA_CACHE.SET_NOT_MODIFIED;
descriptionText: This procedure sets up the headers for a not-modified cache hit. It is used in the Validation technique only.

name: owa_cache.set_surrogate_control
bodyFullText:
OWA_CACHE.SET_SURROGATE_CONTROL(
   p_value        IN       VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure sets the headers for a surrogate-control header for Web cache

name: owa_cookie.get
descriptionText: This function returns the values associated with the specified cookie. The values are returned in a OWA_COOKIE.COOKIE DATA TYPE.

name: owa_cookie.get_all
bodyFullText:
OWA_COOKIE.GET_ALL(
   names          OUT      vc_arr,
   vals           OUT      vc_arr,
   num_vals       OUT      INTEGER);
descriptionText: This procedure returns all cookie names and their values from the clien\'s browser. The values appear in the order in which they were sent from the browser.

name: owa_cookie.remove
bodyFullText:
OWA_COOKIE.REMOVE(
   name           IN       VARCHAR2,
   val            IN       VARCHAR2,
   path           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure forces a cookie to expire immediately by setting the "expires" field of a Set-Cookie line in the HTTP header to "01-Jan-1990". This procedure must be called within the context of an HTTP header.

name: owa_cookie.send
body:
name => $1
	, value => $2
	, expires => NULL
	, path => NULL
	, domain => NULL
	, secure => NULL
bodyNoDefault:
name => $1
	, value => $2
	, expires => $3
	, path => $4
	, domain => $5
	, secure => $6
bodyFullText:
OWA_COOKIE.SEND(
   name           in       varchar2,
   value          in       varchar2,
   expires        in       date       DEFAULT NULL,
   path           in       varchar2   DEFAULT NULL,
   domain         in       varchar2   DEFAULT NULL,
   secure         in       varchar2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure generates a Set-Cookie line, which transmits a cookie to the client. This procedure must occur in the context of an HTTP header.

name: owa_custom.authorize
bodyFullText:
OWA_CUSTOM.AUTHORIZE 
  RETURN BOOLEAN;
descriptionText: This function is used when PLSQL Agen\'s authorization scheme is set to GLOBAL or CUSTOM when there is no overriding OWA_CUSTOM package.

name: owa_image.get_x
descriptionText: This function returns the X coordinate of the point where the user clicked on an image map.

name: owa_image.get_y
descriptionText: This function returns the Y coordinate of the point where the user clicked on an image map.

name: owa_opt_lock.checksum
bodyFullText:
OWA_OPT_LOCK.CHECKSUM(
   p_buff        IN       VARCHAR2) 
 RETURN NUMBER;

OWA_OPT_LOCK.CHECKSUM(
   p_owner       IN      VARCHAR2,
   p_tname       IN       VARCHAR2,
   p_rowid       IN       ROWID) 
  RETURN NUMBER;
descriptionText: This function returns a checksum value for a specified string, or for a row in a table. For a row in a table, the function calculates the checksum value based on the values of the columns in the row. This function comes in two versions.

name: owa_opt_lock.get_rowid
descriptionText: This function returns the ROWID datatype from the specified OWA_OPT_LOCK.VCARRAY DATA TYPE.

name: owa_opt_lock.store_values
bodyFullText:
OWA_OPT_LOCK.STORE_VALUES(
   p_owner        IN       VARCHAR2,
   p_tname        IN       VARCHAR2,
   p_rowid        IN       ROWID);
descriptionText: This procedure stores the column values of the row that you want to update later. The values are stored in hidden HTML form elements.

name: owa_opt_lock.verify_values
descriptionText: This function verifies whether values in the specified row have been updated since the last query. Use this function with the STORE_VALUES Procedure.

name: owa_pattern.amatch
bodyFullText:
OWA_PATTERN.AMATCH(
   line           IN       VARCHAR2,
   from_loc       IN       INTEGER,
   pat            IN       VARCHAR2,
   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN INTEGER;

OWA_PATTERN.AMATCH(
   line           IN       VARCHAR2,
   from_loc       IN       INTEGER,
   pat            IN OUT   PATTERN,
   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN INTEGER;

OWA_PATTERN.AMATCH(
   line           IN       VARCHAR2
   from_loc       IN       INTEGER
   pat            in       varchar2
   backrefs       OUT      owa_text.vc_arr
   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)

OWA_PATTERN.AMATCH(
   line           IN       VARCHAR2
   from_loc       IN       INTEGER
   pat            IN OUT   PATTERN
   backrefs       OUT      owa_text.vc_arr

 RETURN INTEGER;
descriptionText: This function specifies if a pattern occurs in a particular location in a string. There are four versions to this function:

name: owa_pattern.change
bodyFullText:
OWA_PATTERN.CHANGE(
   line           IN OUT    VARCHAR2,
   from_str       IN        VARCHAR2,
   to_str         IN        VARCHAR2,
   flags          IN        VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN INTEGER;

OWA_PATTERN.CHANGE(
   line           IN OUT   VARCHAR2,
   from_str       IN       VARCHAR2,
   to_str         IN       VARCHAR2,
   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);

owa_pattern.change(

   from_str       IN       VARCHAR2,
   to_str         IN       VARCHAR2,
   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN INTEGER;

OWA_PATTERN.CHANGE(
   mline          IN OUT   owa_text.multi_line,
   from_str       IN       VARCHAR2,
   to_str         IN       VARCHAR2,
   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This function or procedure searches and replaces a string or multi_line datatype. If multiple overlapping strings match the regular expression, this subprogram takes the longest match.

name: owa_pattern.getpat
descriptionText: This procedure converts a VARCHAR2 string into an OWA_PATTERN.PATTERN DATA TYPE.

name: owa_pattern.match
bodyFullText:
owa_pattern.match(
   line           IN       VARCHAR2,
   pat            IN       VARCHAR2,
   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;

owa_pattern.match(
   line           IN       VARCHAR2,
   pat            IN OUT   PATTERN,
   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;

owa_pattern.match(
   line           IN       VARCHAR2,
   pat            IN       VARCHAR2,
   backrefs       OUT      owa_text.vc_arr,
   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;

OWA_PATTERN.MATCH(
   line           IN       VARCHAR2,
   pat            IN OUT   PATTERN,
   backrefs       OUT      owa_text.vc_arr,
   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;

owa_pattern.match(
   mline          IN       owa_text.multi_line,

   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;

OWA_PATTERN.MATCH(
   mline          IN       owa_text.multi_line,
   pat            IN OUT   pattern,
   rlist          OUT      owa_text.row_list,
   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;
descriptionText: This function determines if a string contains the specified pattern. The pattern can contain regular expressions. If multiple overlapping strings can match the regular expression, this function takes the longest match.

name: owa_sec.get_client_hostname
bodyFullText:
OWA_SEC.GET_CLIENT_HOSTNAME
 RETURN VARCHAR2;

name: owa_sec.get_client_ip

OWA_SEC.GET_CLIENT_IP 
  RETURN OWA_UTIL.IP_ADDRESS;
descriptionText: This function returns the IP address of the client.

name: owa_sec.get_password
bodyFullText:
OWA_SEC.GET_PASSWORD 
  RETURN VARCHAR2;

name: owa_sec.get_user_id
bodyFullText:
OWA_SEC.GET_USER_ID 
  RETURN VARCHAR2;

name: owa_sec.set_authorization
bodyFullText:
OWA_SEC.SET_AUTHORIZATION(
    scheme         IN       INTEGER);
descriptionText: This procedure, called in the initialization portion of the OWA_CUSTOM package, sets the authorization scheme for the PL/SQL Gateway. This implements your authorize function, which authorizes the user before his requested procedure is run. The placement of the authorize function depends on the scheme you select.

name: owa_sec.set_protection_realm

OWA_SEC.SET_PROTECTION_REALM(

name: owa_text.new_row_list

name: owa_text.print_multi
bodyFullText:
OWA_TEXT.PRINT_MULTI(
   mline       IN       multi_line);

name: owa_text.print_row_list
bodyFullText:
OWA_TEXT.PRINT_ROW_LIST(
   rlist       IN       multi_line);

name: owa_text.stream2multi
descriptionText: This procedure converts a string to a multi_line datatype.

name: owa_util.bind_variables
body:
theQuery => NULL
	, bv1Name => NULL
	, bv1Value => NULL
	, bv2Name => NULL
	, bv2Value => NULL
	, bv3Name => NULL
	, bv3Value => NULL
	...
	, bv25Name => NULL
	, bv25Value => NULL
bodyNoDefault:
theQuery => $1
	, bv1Name => $2
	, bv1Value => $3
	, bv2Name => $4
	, bv2Value => $5
	, bv3Name => $6
	, bv3Value => $7
	...
	, bv25Name => $8
	, bv25Value => $9
bodyFullText:
OWA_UTIL.BIND_VARIABLES(
   theQuery       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   bv1Name        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   bv1Value       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   bv2Name        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   bv2Value       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   bv3Name        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,

        ...

name: owa_util.calendarprint
descriptionText: These procedures creates a calendar in HTML with a visible border. Each date in the calendar can contain any number of hypertext links.

name: owa_util.cellsprint
bodyFullText:
OWA_UTIL.CELLSPRINT(
   p_colCnt          IN    INTEGER,
   p_resultTbl       IN    vc_arr,
descriptionText: This procedure generates an HTML table from the output of a SQL query. SQL atomic data items are mapped to HTML cells and SQL rows to HTML rows. You must write the code to begin and end the HTML table. There are nine versions of this procedure:

name: owa_util.choose_date
descriptionText: This procedure generates three HTML form elements that allow the user to select the day, the month, and the year.

name: owa_util.get_cgi_env
descriptionText: This function returns the value of the specified CGI environment variable.

name: owa_util.get_owa_service_path
bodyFullText:
OWA_UTIL.GET_OWA_SERVICE_PATH
 RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function returns the full virtual path of the PL/SQL Gateway that is handling the request.

name: owa_util.get_procedure
bodyFullText:
OWA_UTIL.GET_PROCEDURE
 RETURN VARCHAR2;
descriptionText: This function returns the name of the procedure that is being invoked by the PL/SQL Gateway.

name: owa_util.http_header_close
bodyFullText: OWA_UTIL.HTTP_HEADER_CLOSE;
descriptionText: This procedure generates a newline character to close the HTTP header.

name: owa_util.listprint
bodyFullText:
OWA_UTIL.LISTPRINT(
   p_theQuery     IN       VARCHAR2,
   p_cname        IN       VARCHAR2,
   p_nsize        IN       NUMBER,
   p_multiple     IN       BOOLEAN   DEFAULT FALSE);

OWA_UTIL.LISTPRINT(
   p_theCursor    IN    INTEGER,
   p_cname        IN       VARCHAR2,
   p_nsize        IN       NUMBER,
   p_multiple     IN       BOOLEAN   DEFAULT FALSE);

name: owa_util.mime_header
bodyFullText:
OWA_UTIL.MIME_HEADER(
   ccontent_type    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT 'text/html',
   bclose_header    IN       BOOLEAN    DEFAULT TRUE,
   ccharset         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure changes the default MIME header that the script returns. This procedure must come before any HTP.PRINT or HTP.PRN calls to direct the script not to use the default MIME header.

name: owa_util.print_cgi_env
bodyFullText: OWA_UTIL.PRINT_CGI_ENV;
descriptionText: This procedure generates all the CGI environment variables and their values made available by the PL/SQL Gateway to the stored procedure.

name: owa_util.redirect_url
descriptionText: This procedure specifies that the application server is to visit the specified URL. The URL may specify either a Web page to return or a program to execute.

name: owa_util.showpage
bodyFullText: OWA_UTIL.SHOWPAGE;
descriptionText: This procedure prints out the HTML output of a procedure in SQL*Plus. The procedure must use the HTP or HTF packages to generate the HTML page, and this procedure must be issued after the HTP or HTF page-generating subprogram has been called and before any other HTP or HTF subprograms are directly or indirectly called.

name: owa_util.showsource
bodyFullText:
OWA_UTIL.SHOWSOURCE (
   cname      IN     VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure prints the source of the specified procedure, function, or package. If a procedure or function which belongs to a package is specified, then the entire package is displayed.

name: owa_util.signature
descriptionText: This procedure generates an HTML line followed by a signature line on the HTML document. If a parameter is specified, the procedure also generates a hypertext link to view the PL/SQL source for that procedure. The link calls the SHOWSOURCE Procedure.

name: owa_util.status_line
bodyFullText:
OWA_UTIL.STATUS_LINE(
   nstatus        IN       INTEGER,
   creason        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   bclose_header  IN       BOOLEAN    DEFAULT TRUE);
descriptionText: This procedure sends a standard HTTP status code to the client. This procedure must come before any htp.print or htp.prn calls so that the status code is returned as part of the header, rather than as "content data".

name: owa_util.who_called_me

name: purge_cache
body:
p_application_id => apex.g_flow_id
	, p_page_id => apex.g_flow_step_id
	, p_user_name => NULL
	, p_current_session_only => FALSE
bodyFullText:
PURGE_CACHE (
    p_application_id       IN NUMBER DEFAULT apex.g_flow_id,
    p_page_id              IN NUMBER DEFAULT apex.g_flow_step_id,
    p_user_name            IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_current_session_only IN BOOLEAN  DEFAULT FALSE );
descriptionText: This procedure purges the cache of the specified application, page, and region for the specified user. If the user is not specified, the procedure purges all cached versions of the page.

name: search
body:
p_username => NULL
	, p_pass => NULL
	, p_auth_base => NULL
	, p_host => $1

bodyFullText:
search (
            p_username          IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
            p_pass              IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
            p_auth_base         IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,

            p_search_base       IN VARCHAR2,

            RETURN APEX_T_LDAP_ATTRIBUTES PIPELINED;

name: utl_call_stack.backtrace_depth

UTL_CALL_STACK.BACKTRACE_DEPTH 
 RETURN PLS_INTEGER;

name: utl_call_stack.backtrace_line

name: utl_call_stack.backtrace_unit

name: utl_call_stack.concatenate_subprogram

name: utl_call_stack.current_edition

UTL_CALL_STACK.DYNAMIC_DEPTH

UTL_CALL_STACK.ERROR_DEPTH
 RETURN PLS_INTEGER;

name: utl_call_stack.error_number

name: utl_call_stack.lexical_depth

name: utl_call_stack.owner

name: utl_call_stack.subprogram

name: utl_call_stack.unit_line

name: utl_coll.is_locator

name: utl_compress.lz_uncompress

name: utl_compress.lz_uncompress_close

UTL_COMPRESS.LZ_UNCOMPRESS_CLOSE(

name: utl_encode.base64_decode

name: utl_encode.base64_encode
descriptionText: This function encodes the binary representation of the RAW value into base 64 elements and returns it in the form of a RAW string.

name: utl_encode.mimeheader_decode
descriptionText: This function accepts as input an "encoded word" of the form:

name: utl_encode.mimeheader_encode
bodyFullText:
UTL_ENCODE.MIMEHEADER_ENCODE (

 RETURN string VARCHAR2 CHARACTER SET buf%CHARSET;
descriptionText: This function returns as an output an "encoded word" of the form:

name: utl_encode.quoted_printable_decode
descriptionText: This function reads the varchar2 quoted printable format input string and decodes it to the corresponding RAW string.

name: utl_encode.quoted_printable_encode
descriptionText: This function reads the RAW input string and encodes it to the corresponding quoted printable format string.

name: utl_encode.text_decode
bodyFullText:
UTL_ENCODE.TEXT_DECODE(
   buf            IN  VARCHAR2 CHARACTER SET ANY_CS, 
   encode_charset IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
   encoding       IN  PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL) 
 RETURN string VARCHAR2 CHARACTER SET buf%CHARSET;
descriptionText: This function converts the input text to the target character set as specified by the encode_charset parameter, if not NULL. The encoded text is converted to the base character set of database, as follows:

name: utl_encode.text_encode
bodyFullText:
UTL_ENCODE.TEXT_ENCODE (
   buf            IN  VARCHAR2 CHARACTER SET ANY_CS, 
   encode_charset IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
   encoding       IN  PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL) 
 RETURN string VARCHAR2 CHARACTER SET buf%CHARSET;
descriptionText: This function converts the input text to the target character set as specified by the encode_charset parameter, if not NULL. The text is encoded to either base64 or quoted-printable format, as specified by the encoding parameter. Quoted-printable is selected as a default if ENCODING is NULL.

name: utl_encode.uudecode
descriptionText: This function reads the RAW uuencode format input string and decodes it to the corresponding RAW string. See "UUENCODE Function" for discussion of the cumulative nature of UUENCODE and UUDECODE for data streams.

name: utl_encode.uuencode
body:
r => $1
	, type => 1
	, filename => NULL
	, permission => NULL
bodyFullText:
UTL_ENCODE.UUENCODE (
   r          IN RAW,
   type       IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT 1,
   filename   IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   permission IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL) RETURN RAW;
descriptionText: This function reads the RAW input string and encodes it to the corresponding uuencode format string. The output of this function is cumulative, in that it can be used to encode large data streams, by splitting the data stream into acceptably sized RAW values, encoded, and concatenated into a single encoded string.

name: utl_file.fclose
bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.FCLOSE (
   file IN OUT FILE_TYPE);
descriptionText: This procedure closes an open file identified by a file handle.

name: utl_file.fclose_all
bodyFullText: UTL_FILE.FCLOSE_ALL;
descriptionText: This procedure closes all open file handles for the session. This should be used as an emergency cleanup procedure, for example, when a PL/SQL program exits on an exception.

name: utl_file.fcopy
body:
src_location => $1
	, src_filename => $2
	, dest_location => $3
	, dest_filename => $4
	, start_line => 1
	, end_line => NULL
bodyNoDefault:
src_location => $1
	, src_filename => $2
	, dest_location => $3
	, dest_filename => $4
	, start_line => $5
	, end_line => $6
bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.FCOPY (
   src_location    IN VARCHAR2,
   src_filename    IN VARCHAR2,
   dest_location   IN VARCHAR2,
   dest_filename   IN VARCHAR2,
   start_line      IN BINARY_INTEGER DEFAULT 1,
   end_line        IN BINARY_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure copies a contiguous portion of a file to a newly created file. By default, the whole file is copied if the start_line and end_line parameters are omitted. The source file is opened in read mode. The destination file is opened in write mode. A starting and ending line number can optionally be specified to select a portion from the center of the source file for copying.

name: utl_file.fflush
bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.FFLUSH (
   file  IN FILE_TYPE);
descriptionText: FFLUSH physically writes pending data to the file identified by the file handle. Normally, data being written to a file is buffered. The FFLUSH procedure forces the buffered data to be written to the file. The data must be terminated with a newline character.

name: utl_file.fgetattr
bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.FGETATTR(
   location     IN VARCHAR2, 
   filename     IN VARCHAR2, 
   fexists      OUT BOOLEAN, 
   file_length  OUT NUMBER, 
   block_size   OUT BINARY_INTEGER);
descriptionText: This procedure reads and returns the attributes of a disk file.

name: utl_file.fgetpos
descriptionText: This function returns the current relative offset position within a file, in bytes.

name: utl_file.fopen
bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.FOPEN (
   location     IN VARCHAR2,
   filename     IN VARCHAR2,
   open_mode    IN VARCHAR2,
   max_linesize IN BINARY_INTEGER DEFAULT 1024) 
  RETURN FILE_TYPE;
descriptionText: This function opens a file. You can specify the maximum line size and have a maximum of 50 files open simultaneously. See also FOPEN_NCHAR Function.

name: utl_file.fopen_nchar
bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.FOPEN_NCHAR (
   location     IN VARCHAR2,
   filename     IN VARCHAR2,
   open_mode    IN VARCHAR2,
   max_linesize IN BINARY_INTEGER DEFAULT 1024) 
RETURN FILE_TYPE;
descriptionText: This function opens a file in national character set mode for input or output, with the maximum line size specified. You can have a maximum of 50 files open simultaneously. With this function, you can read or write a text file in Unicode instead of in the database character set.

name: utl_file.fremove
descriptionText: This procedure deletes a disk file, assuming that you have sufficient privileges.

name: utl_file.frename
body:
src_location => $1
	, src_filename => $2
	, dest_location => $3
	, dest_filename => $4
	, overwrite => FALSE
bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.FRENAME (
   src_location     IN   VARCHAR2,
   src_filename     IN   VARCHAR2, 
   dest_location    IN   VARCHAR2,
   dest_filename    IN   VARCHAR2,
   overwrite        IN   BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
descriptionText: This procedure renames an existing file to a new name, similar to the UNIX mv function.

name: utl_file.fseek
bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.FSEEK (
   file             IN OUT  UTL_FILE.FILE_TYPE,
   absolute_offset  IN      PL_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL,
   relative_offset  IN      PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure adjusts the file pointer forward or backward within the file by the number of bytes specified.

name: utl_file.get_line
bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.GET_LINE (
   file        IN  FILE_TYPE,
   buffer      OUT VARCHAR2,
   len         IN  PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure reads text from the open file identified by the file handle and places the text in the output buffer parameter. Text is read up to, but not including, the line terminator, or up to the end of the file, or up to the end of the len parameter. It cannot exceed the max_linesize specified in FOPEN.

name: utl_file.get_line_nchar
bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.GET_LINE_NCHAR (
   file        IN  FILE_TYPE,
   buffer      OUT NVARCHAR2,
   len         IN  PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure reads text from the open file identified by the file handle and places the text in the output buffer parameter. With this function, you can read a text file in Unicode instead of in the database character set.

name: utl_file.get_raw
bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.GET_RAW (
   file       IN            UTL_FILE.FILE_TYPE, 
   buffer     OUT NOCOPY    RAW, 
   len        IN            PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure reads a RAW string value from a file and adjusts the file pointer ahead by the number of bytes read. UTL_FILE.GET_RAW ignores line terminators.

name: utl_file.is_open
descriptionText: This function tests a file handle to see if it identifies an open file. IS_OPEN reports only whether a file handle represents a file that has been opened, but not yet closed. It does not guarantee that there will be no operating system errors when you attempt to use the file handle.

name: utl_file.new_line
descriptionText: This procedure writes one or more line terminators to the file identified by the input file handle. This procedure is separate from PUT because the line terminator is a platform-specific character or sequence of characters.

name: utl_file.put
descriptionText: PUT writes the text string stored in the buffer parameter to the open file identified by the file handle. The file must be open for write operations. No line terminator is appended by PUT; use NEW_LINE to terminate the line or use PUT_LINE to write a complete line with a line terminator. See also "PUT_NCHAR Procedure".

name: utl_file.put_line
bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.PUT_LINE (
   file      IN FILE_TYPE,
   buffer    IN VARCHAR2,
   autoflush IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
descriptionText: This procedure writes the text string stored in the buffer parameter to the open file identified by the file handle. The file must be open for write operations. PUT_LINE terminates the line with the platform-specific line terminator character or characters.

name: utl_file.put_line_nchar
descriptionText: This procedure writes the text string stored in the buffer parameter to the open file identified by the file handle. With this function, you can write a text file in Unicode instead of in the database character set. This procedure is equivalent to the PUT_NCHAR Procedure, except that the line separator is appended to the written text. See also PUT_LINE Procedure.

name: utl_file.put_nchar
descriptionText: This procedure writes the text string stored in the buffer parameter to the open file identified by the file handle.

name: utl_file.put_raw
bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.PUT_RAW (
   file          IN    UTL_FILE.FILE_TYPE,
   buffer        IN    RAW, 
   autoflush     IN    BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
descriptionText: This procedure accepts as input a RAW data value and writes the value to the output buffer.

name: utl_file.putf
bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.PUTF (
   file    IN FILE_TYPE,
   format  IN VARCHAR2,
   [arg1   IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   . . .  
   arg5    IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL]);
descriptionText: This procedure is a formatted PUT procedure. It works like a limited printf(). See also PUTF_NCHAR Procedure.

name: utl_file.putf_nchar
bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.PUTF_NCHAR (
   file    IN FILE_TYPE,
   format  IN NVARCHAR2,
   [arg1   IN NVARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   . . .  
   arg5    IN NVARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL]);
descriptionText: This procedure is a formatted version of a PUT_NCHAR Procedure. Using PUTF_NCHAR, you can write a text file in Unicode instead of in the database character set. It accepts a format string with formatting elements\\ and %s, and up to five arguments to be substituted for consecutive instances of %s in the format string. The expected datatype of the format string and the arguments is NVARCHAR2.

name: utl_http.add_cookies
descriptionText: This procedure adds the cookies either to a request context or to the UTL_HTTP packag\'s session state.

name: utl_http.assign_wallet_acl
descriptionText: Note:

name: utl_http.begin_request
body:
url => $1
	, method => 'GET'
	, http_version => NULL
	, request_context => NULL
bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.BEGIN_REQUEST (
   url               IN  VARCHAR2,
   method            IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'GET',
   http_version      IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   request_context   IN  request_context_key DEFAULT NULL)
RETURN req;
descriptionText: This functions begins a new HTTP request. UTL_HTTP establishes the network connection to the target Web server or the proxy server and sends the HTTP request line. The PL/SQL program continues the request by calling some other interface to complete the request. The URL may contain the username and password needed to authenticate the request to the server. The format is

name: utl_http.clear_cookies
bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.CLEAR_COOKIES (
   request_context  IN  request_context_key DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure clears all the cookies maintained either in a request context or in the UTL_HTTP packag\'s session state.

name: utl_http.close_persistent_conn
bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.CLOSE_PERSISTENT_CONN (
   conn  IN connection);
descriptionText: This procedure closes an HTTP persistent connection maintained by the UTL_HTTP package in the current database session.

name: utl_http.close_persistent_conns
body:
host => NULL
	, port => NULL
	, proxy_host => NULL
	, proxy_port => NULL
	, ssl => NULL
bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.CLOSE_PERSISTENT_CONNS (
   host        IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   port        IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL,
   proxy_host  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   proxy_port  IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL,
   ssl         IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT NULL);
descriptionText: This procedure closes a group of HTTP persistent connections maintained by the UTL_HTTP package in the current database session. This procedure uses a pattern-match approach to decide which persistent connections to close.

name: utl_http.create_request_context
body:
wallet_path => NULL
	, wallet_password => NULL
	, enable_cookies => TRUE
	, max_cookies => 300
	, max_cookies_per_site => 20
bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.CREATE_REQUEST_CONTEXT (
 wallet_path          IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
 wallet_password      IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
 enable_cookies       IN BOOLEAN  DEFAULT TRUE,
 max_cookies          IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT 300,
 max_cookies_per_site IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT 20)
RETURN request_context_key;
descriptionText: This function creates a request context. A request context is a context that holds a wallet and a cookie for private use in making a HTTP request. This allows the HTTP request to use a wallet and a cookie table that will not be shared with other applications making HTTP requests in the same database session.

name: utl_http.destroy_request_context
bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.DESTROY_REQUEST_CONTEXT (
   request_context    request_context_key);
descriptionText: This procedure destroys a request context in UTL_HTTP. A request context cannot be destroyed when it is in use by a HTTP request or response.

name: utl_http.end_request
bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.END_REQUEST (
   r  IN OUT NOCOPY req);
descriptionText: This procedure ends the HTTP request. To terminate the HTTP request without completing the request and waiting for the response, the program can call this procedure. Otherwise, the program should go through the normal sequence of beginning a request, getting the response, and closing the response. The network connection will always be closed and will not be reused.

name: utl_http.end_response
bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.END_RESPONSE (
   r  IN OUT NOCOPY resp);
descriptionText: This procedure ends the HTTP response. It completes the HTTP request and response. Unless HTTP 1.1 persistent connection is used in this request, the network connection is also closed.

name: utl_http.get_authentication
bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.GET_AUTHENTICATION(
   r          IN OUT NOCOPY resp,
   scheme     OUT VARCHAR2,
   realm      OUT VARCHAR2,
   for_proxy  IN BOOLEAN  DEFAULT FALSE);
descriptionText: This procedure retrieves the HTTP authentication information needed for the request to be accepted by the Web server as indicated in the HTTP response header.

name: utl_http.get_body_charset
bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.GET_BODY_CHARSET (
   charset  OUT NOCOPY VARCHAR2);
descriptionText: This procedure retrieves the default character set of the body of all future HTTP requests.

name: utl_http.get_cookie_count

name: utl_http.get_cookie_support

UTL_HTTP.GET_COOKIE_SUPPORT (

name: utl_http.get_cookies

name: utl_http.get_detailed_excp_support
bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.GET_DETAILED_EXCP_SUPPORT (

name: utl_http.get_detailed_sqlcode

UTL_HTTP.GET_DETAILED_SQLCODE 
RETURN PLS_INTEGER;

name: utl_http.get_detailed_sqlerrm

UTL_HTTP.GET_DETAILED_SQLERRM

UTL_HTTP.GET_FOLLOW_REDIRECT (

name: utl_http.get_header_by_name

UTL_HTTP.GET_HEADER_BY_NAME(

name: utl_http.get_header_count
